story:
IT'S TIME!!!

We've been out performing hundreds of live shows around the Pacific Northwest, but now after a few years we're finally making time to get back in the studio. We're going to record a few fan-favourite songs, including 'Mexico', 'Kumbaya Supernova', 'Madman', a couple of new tunes, and more! We enjoy folks singing along to these songs at shows, but it's time we made them available for you to take home also.

What We Have: Songs and Musicians

Phil Hirschi (cello), Oliver Dye (drums), Mary Ann Miller (vocals), Cory Cavazos (bass), Saint John (guitar, vocals), plus many special guests including some internationally known stars and some of our super-talented friends from the Seattle music scene. This album is going to be pretty rad. 

What We Need: Studio Time and Manufacturing

This is the part where we need funding to get this record made, we'll be recording and creating copies as economically as we can, but studio time and engineers still need to be paid. Your help will ensure that we can get the musicians and songs into the studio and then copies of them out into the world and into your ears. 

Thank You!

Music is still made because of folks like you, without your contribution we wouldn't be able to make this record. Please share this campaign if you have some like-minded friends that might also want to be a part of it. Thank you!

 

Much love,

Saint John and the Revelations

story: We are youth musicians trying to make a difference with music. We are attempting to save funds for our music needs and to buy equipment we need at that moment. We will use the proceeds coming from here to help with our drums, and guitars, as well as microphones and cables. Donations of $10 and more will be rewarded with a CD, t-shirt, or sticker. Please comment your t-shirt size. Thank you and have a good day.

story:
Our Story

What happens when two creative gals from Monmouth, Maine get together? COLORS Creative Arts! Growing up in a small town in Maine, Amy Arsenault and Bethany Perkins both discovered their passion for the ARTS at a very young age. Amy was always attracted to all things colorful, was inspired by the beauty of nature that surrounded her, and the smell of a brand new box of oil pastels.  Bethany grew up in a musical household, as her parents were both musicians and teachers of music.  With her talented mom by her side, Bethany began playing the piano at 4 years old.  Amy and Bethany grew up with the famous Cumston Hall down the road, home of the Shakepearean Theater of Monmouth, where both performed in plays throughout their childhood. 

Not only are Amy and Bethany passionate about creating their art, but they are driven to share their gift to others of all ages and abilities. Both believe in the rejuvenating qualities of the arts.  Art and Music are deeply connected to feeling and meaning, and when expressed, they have the ability to open up the mind to the joys of the human spirit. Marc Chagall said it well, "Color is everything, Color is vibration like music; Everything is vibration."  Their goal with COLORS Creative Arts, is to create a community through creativity; one they certainly would have thrived in growing up.  COLORS is a space where classes can be held inside or outside, and is nestled by Portland's Back Cove, a perfect location for inspiration and connecting with nature within this small city. Now we are also offering massage therapy!

With help from contributors to our campaign, we will be able to get a head start financially.  Offering sessions in music, visual arts, yoga, massage, and dance, there is something for almost everyone who wants to open their minds to creativity. With a successful campaign, we will be able to provide an exciting, creative environment to everyone who enters our studio.  We are thankful to have the sunshine of happy energy and talents from Nicole Mokeme, who assists in art classes, hosts events for teens, and teaches creative movement classes.  Also, the positive and peaceful yoga teacher, Hayley Brennan, will soon be offering classes in yoga, meditation, and mindfulness. Kirk Underwood will be our resident massage therapist. Our dream of creating a creative community has already started, but with a little financial help we will be able to offer the best Arts programming possible.


What We Need & What You Get

More Details:

  • We are asking for $6,500 to help with the start up costs that come with opening a small business. This money will help with materials, rent, and bills until we are able to build and be self sustaining!
  • Every contribution is directly linked to an exciting perk.  Most of our perks are designed for you to receive classes, and/or artwork in a fair exchange for your contribution. Visit ColorsCreativeArts.com
  • Thank you so much for considering to contribute to our creative community.  Please help us spread the word!


Other Ways You Can Help 

Want to help but are unable to give?

  • Help us get the word out by telling your friends!
  • Share on facebook!
  • Also please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hello!

Thanks for your interest in my project! In short, I am recording and releasing a limited-run tape cassette and digital download ep of new material, titled "Summer Flight (Lasts Forever)".  To help fund a trip to teach, learn, and guide workshops in remote northern schools, and record new work and perform in the Northern Yukon, I am offering advance sales of the cassette, which will be delivered with digital download codes of the recordings, as well as other goodies, for contributors to this campaign. The remainder of the tapes will be for sale on my cross-Canadian tour.

 

The Project

This winter, I am embarking on a Canadian tour, ending with a trip to the Yukon Territory. While in the Yukon, I will be doing artist talks as well as collaborative songwriting workshops with students at Chief Zzeh Gittlit School In Old Crow, and Robert Service Secondary in Dawson City. Chief Zzeh Gittlit School is the furthest north of Yukon schools. It is located in Old Crow, the home of the Vuntut Gwich’in, which is the only fly-in community in the Yukon. Old Crow is located north of the Arctic Circle on the bank of the Porcupine River near the junction of the Old Crow River and the Porcupine. Robert Service is located in Dawson City, on the traditional Territory of the Tr’ondëk Hwëch’in. I am privileged to be an invited guest of these communities, and I travel there with humility, gratitude, and an enthusiasm to learn, in turn, from the students and their communities.

Following this trip to the subarctic, I will be returning to Whitehorse to record new material with my friend and esteemed producer, Jordy Walker. Joining me will be my close collaborator, Liam Cole. The three of us will be collaborating on new recorded work with Yukon-based artists.

Specifically for this tour, I am releasing a limited-run tape cassette featuring three songs:

  • An extended version of a new arrangement for my song "Summer Fights". Another full-band version will appear on my forthcoming album 'The Winter of our Discotheque'.
  • An alternative version of my forthcoming single "Candy Store", in its original folk-orientated form.
  • A brand new song "Saint Maybe (Quid Pro Quo)". An alternative, full-band version of this will be recorded by producer Jordy Walker while I am in Whitehorse.

 

The Subarctic is very far away and quite complicated to get to from Ontario. I am recording and releasing this limited-run cassette in an effort to help fund this month-long experience.

What You Get

I am raising $4,500 to contribute to some of the costs associated with this trip and the production of this tape. Contributors will receive:

  • A numbered copy (1-150) of the limited release cassette, featuring original artwork by a very special visual artist TBA
  • A digital download code for the cassette
  • A digital download code for my forthcoming single "Candy Store", via Bandcamp.
  • A letter, handwritten in the Yukon, on the back of a print of original artwork by a very special TBA visual artist.
  • A "Summer Fights Last Forever" button.

Any additional tapes not purchased through this campaign will be available for sale at my performances in the Yukon, and a further run of copies will be given to students and families at the school for free. If the campaign covers the costs of the trip and production, the remainder of the funds will be donated to the schools.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help. I would love for this campaign to be shared far and wide. Feel free to share on social media channels, and tag me! @michaelcduguay

story:
Overview

Reminding ourselves and everyone around us of the magic that is surrounding us all. With this intention in our hearts and minds we have embarked on a mission to release our first joint album, ‘REMIND ME OF THE MAGIC’.

And it is thanks to you that we can make this mission a reality. Thanks to you we can spread the magic of music and share what we believe in – emotions that go beyond words, connections impossible to describe with language and magical coincidences hard to believe to be real.
Thank you for supporting us and believing in us, we are so grateful for it!
 

Who are we?

We are Marketa (Czech Republic) and Lea (Germany), and together, we are the handpan duo MEA. MEA is our music project combining the sounds of handpans with other instruments. Playing with subtle melodies, expressive rhythms and the sounds of nature, MEA takes you on a musical journey and invites you to close their eyes and fly. 

MEA is music from the heart.
To make our souls sing
To bring peace to the mind
To connect to ourselves
To live the emotion of every moment
To dive into sound and vibrations
And to share our love and light.

What do we aim for with this campaign?

In the past months, we have embarked on a mission, to record an album that will remind ourselves and all of you about the magic found within every one of us and everything around us. With this campaign, we want to give this album the form it deserves – a proper mixing and mastering that will sooth our ears and a beautiful artwork that will light a sparkle in our eyes. We also wish to press our CDs so everyone can have a token of our music outside of the digital realm.
All this we will do in collaboration with amazing artists, sound engineers, handpan makers and talented human beings that we are so happy to have in our lives. And above all, in collaboration with you, who listen to our music and spread the magic of music and life wherever you go.

How can you support us?

Share this campaign, the more people, the more magic!
Follow us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/meahandpan/), Instagram (mea.handpan)
or sign up for newsletter on our website (https://meahandpan.com).
Contribute to this campaign, pre-order our cd and get some of the perks we prepared for you.
And spread magic wherever you go!
Thank you.

What do we need your support for?

Your support, in any form, is a precious piece of magic for us. Knowing that you are there, sharing the passion for music with us, makes us very grateful.
With the money raised in this campaign, we will cover the costs for mixing and mastering of our music (600 €), artwork (150 €), CD pressing and distribution (1000 €) and we will also need to ship of all the perks we prepared for you (100 €). On top of all that, indiegogo and processing of the payments amount to around 10% of what we crowdfund.
All together we need 2000 €, and with this goal, we throw ourselves in this digital space where we know we can find people who believe in the same kind of magic as we do. If we collect more, we will be able to cover our costs for the cd production too, press more CDs and advertise our album better. We will also do a really cool video clip for one of our album’s tracks.


When will all this be done?

For Christmas!
The campaign will run until December 24 th and we want to celebrate this year Christmas with you, reminding us that magical times can last the whole year, as long as we spend them with people we love, doing things that matter to us and staying true to ourselves.

A lot has already been created, we recorded our songs, some of them have been mixed and
pre-mastered and we already teamed up with Sohpie Bx who created the artwork for the
album.

As soon as we receive our album from the pressing company (at the end of this year), they will be ready to be shipped to you. We will make sure that everything is shipped in January 2020. Hanpdan classes can be scheduled anytime, we will find a date and time that suit all of us. Concerts, workshops will be ‘delivered’ after we come back to Europe recharged with new
energy and ideas at the end of March 2020. We will get in touch with each of you
individually to schedule the time that is best for all of us.

Eh, have you read through all the text until here? That already means a lot, thank you!

With gratitude and love,
Marketa and Lea

story:
Campaign Summary

 

We are a group of determined students from The University of Tennessee Knoxville that are working with the local nonprofit, The Joy of Music School, to help them raise money to make their upcoming May recital a success. The goal of this campaign is to raise $2,000 to replace all 278 damaged instrument strings in order for the young, at-risk students of The School to perform effectively.

 

These needed instrument strings vary in price in respect to the instrument, but the average string costs roughly $10.

 

Since the students at this organization are not in the financial state to purchase their own instruments, let alone replace the damaged strings, The Joy of Music School is actively seeking help to make each child’s dreams a reality.

 

As a community, we need to come together to ensure that every deserving child in Knoxville and the surrounding community has the best opportunity to succeed and the chance to create the joyful sounds of music this Spring season.

 

Any size donation will allow The School to string together the best May recital yet!

 

The Organization As A Whole

Beginning operations in 1998, The Joy of Music School is a local, nonprofit organization that provides an enriched music education for disadvantaged, at-risk children in the Knoxville community and surrounding area. In the hopes of broadening opportunities, free music lessons taught by volunteers and free musical instruments are offered. It is this organization’s goal to encourage and support each child to reach their highest potential on and off the stage.  
 

What We Need

 

According to City-data.com, the median household income in Knoxville is $13,000 below the Tennessee state median. This creates a large amount of potentially at-risk children who may not have access to the same privileges as others, such as music education.

 

In order for these young children to learn and gain further musical skills and techniques, The School needs to raise funds to replace the broken, worn down instrument strings.

 

Any sign of support would be greatly appreciated by The School and the artistic students.

 

Impact on Community

 

The Joy of Music School teaches and motivates more than 200 local, disadvantaged children at their on-site location. In addition to those students though, The School also motivates and supports another 700 to 1,000 children enrolled in outreach programs such as The Emerald Youth Foundation, Boys & Girls Club, and The Urban Family Outreach. Volunteer teachers provide group music classes to these after-school sites with the goal of inspiring them artistically and developing their skills musically.  

 

Success Story

 

Though every student at The Joy of Music School gain additional musical opportunities that they would not have had before, Taber Gable was a child who stood out.

 

To read about Taber Gable’s journey in becoming a Jazz Graduate Student at Juilliard School, click on the following link: https://joyofmusicschool.wordpress.com/2014/05/...

 

Hear From The Staff and Students:

 

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCTp1ixHpinhy0W...

story:
Our Story

Inspired by the music of John Zorn, the AACM, Ornette Coleman, Dave Douglas, Sex Mob, and Duke Ellington, the band plays original music and not-so-standards that will keep you listening, thinking and on your toes. 

Formed in 2010, the Craig Pedersen Quartet features four of the hardest working creative musicians in Ottawa and Montreal.   All working musicians, and individually fluent in a variety of styles, we come together under Craig Pedersen’s leadership to make music that walks the distance between approachable and challenging music.

2011 has been a busy year for the band, beginning with the recording and release of the EP Early Winter, which was featured in it’s entirety on both CITR Vancouver’s The Rib Podcast and CISM Montreal’s 12” Dans le Jazz Podcast, along with having the title track included nationally on CBC radio 2’s The Signal podcast with Laurie Brown in February.  

Most recently, the Quartet was chosen by the Ottawa Jazz Festival to open for Jerry Granelli in October.  We performed this summer at the 2011 TD Ottawa International Jazz Festival and with upcoming performances in Toronto, Ottawa, Montreal and Quebec City, the band is slowly gaining recognition and popularity.  


We are:

Craig Pedersen - trumpet/compositions
Linsey Wellman - saxophone
Joel Kerr - double bass
Mike Essoudry - drums


The Impact 

We love sharing our music with you.  The more we perform and share, the better the band gets, and thus the more opportunities to perform and share we have.  It is our hope that with this release will come more performance and recording opportunities.  With your support, this release will help us apply for festivals, shows and grants across the country, and will foster our continued growth thus creating more opportunities to make live and recorded music for YOU. 


Our Budget:

Records are costly affairs.  They're also big investments.  The challenge for independent artists like ourselves is the investment.  When a record costs $2500 to make (which, is on the exceptionally cheap side), an artist is expected that can pay that out of pocket until they can recoup costs in sales, which can take quite a while.  It's our hope that with your help, we can offset the time-line a little bit, and recoup some of the costs before the record officially goes on sale.  Please notice that we are not asking for our supporters to cover all our costs.  We're hoping that through album pre-sales and sponsorships we can cover the cost of manufacturing.  We know the rest is our responsibility.

So, here's the deal.  I don't think that it's reasonable or fair to ask for to fund the CD without an understanding of my business plan and budget.  Here is my basic budget:

Recording/mixing with Matt Ouimet at Resonator Studios: $600
Mastering with Phil Bova at Bova Sound: $600
Manufacturing Costs: $1000
Liner notes, buttons and promotion: $300

Total: $2500


The Perks!

As you can see in the video, we're really pouring our ideas into making this CD available at a variety of income levels. 

Jewel Case CD:

We know that for many of us, $20 seems out of our budget for a CD.  That's why we're offering a bare-bones, liner-note free, $10 CD only package.  It saves on our costs to be able to offer a CD this way, and helps us get our music into your hands affordably.  The album art will be done by David Bosschaart.

One-inch Buttons:

Designed by Morel McMaster, we've got wonderful one-inch buttons, featuring Craig's iconic glasses and moustache! $15 for the CD + 2 buttons

The Mini-booklet liner notes:

We're very excited about the mini-booklet.  Craig has hand-written all-new special edition versions of the sheet music from the record, which look beautiful when shrunken down to a quarter of the size, and made into a booklet.  On each facing page you'll find hand written liner notes about the compositions, and in the back a section dedicated to thank-you's for the supporters.  $20 for the CD + the mini-booklet

CD release tickets:

The CD release is slated to happen on November 29th at Club Saw in Ottawa. Add $10 to any of the packages and get 1 ticket to the concert.  You can pick your CDs up at the release.


Become a friend, supporter or sponsor:

Become a friend, supporter or sponsor of the Craig Pedersen Quartet and receive a CD, the booklet, the buttons, a CD release ticket and see your name listed along with others in the liner notes, and a digital download of the album and booklet.  


Other Ways You Can Help:

Want to put up posters for the CD release?  I'll give you a CD, booklet, buttons, a ticket, AND put you in the Friends section of the liner notes.


Join the mailing list: http://eepurl.com/fLGJQ
Share our youtube videos: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TfBnkuqx96M

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W3fg-RBK5qI


Like us on facebook: http://www.facebook.com/CraigPedersenQuartet
story_txt:
Our Story


Inspired by the music of John Zorn, the AACM, Ornette Coleman, Dave Douglas, Sex Mob, and Duke Ellington, the band plays original music and not-so-standards that will keep you listening, thinking and on your toes. 
Formed in 2010, the Craig Pedersen Quartet features four of the hardest working creative musicians in Ottawa and Montreal.   All working musicians, and individually fluent in a variety of styles, we come together under Craig Pedersen’s leadership to make music that walks the distance between approachable and challenging music.
2011 has been a busy year for the band, beginning with the recording and release of the EP Early Winter, which was featured in it’s entirety on both CITR Vancouver’s The Rib Podcast and CISM Montreal’s 12” Dans le Jazz Podcast, along with having the title track included nationally on CBC radio 2’s The Signal podcast with Laurie Brown in February.  
Most recently, the Quartet was chosen by the Ottawa Jazz Festival to open for Jerry Granelli in October.  We performed this summer at the 2011 TD Ottawa International Jazz Festival and with upcoming performances in Toronto, Ottawa, Montreal and Quebec City, the band is slowly gaining recognition and popularity.  

We are:
Craig Pedersen - trumpet/compositions
Linsey Wellman - saxophone
Joel Kerr - double bass
Mike Essoudry - drums




The Impact 


We love sharing our music with you.  The more we perform and share, the better the band gets, and thus the more opportunities to perform and share we have.  It is our hope that with this release will come more performance and recording opportunities.  With your support, this release will help us apply for festivals, shows and grants across the country, and will foster our continued growth thus creating more opportunities to make live and recorded music for YOU.

Join the mailing list: http://eepurl.com/fLGJQ










Share our youtube videos: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TfBnkuqx96M

story:
Dear Earthlings,

Firstly, I have to say I love all of you so much for visiting this page!

I am in great need of some funds to in order to release my debut CD. The songs have been recorded, mixed and the CD release party has been booked. I need money for CD pressing, mastering, artwork and if I have money left over I will use it for promotion. Exciting, no?!!!! 

Let me tell you a little about myself…

I am a songwriter and multi-instrumental folk musician from Ottawa, Ontario. On stage I go by the name Erin Saoirse Adair, which reflects my Irish and Scots heritage and the influence of these folkloric traditions in my music (and my extensive and formative travels in Celtic Western Europe); my music and lyrics are therefore an extension of not only my ancestry but also my travels and life experiences. As an artist I strive to see beauty in ugly situations. My work focuses on polyphony (in the general sense) through the complexity of experience in the Canadian urban setting. Through my lyrical narratives I explore notions of brokenness, loss of place (and rediscovering a sense of it), and despair, especially via the tropes of urban decay, youthful alienation, addiction, and poverty. I offer many of my own experiences; having been at times homeless, suicidal, abused and abusive, and after an arduous struggle with addiction, my own stories add strength to my chosen themes. I am inspired by the suffering and redemption described by poets such as Seamus Heaney, Leonard Cohen, and Sylvia Plath. With these guides, I pursue my art in order to lend without shame my stories to the polyphony that surrounds me.

With the help of a creation grant from Canada Council for the Arts, over the past year I have been earnestly writing, polishing, and performing new songs and with the help of funding from Ontario Arts Council and the City of Ottawa I have been able to record these songs, hire session musicians, and finish the mixing process. I have spent all of my money trying to create music that is to my liking. I need your help to fund the mastering and pressing of my CD! Without your help, my music will be held hostage by my computer and will never be free in the physical world!

You can sample my recordings (so far) by visting my (kinda crappy, I need money for that too) website at www.erinsaoirseadair.com. If you send me an email, I can send you an mp3 file of my new single "Drunken Cliche" or "No Confusion" so you can put it on your iPod before the CD release! My email is is erinsaoirseadair.music@gmail.com

HERE IS MY BUDGET 

Music video production

(for Dirty Water) Expected cost: $1,284

Production will be by Craig Conoley of Partus Films. The video for this campaign is a video we already made together.

Merchandise

Expected cost: $3,000

This will include 1,000 CDs, artwork and design

Website design

Expected cost: $500

Mastering with Bova Sound

Expected cost: $500

TOTAL: 5,284

Even if you can’t help out financially, you can share my Indie-gogo campaign facebook, twitter, or any other means you have to get the word out! Make some noise!!!! If you spread it around a lot (enough for me to take notice), I will send you a free CD and other awesome perks!

The Perks! 

What you will get with your contributions.

If you donate...

$5 – You will receive a digital download of the album

$12 – You will receive a CD with a three dollar Indie-gogo discount! Once it’s released it will be $15.

$20- You will receive a SIGNED copy of the CD and a free button!

$30- You will receive a signed poster, signed copy of the CD, and five free buttons.

$75– You will receive a one hour ukulele, guitar or songwriting lesson. If you don’t live in Ottawa, we can do it over skype!

$200 –  You will receive five signed copies of the CD, a free button, a signed poster, and a one hour ukulele lesson. If you’re not in Ottawa, we can do it over skype!

$300- Your name will appear in the “thank yous” on the album, as well as you will receive 5 signed CDs, a signed poster and free button. I will also record and make a video of a song of your choice.

$500- Your name will appear in the “thank yous” on the album, as well as you will receive 10 signed copies of the CD, a signed poster and I will send you 3 tracks of your choosing one month before the release date.

1000- A free house concert. Travel and accommodation must be paid for if you live outside of Ottawa. In this house concert, I will play 3 songs of your choosing, and two 30 minute sets. You will also receive 10 signed copies of the CD, a signed poster, and as many buttons as you want. YOU ALSO GET A FREE HUG. You will also be mentioned in the thank yous.

1500- I will write you a song about anything you want, record it on my macbook, and make you a video! You will also receive a free house concert, 10 cds, as many buttons as you want, and a FREE HUG!!!! You will also be mentioned in the thank yous.

story:
Who We Are & What We're Doing

Hello there!

We are thrilled and honestly overwhelmed that you've stopped by and are considering supporting our journey. Words can't express what that means to us and we hope that you'll be a part of what God is doing (and will do) through our music. 

In creating the Like The Wind project we (Ben and Leah) are making a decision to take the leap of faith that has beckoned us for nearly five years of our lives and ministry. It's by your support and the grace and provision of Jesus that we'll be able to step out onto the waves and make an acoustic, organic, inspired, Spirit-led piece of musical and visual art (made up of four original worship songs) which thoroughly represents our heart and the type of worship movement we'd be honored to carry and share across the world. Having said that, we could make all sorts of grand gestures about the future but the truth is this: we don't have everything mapped out, nor do we have it all together. We are simply following where the Spirit takes us, one step at a time. For us, this is that "next step".  No matter what is to come, our hearts are to see the Kingdom of God invade earth, and not just from the sidelines. We want it to be up-close and personal. Not merely Jesus living in us but us, living in Jesus.

This live worship EP is the genesis of a grand adventure... Join hands with us as we walk in the fullness of Jesus and see where we end up!

What We Need & What You Get

The amount we are trying to raise may seem outrageous to some, but we truly desire to make something beautiful, worthwhile, extraordinary. Not only that but we want to be able to take care of the musicians, videographers, photographers, technicians, engineers and everyone who has a hand in this project. We want you to feel comfortable and at ease, knowing that your hard-earned dollar is going toward artwork made with integrity and excellence. Here is a list of the costs that go into creating this type of product (and please keep in mind that even with this seemingly large budget we have been blessed with amazing deals and cost breaks, thanks to Jesus and some really generous, talented folks!) (Yeah, it's that expensive to make a good project!) (Sick, we know.):

  • Videography - $2,000
  • Recording (Studio/Musicians/Audio Engineer/Mastering) - $3,000
  • Artwork/Photography - $2,000
  • CD's (hard copies) - $1,000
  • Marketing - $1,000
  • Misc. (emergencies, oversights, etc.) - $1,000

Remember that every penny makes an impact! Also, check out our perks and prizes. We appreciate your gift so much and we want to sweeten the deal as much as possible! And no matter your ability to support at this time (whether it be a lot, a little, or none at all) the fact that you've taken the time to look over this page means the world to us. Please pray for us and keep up with what we're doing-- your spiritual partnership is of the utmost importance! 

Where We're Going & How You're Helping

As we said before, we're not interested in talking a big game or making crazy plans to further ourselves. As a young married couple and new parents we feel that we are at the most beautiful crossroad in life; we have the unique opportunity to forsake the striving that this world impresses upon us and leave behind the harsh taskmaster that is the "American Dream" and instead live out the call of Jesus, as commanded in Matthew 28:16-20. We want our hearts to be singularly focused on serving God. We want our child(ren) to be raised up seeing Jesus move in power, inside and outside of the four walls of "church". We've tried the approach of asking God to bless us where we are... and He is so good, so faithful and He does work all things together for the good of those who love Him and are called according to His purposes (Romans 8:28) and we are beyond grateful for that! However, what we desire more than anything is to forget about what we have planned--what we could dream up--because we have confidence in the promise that what He has is just better. 

We have nothing holding us back. Nothing separating us from walking in His perfect will! How exciting!

We understand that not everyone is in this season, has this opportunity, etc. which is why we would love for you to be a part of our team and support what Jesus is doing in our lives. We want you to be our partners, our prayer covering, our family, and for you to feel equally blessed by the partnership. Please consider what your role in this ministry can be!

Thank you, thank you, thank you! This is our prayer for you:

Sweet Savior, bless the hearts behind the computer screens in this very moment. You transcend time and space. You are better than anything we can ask or imagine. Thank you for placing people along our path who are filled with the desire to give their time, efforts and financial gifts toward the furthering of Your Glory! We long to see revival, however that looks. In our own spirits, in our churches, in our nations. Help us to make Your reality our reality! God, we ask with our whole hearts that you would invade our lives, turn our world upside down, help us to cast aside our yearning for the satisfactions of this earth. Let us fix our eyes on You! Maker, Creator, King, Author, Lover of our Souls. We are no longer interested in seeing You join us, but rather in us joining You! Thank you for allowing us to see You and to worship You fully, in spirit and in truth. Oh Jesus, we as you to take us where You're going!

Amen.


I remain confident of this: 

I will see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living.

(Psalm 27:13)

Sharing is Caring 

We'd be honored if you'd share about this project, our story, the funding needed, etc. with your friends, family and social media following! In doing so you are making an impact and we appreciate that more than you know! Cause ya know... sharing is caring... Aaaw! Presh. <3 (<-- *That was Leah.)


;) (<-- *so was that.)

story:
ABOUT US:

Timmy Findlen is a ukulele player based in Nashville, Tennessee.  He is the former bandleader of Over A Cardboard Sea: Portland, Maine’s premier ukulele novelty act. When in Maine, he plays in The Vododeyos, a ukulele duo with Joel Eckhaus, with whom he also builds and repairs ukuleles.  He also likes ukuleles.  He currently plays electric bass with the honky tonk group J.P. Harris & The Tough Choices.  See his work with Over A Cardboard Sea.

Lindsay McCaw has been playing American old time music for over 15 years. She performs music and calls dances around the country.  McCaw plays fiddle, banjo, guitar, accordion and piano.  She is also part of several theater and puppet companies, including her own, called The Dolly Wagglers.  She has won several musical distinctions such as two-time winner of the Minneapolis Jug Band Contest and four-time first-place winner of the Sheffield Field Days Fiddle contest. See her work with the Dolly Wagglers and The Corn Potato String Band

Matt Bell is a guitarist from New Orleans, where he is the bandleader and arranger for Bustout Burlesque, a troupe that recreates 1950’s style nightclub entertainment at the House of Blues.  In 2012, he received a Master’s Degree in Jazz Studies from The University of New Orleans, and he now works exclusively as a musician and teacher of the guitar and lap steel.  Learn about Bustout Burlesque.

Aaron Jonah Lewis is a multi-instrumentalist, performer and educator. He has won awards at the Clifftop Appalachian String Band Festival, including First Place Neotraditional Band in 2008, and at the Galax Old Fiddlers Convention, including First Place Bluegrass Fiddle in 2007, and he has performed at major festivals from the US to the UK and from Italy to Finland. Lewis has appeared on dozens of recordings from bluegrass and old time to swing jazz, modern experimental and Turkish classical music projects. He has taught workshops at the Royal Scottish Academy of Music and Drama in Glasgow and at the English Folk Dance and Song Society in London. He also plays and teaches banjo, mandolin, guitar, and bass and is currently based in Detroit, Michigan.  Go to his Website.

Joy Patterson is an Artist, Musician, Foley Artist, Clown and Mr. T impersonator living and working in New Orleans.  Her mastery of the kazoo and washboard are rumored to exist, and her fashion sense impresses the world via her Etsy Store.

Martin Fisher is the Curator of Recorded Media Collections at The Center For Popular Music at Middle Tennessee State University.  He has a B.S. in Broadcast Communications with a minor in Music from the University of Tennessee.  His work includes preserving, maintaining and augmenting the Center's sound recordings collection, assisting researchers in locating and obtaining copies of recordings, and conducting acoustical wax cylinder recording demonstrations as part of the Center's outreach program.

WHAT WE ARE DOING:

“From the first recordings made on tinfoil in 1877 to the last produced on celluloid in 1929, cylinders spanned a half-century of technological development in sound recording.  As documents of American cultural history and musical style, cylinders serve as an audible witness to the sounds and songs through which typical audiences first encountered the recorded human voice. And for those living at the turn of the 20th century, the most likely source of recorded sound on cylinders would have been Thomas Alva Edison's crowning achievement, the phonograph.”

--Cylinder Preservation and Digitization Project; Donald C. Davidson Library, University of California at Santa Barbara

Our mission, and our passion, is to perform the weirdest songs from the early days of tin pan alley on the format on which they were first recorded--wax cylinder.  Since there are very few people in the world that can accommodate such a desire, we are forced to congregate in the vicinity of one Martin Fisher, who has expertise in this field.  Acoustic microphones are odd contraptions when compared to today's hi-fi recording innovations. Take, for instance, how Mr. Fisher directs a band--not with headphones and the careful placement of a microphone, but with a doctor's stethoscope applied to a felt-lined horn.  We move around the room as he listens, following directions such as, "Back up two feet, and sing louder--did I say sing?--I mean shout!"  

We all share a love of antiquated pop tunes, and we are asking for a chance to record them in the only medium that does them justice.  These old songs give a voice to a bygone era and reflect the attitudes of their time, and no matter how silly they seem they are historical documents of their time.  We aim to mine the zaniest and most obscure songs from the early 20th century and record them for a new audience to underscore both the absurdity and importance of popular music in American history.  


OUR BUDGET:

Our budget includes $400 for each member to help with travel expenses to and from Nashville, with funds for plenty of wax cylinder blanks (on order from England), studio time, rehearsal space (and a place to sleep), and supplies for artwork and the packaging of the recordings.

Travel Expenses (for 5):  $2000

Wax Cylinder Blanks (25):  $500

Studio Time:  $500

Album Artwork:  $500

Rehearsal Space / Rent:  $400

Photography (Tintype): $100

TOTAL:  $4000

If we do not reach our goal, we're going to do it anyway.  It will hurt us quite a bit in the old pocketbook, and might take another year to finish, but we believe in this project enough to the point where we'll make it happen no matter what!  However, If some of you feel like bringing the donations above our goal, we will use the money to help fund a tour in which we perform these songs live!  Since we are all professional musicians, we are always busy and always broke.  Any extra money would allow us to plan a series of performances to showcase our take on the numbers of yesteryear.  Thank you to all of our family and friends!  We appreciate your support!
story_txt:
ABOUT US:
Timmy Findlen is a ukulele player based in Nashville,
Tennessee.  He is the former bandleader
of Over A Cardboard Sea: Portland, Maine’s premier ukulele novelty act. When in Maine, he plays in The Vododeyos, a ukulele duo with
Joel Eckhaus, with whom he also builds and repairs ukuleles.  He also likes ukuleles.  He currently plays electric bass with the
honky tonk group J.P. Harris & The Tough Choices.  See his work with Over A
Cardboard Sea.
Lindsay McCaw has been playing American old time music for over 15 years. She performs music and calls dances around the country.  McCaw plays fiddle, banjo, guitar, accordion and piano.  She is also part of several theater and puppet companies, including her own, called The Dolly Wagglers.  She has won several musical distinctions such as two-time winner of the Minneapolis Jug Band Contest and four-time first-place winner of the Sheffield Field Days Fiddle contest. See her work with the Dolly Wagglers and The Corn Potato String Band
Matt Bell is a guitarist from New Orleans, where he is the
bandleader and arranger for Bustout Burlesque, a troupe that recreates 1950’s
style nightclub entertainment at the House of Blues.  In 2012, he received a Master’s Degree in
Jazz Studies from The University of New Orleans, and he now works exclusively
as a musician and teacher of the guitar and lap steel.  Learn about Bustout
Burlesque.
Aaron Jonah Lewis is a
multi-instrumentalist, performer and educator. He has won awards at the
Clifftop Appalachian String Band Festival, including First Place Neotraditional
Band in 2008, and at the Galax Old Fiddlers Convention, including First Place
Bluegrass Fiddle in 2007, and he has performed at major festivals from the US
to the UK and from Italy to Finland. Lewis has appeared on dozens of recordings
from bluegrass and old time to swing jazz, modern experimental and Turkish
classical music projects. He has taught workshops at the Royal Scottish Academy
of Music and Drama in Glasgow and at the English Folk Dance and Song Society in

story:
ALL CONTRIBUTIONS ALSO INCLUDE TICKETS TO OUR OPENNING TWO DAY INDEPENDENT BAND FESTIVAL BEING HELD IN SEPT. 2015

PLEASE READ UPDATES

 by clicking on the

 UPDATE link above

 

Short Summary

Our Song:

We are Mid-Michigan Music Theater (Bob Jordan and Cheryl McCullough) and we are passionate about music. During the summer of 2014 we will be breaking ground on the Mid-Michigan Music Theater, a 15,000 seat outdoor amphitheater in the Lansing area. This has been a dream of ours for many years.  Bob has over 25 years in the music business working with country, contemporary Christian, rock & pop groups.  After too many years on the road on a bus he is ready to be close to home, but still in the music business.

Where we are now:

We have the property (100 acres), conceptual drawings, website, Facebook and Twitter pages, and investors.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to go through the permit process with MDOT, The State of Michigan, the county, the township, the Board of Health and others. We need to have the engineering studies done on the land. We need to prepare the business plan to present to the investors. We need the lawyers to cross all the “T’s” and “Dot” all the “I’s”. Just based on the response we have gotten on Facebook, the investors are already fighting over who gets to be involved!

What will your verse be?

With your support we can make this happen. We are very excited about the opportunity to bring LARGE live concerts to the Lansing area.

What do you receive for your contribution?  Plenty!! We have many awesome perks available including concert tickets, VIP seating, signed CDs & T-shirts, and more! Depending on the level of your contribution you can choose from several different gifts. Check the perks on the right side of the page for more details.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you cannot still help!  Spreading the word about this campaign and about the venue itself is also very important. Either way, please share with your network of friends and family, and feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools.

The Song goes on...

story:
About me:

Hi - I'm CK Brown, singer/songwriter. 

My first CD, "If I Believed", is set to release this year.  Recording a professional CD of my positive music is a dream I've had for 30 years.  My music is described as an eclectic conscious pop-folk-country rock-bluegrass that makes you smile.  

I've performed all my life - singing and playing in bands, church and community events. Then I began traveling around the world to places like Bali, Cambodia, Peru, and singing for kids in schools and orphanages.  I realized people everywhere were thirsty for the kind of positive music that I loved to sing and play.  I started writing songs about being your best, believing in yourself and following your dreams, and this turned into the theme for my first CD.

Why wait 30 years to record my first CD?  I didn't believe I was good enough - thought I had to have it all figured out before I took that first step.  Then 3 years ago, I came to realize there were no guarantees I would ever have it figured out.  So, I took that first step, not knowing where it would lead, but believing I could do it if I just kept working at it.

By taking that first step, and holding onto belief that I would be shown the next step, I have recorded 10 of 11 songs for my first CD titled "If I Believed".  The title cut is co-written by me, along with my producer and friend Freebo (yep, the great bass player who toured for years with Bonnie Raitt).  

About my CD project's path:

I have learned tons, along my recording path, and it has been especially great to find I was a pretty decent singer.  I hired amazing pro artists to make a really high-quality professional CD.  About half the songs are recorded at Addison Studios in the LA area, with the very talented Robert Tepper doing the engineering and mixing, and Freebo adding his expertise to every step of the production. 

Because I also wanted to put a bit of CK signature bluegrass instrumentation into the folk-pop-rock mix, I was led to work with another fantastic studio engineer/producer,
Jim Ratts of Raven Studios (and Runaway Express fame) in the Denver, Colorado area.  Through Jim, I was fortunate to meet, and hire, the top bluegrass instrumentalist in Colorado, the versatile, amazingly talented and humorously humble musical magician , Ernie Martinez.  Ernie plays more instruments than anyone I know, plays each one expertly, and I am honored to have his instruments on several of my songs.

I have incredible singers providing harmony backups, such as Freebo, Daniel Nahmod, Mollie O'Brien, Amy Nugent and Mailyn Faulkner.  I also included my favorite accordian player, John Magnee of The Subdudes fame, which adds a wonderful, unique quality to the sound! 


What YOU get for supporting my CD

  • This is where you come in.  Since I began this CD project in 2011, I have tried funding the whole thing completely on my own.  It has been tough, and the project had to go on hold for months at a time, as I saved up enough money to pay for a little more recording or mixing time.  

    As I near completion of the CD,     I see it will be very beneficial to the project to have outside monetary support, so I have enough time in the studio time to record and mix polished vocals for the remaining songs, professionally master the CD, put together professional graphics,  pay the licensing and copyright fees, and of course have the CDs themselves physically made.  

  • My initial goal on this campaign is to raise $25,000.  All money raised will go towards professional studio time, airfare to get to the studios, professional session musicians and background singers, high quality mastering, professional graphics and CD production, distribution to online retailers and pressing, copywright and licensing fees, promotional materials such as CDs, cards and posters.

    If I am able to exceed my goal, I have plans to put together a professional music video with a positive theme, start production on a CD to help children see the best in themselves, and begin working towards my next positive message CD.

  •  Take a look over to the right, where I'm offering many cool perks for you, including new music downloads, autographed CDs, amazing programs from a best selling author, and coaching sessions to help you step into your own greatness!  Because I am also a certified Infinite Possibilities Trainer, AND a certified Passion Test Facilitator, I am offering wonderful classes, no matter where you are in the world, through the wonders of computer webinars.  If you are local to the Seattle area, or want to fly me to where you're at, you can even host your own house concert for your friends.

    Every person who backs my project, and everyone who helps by spreading the word, will be part of making this CD a reality in 2014!  Every dollar that is contributed helps me continue to do what I love, which is bringing heartfelt, positive music to the world, and in doing so, uplifting people to believe in themselves and being the best that they can be.

    I ask everyone to please share the link to this page as much as possible, whether or not you are able to make a monetary donation.  
  • Email it to individuals and groups who might be interested in helping indie music thrive, or might be helped by adding positive music to their life.  
  • Post my campaign link to your Facebook - share it on Twitter - post it on your enewsletter or blog - be the center of the positive ripple that spreads out to uplift the rest of the world.

    Bottom line action:
  • Please tell your friends, co-worker, family, acquaintances about my campaign -  share my link and ask them to share as well. 
  • Read through the perks, click and select the donate level you like

Thanks for whatever you can do - I really appreciate your help in producing my CD.

Email it to individuals and groups who might be interested in helping indie music thrive, or might be helped by adding positive music to their life.  
Post my campaign link to your Facebook - share it on Twitter - post it on your enewsletter or blog - be the center of the positive ripple that spreads out to uplift the rest of the world.Bottom line action:

story:
Short Summary

An Indie GoGo to help Staring at Shipwrecks fund their music video recording with Sam Link! We will be recording the video regardless, but funding helps us record the video sooner and also gives you all the chance to get some awesome prizes! Hope you can help us out, thanks!

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to make sure we can fund this video in time to release it as soon as possible for all of you. Helping to fund us gets you really awesome perks as well, so don't miss these opportunities!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help fund us, make sure to shout out our campaign and share it with your friends so we can get as much help as possible!

story:
Interlude of My Own Humanity Showing

Hi! Jen Budd here.  I'll begin by saying I'm nervous - this whole funding campaign is so out of my comfort zone. Normally in a situation like this I would put my head down and do it myself by using my own savings and working ridiculous hours to pay for it myself - which is what I have done with my past recordings and business endeavours. It is because of these investments, which I am so proud and grateful for, that am broke and thought a project like this would be financially impossible.  However, I was encouraged by a close friend of mine (Anne *cough*) to get out of my comfort zone, and trust that the community I surround myself with would, in fact, want to support my next  musical/ministry project. 

I am passionate about writing songs and leading praise in the Church.  It may come as a shock to some of you that I haven't recorded a praise album yet.  But the fact of the matter is that I have been avoiding the nudge to record a praise album for the past 7 years.  Blatant disobedience *eye roll*.  Ultimately, my cynicism of Christian music prevented me from listening, trusting and being obedient to God.  I am human and I have sinned, but I have also encountered a Love that has dispelled fear and brought new life. 

So here I go, with my hands up in surrender - hoping that I am on a roller coaster to enjoy a ride, not jumping out of a plane without a parachute. 

 

About the EP, "Humanity, Meet Heaven"

How do I reconcile the goodness of God in the midst of this problem of pain? What does it mean "on earth, as it is in Heaven"?   “Humanity, Meet Heaven” was birthed out of a place of prayer and solitude, personal struggles and revelations, and seeing a common thread of questions in my community.  I began to write songs that both recognize our humanity – the brokenness and suffering we endure – and also the immense power and love of God that meets humanity where we are at. From that personal time of re-birthed hope, came songs that offer a snippet of God’s nature, freedom, and the celebration of heaven, as it can be on earth.

This EP will be released to the public for FREE (on all available digital platforms, downloadable chord charts will be available on my website).  My hope is that the EP will be a free gift to my community and the broader Church.  In order to make this reality, this is where a financial partnership with YOU will come into play...

 

Recording Costs & Partner Perks (What YOU Get)

We need at least $6,000 CAD to record 3 songs.  This includes (1) recording (produced by Drew Brown), (2) mastering, (3) paying musicians, (4) baseline costs of some partner perk's, and (5) the 5% Indiegogo will take from the campaign.  

PERKS INCLUDE:

  1. Catered Workshops for your Praise Team / Church / Organization, valued up to $300.00 CAD/each.
    • Vocal Workshops 
    • Music Theory Workshops
    • Songwriting Workshops
    • Praise & Worship Theology 
    • Praise Team  - Preparation, Set Lists, Band Dynamics, Practices, Team Building, etc.
  2. Praise Leading at your local church (within 200 km driving distance).
  3. House "Concert"/Praise Night (within 200km driving distance), valued at $250.00 CAD.
  4. Private 60-minute Vocal Lesson with Jennifer Budd (in Hamilton Studio or via Skype), valued at $100.00 CAD.
  5. Private 30-minute Vocal Lessons with Jennifer buddy (in Hamilton Studio or via Skype). valued at $49.95 CAD.
  6. A Julia Veenstra print of "The Beauty of Muskoka" (16 by 48 inch), valued at $800.00 CAD. Only 5 available. Shipping included.
  7. T-Shirt with album artwork, designed by Meredith W. Park (Instagram: @meredithplayground), valued at $20.00 CAD
  8. Crewneck Sweater with album artwork, designed by Meredith W. Park (Instagram: @meredithplayground), valued at $30.00 CAD
  9. If you prefer the no-perk option, you can also contribute by donation only - just follow the prompts after pressing "BACK IT" button on the top right.

To meet our goal, we would need 6 CHURCHES,  24 HOUSES, or 60 INDIVIDUALS to partner with us! Doable, YES! 

*In the case that we do not raise the full amount, we will record as many songs possible with the available funds and donate the rest of the excess funds to 541 Eatery & Exchange (Hamilton, ON).

 

The Impact

I resonate deeply with the cry of these songs, and at the same time, I feel a sense of excitement and encouragement of God's goodness revealed.  Considering the current state of our world and our Church, I'm sure there are others who will feel the same. I believe the message that God meeting us in our pain is extremely timely and hopeful for Christians and non-Christians alike.  Immanuel - God with us. 

 

Risks & Challenges

I am completely financially tapped.  

BUT I have a readiness in my spirit that this is the time for these songs and I want to dedicate my time and skill to a project that can bless my community and the Church.  I am willing to offer a lot of my time to "pay off" what I can through PARTNER PERKS (ie. vocal coaching, leading praise, workshops).  I truly believe that with many hands (and dollars), WE can make this project come to fruition together.

 

Other Ways You Can Partner

If you can't contribute financially at this time (and that's ok!),  you can still partner with this project!

  • Spread the word on social media!  Please share the links on Facebook and Instagram to spread the word - or tell your friends & family in person.  
  • Pray! This is the most important way to contribute.  These songs were birthed out of a place of silence, solitude & prayer.  I would LOVE to have this project be covered with prayer throughout the process of the crowdfunding campaign, recording sessions, and release.  

 

And that's all there is to it.  So you in or what?!

 

Links

Jennifer Budd Socials: 

http://facebook.com/JenniferBuddMusic

http://instagram.com/yourbuddjen

Théma Arts Academy: 

www.themaartsacademy.com
story_txt:
Interlude of My Own Humanity Showing
Hi! Jen Budd here.  I'll begin by saying I'm nervous - this whole funding campaign is so out of my comfort zone. Normally in a situation like this I would put my head down and do it myself by using my own savings and working ridiculous hours to pay for it myself - which is what I have done with my past recordings and business endeavours. It is because of these investments, which I am so proud and grateful for, that am broke and thought a project like this would be financially impossible.  However, I was encouraged by a close friend of mine (Anne *cough*) to get out of my comfort zone, and trust that the community I surround myself with would, in fact, want to support my next  musical/ministry project. 
I am passionate about writing songs and leading praise in the Church.  It may come as a shock to some of you that I haven't recorded a praise album yet.  But the fact of the matter is that I have been avoiding the nudge to record a praise album for the past 7 years.  Blatant disobedience *eye roll*.  Ultimately, my cynicism of Christian music prevented me from listening, trusting and being obedient to God.  I am human and I have sinned, but I have also encountered a Love that has dispelled fear and brought new life. 
So here I go, with my hands up in surrender - hoping that I am on a roller coaster to enjoy a ride, not jumping out of a plane without a parachute. 
 
About the EP, "Humanity, Meet Heaven"
How do I reconcile the goodness of God in the midst of this problem of pain? What does it mean "on earth, as it is in Heaven"?   “Humanity, Meet Heaven” was birthed out of a place of prayer and solitude, personal struggles and revelations, and seeing a common thread of questions in my community.  I began to write songs that both recognize our humanity – the brokenness and suffering we endure – and also the immense power and love of God that meets humanity where we are at. From that personal time of re-birthed hope, came songs that offer a snippet of God’s nature, freedom, and the celebration of heaven, as it can be on earth.
This EP will be released to the public for FREE (on all available digital platforms, downloadable chord charts will be available on my website).  My hope is that the EP will be a free gift to my community and the broader Church.  In order to make this reality, this is where a financial partnership with YOU will come into play...
 

Recording Costs & Partner Perks (What YOU Get)
We need at least $6,000 CAD to record 3 songs.  This includes (1) recording (produced by Drew Brown), (2) mastering, (3) paying musicians, (4) baseline costs of some partner perk's, and (5) the 5% Indiegogo will take from the campaign.  
PERKS INCLUDE:


Catered Workshops for your Praise Team / Church / Organization, valued up to $300.00 CAD/each.
Vocal Workshops 
Music Theory Workshops
Songwriting Workshops
Praise & Worship Theology 
Praise Team  - Preparation, Set Lists, Band Dynamics, Practices, Team Building, etc.



Praise Leading at your local church (within 200 km driving distance).

House "Concert"/Praise Night (within 200km driving distance), valued at $250.00 CAD.

Private 60-minute Vocal Lesson with Jennifer Budd (in Hamilton Studio or via Skype), valued at $100.00 CAD.
Private 30-minute Vocal Lessons with Jennifer buddy (in Hamilton Studio or via Skype). valued at $49.95 CAD.

A Julia Veenstra print of "The Beauty of Muskoka" (16 by 48 inch), valued at $800.00 CAD. Only 5 available. Shipping included.

T-Shirt with album artwork, designed by Meredith W. Park (Instagram: @meredithplayground), valued at $20.00 CAD

Crewneck Sweater with album artwork, designed by Meredith W. Park (Instagram: @meredithplayground), valued at $30.00 CAD

If you prefer the no-perk option, you can also contribute by donation only - just follow the prompts after pressing "BACK IT" button on the top right.

To meet our goal, we would need 6 CHURCHES,  24 HOUSES, or 60 INDIVIDUALS to partner with us! Doable, YES! 
*In the case that we do not raise the full amount, we will record as many songs possible with the available funds and donate the rest of the excess funds to 541 Eatery & Exchange (Hamilton, ON).

 
The Impact
I resonate deeply with the cry of these songs, and at the same time, I feel a sense of excitement and encouragement of God's goodness revealed.  Considering the current state of our world and our Church, I'm sure there are others who will feel the same. I believe the message that God meeting us in our pain is extremely timely and hopeful for Christians and non-Christians alike.  Immanuel - God with us. 
 

Risks & Challenges
I am completely financially tapped.  
BUT I have a readiness in my spirit that this is the time for these songs and I want to dedicate my time and skill to a project that can bless my community and the Church.  I am willing to offer a lot of my time to "pay off" what I can through PARTNER PERKS (ie. vocal coaching, leading praise, workshops).  I truly believe that with many hands (and dollars), WE can make this project come to fruition together.
 

Other Ways You Can Partner
If you can't contribute financially at this time (and that's ok!),  you can still partner with this project!


Spread the word on social media!  Please share the links on Facebook and Instagram to spread the word - or tell your friends & family in person.  


Pray! This is the most important way to contribute.  These songs were birthed out of a place of silence, solitude & prayer.  I would LOVE to have this project be covered with prayer throughout the process of the crowdfunding campaign, recording sessions, and release.  


 And that's all there is to it.  So you in or what?! LinksJennifer Budd Socials: http://facebook.com/JenniferBuddMusichttp://instagram.com/yourbuddjenThéma Arts Academy: www.themaartsacademy.com

story:
The Mission

When I was a kid, quality music filled my heart and mind with the good news of God's love and goodness. Music shaped my walk with God and I want to bring that to kids of this generation.  Today's kids listen to pop music with an adult sound.  My goal is to create an album that communicates the truth and love of God with lyrics kids can relate to, but for that message to be carried by the vehicle of the modern pop music sound kids love to sing and dance to. God has called me to write great songs for kids and I want to bring those songs to the world in the best way possible. 

Make A Pledge Today

All rewards come with a gift-able "Spread the Love" reward to share with someone you love. So not only are you investing into the lives of countless kids, parents, and families but you also get a little something for yourself, and something to give away.  

The $$$

Creating a high-quality album that has the ability to reach the world is VERY expensive. A single song created with high-quality producers, musicians, mixing, and mastering can cost between $2500-$5000. This is one of the benefits to being signed to a record label - they typically cover the large cost of creating a quality record upfront. 

I enjoy being an independent artist and that's where crowdfunding comes in. If I can raise the money myself, I can create a quality record while still keeping creative control of my music and career. 

So I have two goals. Goal #1 is $15,000. This will cover the cost of having a 5 song EP produced by top-notch kids music producers and musicians. (ACCOMPLISHED!)

Goal #2 is $30,000.  This will cover the cost of have a 10 song full album produced by top notch kids music producers and musicians. 
 

The Team

I am so excited to be working with a team of producers and writers from USA & Canada.  This includes producers and writers who have won Grammy's, Dove Awards, Juno's, created the music for Veggietales, and other international kids projects.  The money donated will be used to work with this quality team that can deliver a product that stands up to anything else in the kids market. 

The Plan

I am already starting to work with writers and producers to create the album.  I am going to keep writing until I have 10 world class kids songs. After that, all that I need is the finances to get the album produced and send it out into the world! 

Risks & Challenges

People ask me often "when is your next album coming out?" and I always respond "as soon as I have $30,000 to get it produced!".  They are usually a bit shocked, but that is the reality of what it costs to create a quality product. The biggest challenge is going to be getting $30,000. I have a plan in place to attack the $30,000 mountain from multiple angles, but the biggest help will be the money I raise through this campaign. 

Ways You Can Help

  • Give to the campaign! =)
  • Share the campaign on social media with the Indiegogo share tools
  • Tell your friends who have kids about it!

Why This Matters

In the end this album is not about me.  To be honest, if it was I wouldn't be doing a kids album. God has put it on my heart to create music that is catchy, singable, filled with creative lyrics and amazing music that carries the light and love of God to kids and families around the world. I can't wait to see the music go from phones, car stereos, and church ministries into the hearts of kids and parents who desperately need a touch from God.  

I am moving forward in faith and will do everything I can to make this album happen.  

Thank you for your love, encouragement and generous support!

Check out the perks to the right and pledge today!   ===========>

Much love, 
Brad

* donations are in Canadian dollars.  This means USA supporters get 27% off their donation.  (i.e. $100 donation will cost $73 USD / $1000 donation will cost $730 USD)

story:
Hey I'm Sam Lawson, and I'm a 23 year old musician from Christchurch, New Zealand. Starting as a concept to self record and produce a 4 track EP over a week in summer, the initial idea quickly grew into something much bigger! I now have 4 tracks recorded and mixed, but as I started with no budget, am already well in debt for this project, and need help to get it over the finish line! If you can support this project, you will be helping me see this through to completion!

As I've said, I need help to finish this off, and that's where you come in! What I've decided to do, is presale the EP on indiegogo in order to raise the funds to print the albums. In essence, I don't care if I don't make any profit on this (it was never about that) but I'd love for people to be able to hear this. So selling it this way lets me pay for the production and know how many copies are required. Any money raised above and beyond the goal can be put into printing extra copies that I can try to sell in the future.

To break down the figures, I need:

$750 for mastering the mixed files

$1500 for printing CD's and packaging

$500 for design work

So in order to raise that I have a range of options available for sale, including digital and physical copies.

If you can't fund this project, you can still help! Share this project with your friends on facebook, and go like (and share) my facebook page, https://www.facebook.com/samlawsonmusicnz/ to stay up to date with future projects!

If nothing else, thanks for giving me the time it took to read this far!

Sam :)

story:
Hey friend! My name is Jeremy Strand. I currently live in the Denver area where I serve as a Pastor at a local church that has a rich history and an exciting destiny. 

A LITTLE ABOUT ME

Music, with the variation of many genres, has been a deep love of mine ever since childhood.  I started learning guitar on my own at 16 and as soon as a few chords were played I began to write some of my own songs. A couple of inspirations of mine would include artists such as Jack Johnson, Ben Harper, Barefoot Truth, as well as Christian artists like Rich Mullins or Shawn McDonald.

WHATS THE CAMPAIGN ABOUT?

This music project is about making an EP without having to go through the conventional means of the music world by being signed by a label. With the EP, we plan to 'get out there' by playing shows in various places with a product we can offer to fans.

Because we're going this route of creating an EP, it takes the financial support of friends like you to make this vision become a reality!

THE BREAKDOWN & THE PERKS

In order to create a record-quality EP, we need $4,500. Once the EP is complete, we will be able to sell it in either physical or digital form to create a profit for the purpose of writing and recording more songs while pursuing more venues to play music.

To check out our sweet Perks by Donating - see the column on the right of the page!

WHAT IF WE DON'T REACH OUR GOAL?

Both myself, and the band, decided early on that all the donations we receive is going to the making of the EP no matter what. We believe in it that much! But, we're also believing that more support may be given than what we're asking for...and if that happens - we'll be able to pursue the music in even greater ways!

THE IMPACT YOU MAKE

Simply put, your generous giving goes directly into the making of the EP as its found in the hands of those who are impacted by the music we make. In fact, we appreciate your support so much that when you give $40 we'll include your name on our website and album itself. 

Every gift you give, will become a part of the story and purpose of the music.

ARE THERE ANY RISKS?

Of course. Thats what makes a story good and every adventure worth pursuing! This project could end up a dud, or it could become more than we imagined. The beautiful part is that no one knows! But we trust that after you listen to our first song, and receive updates about the other songs in the making, you will become as inspired as we are and believe in what we're pursuing.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

If you aren't able to give anything at this time, that's okay! We believe prayer is just as important. 

And get the word out! This means sharing our videos, music, and fundraising video on your facebook page and Instagram. A major part of success comes from friends like you who tell their friends and family - in fact, we believe this is the best way to become known in the music world. 

WEBSITE: www.jeremystrand.com    

FAEBOOK:  www.facebook.com/jeremystrandmusic/

INSTAGRAM: @jeremystrandmusic   

BANDCAMP: https://jeremystrand.bandcamp.com/releases

story:
We are basically asking those of you who want to hear a new Mother Funk Conspiracy album to buy it now to help us make it. This is the MFC that had 350,000+ digital downloads of our first EP. $5,000 will buy our band mates' airfare to get to LA, the time off work to record that week, and pay mixing and mastering costs. If we receive up to $8,000 we can print physical copies or even vinyl. Otherwise iTunes it is :)

We are sitting on a full album of new material that's funkier than all get out! Let's do this!!!

Each member of MFC is a working/touring musician. But we are committed to finding one week to meet in Los Angeles this year to track the record. The funds generated here will make that commitment possible.


Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
