story:
Hello everyone! 

I am a professional pianist/singer/songwriter originally from Vancouver, Canada, but now living in London, UK. For the past two and a half years, I have been making a living playing in five-star hotel/restaurant establishments, from the Fairmont Pacific Rim and Shangri-La in Vancouver, to the Dorchester and Savoy hotels in London, some of the finest and most famous hotels in the world. Before this, I was a student at Berklee College of Music in Boston. I am 21 years old.

In 2013, I released a 5-song EP of original music entitled 'Tears In Rain', and the response I received was overwhelmingly positive from fans and industry executives alike. However, since then, I have written many, many more songs and would love to share them with you.

What better way to share my new songs than to debut them travelling on a romantic journey from Paris to Amsterdam?

Here is my plan:

On September 23rd, 2014, I will leave to spend 5 days in Paris, 5 days in Brussels, and 5 days in Amsterdam, then return to London.

I will search far and wide for pianos to play both inside and outside of the city, looking for the best locations possible.

I will play and sing on these pianos, record the live performances as well as travel footage, and compile them myself into an online video series.

My only equipment: Myself, two USB microphones, microphone stands, an HD camcorder, and my laptop. As basic a setup as it could possibly be. Just me, the songs, and pretty French girls. Hopefully.

The entire trip is booked and ready to go, and I have already found a few pianos to play on in some great locations. 

However, these things cost money, and I am a musician. Musicians that aren't famous yet don't generally make much money, especially when they are paying rent in London.

Travel, lodging, food and equipment costs included, this 15-day trip will cost about £2000 (roughly $3300 USD), comprised of:

Equipment (software, batteries, microphones, cables, headphones, etc): £650

Trains and city transport: £300

Lodging/Accommodation via Airbnb: £600

Food: £300 (£20/day)

Miscellaneous: £150


The way I have set it up is this:

If you contribute £5 or more, you will receive a free download of my EP 'Tears In Rain'.

If you contribute £50 or more, I will send you a personal video greeting/thank you from Paris, Brussels, or Amsterdam. Or from a train in the middle of the Belgian countryside on the way to Bruges. Or in Bruges. Or in Antwerp. Or Ghent.

If you contribute £100 or more, I will dedicate a song to you.

If you contribute £250 or more, I will make a video of myself performing any cover or original song of your choice from my 70+ song repertoire, dedicated to you. The list is available on my website.

If you contribute £500 or more before September 20th (to give me a couple days to learn it), I will make a video of myself performing any song you choose, dedicated to you, as long as it is within my capability to perform. Rap is not my forte.

Anything helps, and any donation will be greatly appreciated. Of course, if you would rather remain anonymous, that's cool too. 

Also, if you know of any great location with a piano in these cities, please let me know, whether it be in a friend's apartment, or in a 19th century concert hall! The more venues I have to choose from, of all kinds, the better the end result will be!

Please spread the word, share the videos and help me follow the dream! :)

Thank you!

Austin Nash Park

www.austinnashpark.com

https://www.facebook.com/austinnashparkmusic

https://www.youtube.com/anashpark1

story:
Hi! My name is Nicholas Phan, and I am seeking your support of my current recording project, A Painted Tale.   

For this third solo recording, I'll be turning to a group of early English composers who range from the Renaissance to the early Baroque. The program, A Painted Tale, features songs for lute and viola da gamba by John Dowland, Thomas Morley and Henry Purcell, as well as some incredible gems by some of their lesser-known contemporaries John Blow, Alfonso Ferrabosco, and Nicholas Lanier.  Taking a cue from the operatic and theatrical practice of creating pastiche works during this period in musical history, rather than simply recording a simple selection of of these early English musical miniatures, I've assembled these incredible songs into a pastiche song-cycle that tells a story of love gained and then lost.

What has always drawn me so powerfully to song is its timelessness. Reading the poetry in these songs I am fascinated by how little the human experience has changed over the centuries.  The highs and lows of falling in and out of love have remained the same after all this time!  By assembling these various songs into a cycle, I am hoping that creating a dramatic context for these pieces will highlight how relevant this material still is today.

In addition to recording these works, my colleagues and I will perform this program in my second solo recital at Carnegie Hall on March 18, 2015.

This album will be recorded October 22 & 23, 2014 at Skywalker Sound in Marin County, CA. I will be joined in the recording studio as well as at Carnegie Hall by two fantastic colleagues who both have extensive experience in this repertoire: violist da gamba, Ann Marie Morgan, a frequent soloist with leading modern and period orchestras including Apollo's Fire, the Baltimore Symphony and the Cleveland, Minnesota, and Philadelphia Orchestras; and lutenist/theorbo-player, Michael Leopold, who regularly performs with leading period instrument ensembles around the world, including Concerto Italiano and La Venexiana, and opera companies including the San Francisco Opera, Houston Grand Opera, and Opera Australia.  The album will be released in February of 2015.

This third album will be released on Avie Records, who also released my first two solo albums, Winter Words and Still Falls the Rain, in 2011 and 2012 respectively. Avie's unique business model is based on artist ownership.  What I love about this model is that it allows for the utmost freedom artistically. Avie's model of artist ownership also places the responsibility for finding funding for recording projects on the artists, which is the reason for my appeal to you at this juncture!

The funds raised from this campaign will be used to cover the costs of album production, post-production, artwork design, CD manufacturing, and marketing.  The amazing thing about recording versus live performance is that it enables a musician to reach the widest audience possible.  Any contribution you make will allow us to bring this phenomenally beautiful and powerful music to the world, and help touch people's hearts the way it has so moved ours.

Thank you so much in advance for your support, and I can't wait to be able to share all of this fantastic music with you!

For this third solo recording, I'll be turning to a group of early English
composers who range from the Renaissance to the early Baroque. The program, A
Painted Tale, features songs for lute and viola da gamba by John Dowland, Thomas Morley and Henry Purcell, as well as some incredible gems by some of their lesser-known contemporaries John Blow, Alfonso Ferrabosco, and Nicholas Lanier.  Taking a cue from the operatic and theatrical practice of creating pastiche works during this period in musical history, rather than simply recording a simple selection of of these early English musical miniatures, I've assembled these incredible songs into a pastiche song-cycle that tells a story of love gained and then lost.What has always drawn me so powerfully to song is its timelessness. Reading the poetry in these songs I am fascinated by how little the human experience has changed over the centuries.  The highs and lows of falling in and out of love have remained the same after all this time!  By assembling these various songs into a cycle, I am hoping that creating a dramatic context for these pieces will highlight how relevant this material still is today.In addition to recording these works, my colleagues and I will perform this program in my second solo recital at Carnegie Hall on March 18, 2015.This album will be recorded October 22 & 23, 2014 at Skywalker Sound in Marin County, CA. I will be joined in the recording studio as well as at Carnegie Hall by two fantastic colleagues who both have extensive experience in this repertoire: violist da gamba, Ann Marie Morgan, a frequent soloist with leading modern and period orchestras including Apollo's Fire, the Baltimore Symphony and the Cleveland, Minnesota, and Philadelphia Orchestras; and lutenist/theorbo-player, Michael Leopold, who regularly performs with leading period instrument ensembles around the world, including Concerto Italiano and La Venexiana, and opera companies including the San Francisco Opera, Houston Grand Opera, and Opera Australia.  The album will be released in February of 2015.This third album will be released on Avie Records, who also released my first two solo albums, Winter Words and Still Falls the Rain, in 2011 and 2012 respectively. Avie's unique business model is based on artist ownership.  What I love about this model is that it allows for the utmost freedom artistically. Avie's model of artist ownership also places the responsibility for finding funding for recording projects on the artists, which is the reason for my appeal to you at this juncture!The funds raised from this campaign will be used to cover the costs of album production, post-production, artwork design, CD manufacturing, and marketing.  The amazing thing about recording versus live performance is that it enables a musician to reach the widest audience possible.  Any contribution you make will allow us to bring this phenomenally beautiful and powerful music to the world, and help touch people's hearts the way it has so moved ours.Thank you so much in advance for your support, and I can't wait to be able to share all of this fantastic music with you!

story:
Vinyl Pinups are among the most talented up-and-coming artists in the indie pop scene. Their first official release, “Gold Rays” is tearing up Soundcloud, hitting over half a million plays since it's release. Their music video for “Gold Rays” was released in late February 2014, debuted exclusively by Ryan Seacrest on his website and YouTube channel, and released on VEVO a few weeks later for the start of Spring Break. The song has become the song of the summer for bloggers, clothing brands, beachgoers, and west coast diehards.

 As a pair, Brennan and Khara have written and produced multiple songs for independent and major label artists, as well as national advertising campaigns, and television shows. The two write, record, produce, and mix their own tracks, all out of the sheer necessity to create. 2014 has given them a chance to finally pursue their own journey as Vinyl Pinups to create fresh new indiepop music that makes people feel good, and speaks to them in a unique way.


Vinyl Pinups' music been used in numerous advertising campaigns for international brands, including Abercrombie & Fitch, Old Navy, and Bebe.
 Now, Vinyl Pinups are gearing up for the release of their second official single, “Heart Shaped Sunnies”, their debut EP, TWO, and the “Heart Shaped Sunnies” official music video, which will be directed by acclaimed director Chuck David Willis.


 This is a unique opportunity to be an integral part of Vinyl Pinups at a crucial point in their career. Vinyl Pinups are raising funds from fans and supporters to finance the production of a beautiful, sophisticated, artistic new music video, and also for additional promotional material for their EP release early in 2015. Like most things, you get what you pay for, which is why VP brought on one of the most talented, fresh, promising, cutting edge, artistically uninhibited, inspired, innovative, pioneering music video directors in the game, Chuck David Willis.

Chuck has an uncompromising and unique artistic voice for the choice music video projects he takes on. His most notable recent works include music videos for Ginny Blackmore's “Bones”, Devan Dubois' “Long Live”, and Chelsea Lankes' soon to be released video “Secret”. Like most great artists, Chuck goes for quality over quantity, and Vinyl Pinups is honored, and excited that he's chosen to take on the music video for “Heart Shaped Sunnies”.


Make sure to listen to an preview (above) of “Heart Shaped Sunnies” prepared exclusively for IndieGogo!

WHAT VP NEEDS AND WHAT YOU GET

  • Vinyl Pinups is looking to raise $10,000 or more to fund their next music video, and promotional material for their debut EP release TWO. Promotional material includes photos, artwork, websites, and additional video/web content, and the physical printing of TWO.
  • Check out the perks! As donations get higher, you become more intimately involved with Brennan and Khara, and even have a chance to attend the EP Release show for TWO in Los Angeles, early next year.
WHY IS IT IMPORTANT FOR PEOPLE TO CONTRIBUTE?
  • With the changing climate of the music industry, more and more artists are creating new ways to get their art out there, and also to run a profitable business. Vinyl Pinups has, to this point, been a fully self funded enterprise. It is important, as industries change, that initiative is taken to adapt and innovate the business model, or the industry will cease to exist. 
  • Vinyl Pinups is part of a new movement that is revolutionizing the way content is produced, released, and marketed. By funding this project, contributors are paramount members of one of the movements that will keep the music industry alive, and keep artists able to produce great music, a vital cornerstone of culture.

  • WHAT MAKES VINYL PINUPS DIFFERENT?

    Vinyl Pinups is a project that reaches far into television, film, advertising, fashion, design, and art, using methods formerly considered unconventional to release music.


RISKS AND CHALLENGES
 In a world of noise, it is difficult for any artist to break through. Music is especially difficult, simply because of the plethora of options listeners have, and the fickle nature of the modern consumer.

 Vinyl Pinups have been an ever evolving force with the changing of the music industry over the years. They rely on their industry intuition from years in the business, and also their adaptability, and reactivity. They're quick to modify methods when challenges arise, and see roadblocks as simply detours. While filming the music video for “Gold Rays”, they even resorted to putting a cameraman on rollerblades to be pulled by his beltloop backwards down the boardwalk when a dolly wasn't available. The end goal is always met.

RECENT PRESS


HILLYDILLY.com

“...the definition of pop gold. 'Only Lonely' is what Lana Del Rey would sound like if she used electronic-based production, and the whistling-led 'Gold Rays' is an undeniable radio hit with its incredibly catchy melodies...”

RyanSeacrest.com

“Laced with soft synths, nonchalant melodies of whistles, and guitar strums, the track is redolent of the trip-hop era with the inclusion of lyrics like: “You put the smile on my face like the sunshine / I won’t cry, cry, cry / cause you’re mine all mine.”

BMI.com Indie Artist Spotlight

“The pair create infectious, optimistic songs evoking images of summer, beaches and better times...they put a fresh sound to a popular genre.”

CHECK OUT VINYL PINUPS ACROSS THE WEB:
http://www.vinylpinups.com
http://www.soundclound.com/vinylpinups
http://www.twitter.com/vinylpinups
http://www.facebook.com/vinylpinups
http://www.pinterest.com/vinylpinups

"GOLD RAYS" OFFICIAL MUSIC VIDEO

story:
Short Summary

My name is David Balmer. I'm a 5th year undergraduate student at Temple University, studying music therapy. Recently, I found that the state will not give me grants in my 5th year, which has put me in a serious financial predicament. I have some scholarships and loans, but it does not come close to covering the debt I will owe.

This campaign is not for me. This is for the betterment of music therapy. Any money raised (you can donate even $1, whatever you can) is going to directly impact my ability to graduate, which will directly impact the opportunity given to me to provide music therapy for those who need it. Music therapy itself is a systematic process of intervention in which music and all of the aspects of music are utilized with therapeutic goals and objectives to help clients/patients to improve, restore, or maintain various forms of health. That's what this is truly about.

What We Need & What You Get

I am going to need about $6,000 to cover my account balance to graduate. I can assure you that 100% of the money raised is going directly to that. If I cannot reach $6,000, that's okay. Every little bit helps. Again, you can even donate $1 and that'll help!

Whether you can help me out or not, I am still very grateful. And if you can help me out, it will not go unnoticed. The perks range from a Facebook shout out to a full song written by me and recorded just for you!

    The Impact

    As aforementioned, music therapy itself is a systematic process of intervention in which music and all of the aspects of music are utilized with therapeutic goals and objectives to help clients/patients to improve, restore, or maintain various forms of health.

    But what does that mean? How can that be applied? Why does it matter?

    Music therapy is a relatively new field that has been gaining ground and growing immensely over the years. The field has become very refined and effective. Music therapy can be used in a wide variety of settings, such as schools, hospitals, psychiatric institutions, hospice care, prenatal and postnatal care, neurological centers, and private practice to name a few. Music therapy can be provided for people of all ages. It can be applied to clients and patients with physical injuries/disabilities, mental disorders, learning disabilities, emotional instability, terminal illnesses, and neurological disabilities, among new creative ways being thought of every single day. The benefits of music therapy can be physical, emotional, mental, and spiritual. The versatility of this field is only expanding, and the reward is exceptionally powerful.

    This is what I am trying to do. To put it simply, I love people, and I want to help those who need help. This beautiful profession is one of the most selfless, giving professions offered in the world, and I want to be a part of that. And right now, I just need some help to attain that.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you cannot help me financially, I am in complete understanding. However, spreading the word ALWAYS helps, and I would be so appreciative of that. You can post it on your Facebook or Twitter page. You can tell your family and friends. Anything and everything helps!!

story:
My Indiegogo campaign is quite simple - Send Local Girls to Rock Camp!  I'll be spearheading a video campaign as a documentation of short videos from the road.  The topics I'll cover and then ask other influential women in the music business to respond to through video are: Lessons from Touring, Things I Wish I Knew as a Young Musician, Breaking Barriers in the Business, and any other fun personal stories.

The purpose of these videos, and what I hope viewers will be able to take away, is to learn a few things about the various approaches to music, our techniques, why we do it, how it benefits us, how it makes us feel and how it bridges and creates different communities.

I am aiming to raise $1,200! The funds raised for these videos will send 4 campers to Girls Rock Camp Vancouver 2015. It cost's approximately $300 for a camper to participate during the week, this covers things like daily lunches and snacks, instruments and gear, and many juice boxes!

Some background information from GRCV:

Girls Rock Camp Vancouver is a project for female youth aged 8-17. The organization hosts a week long music camp and various workshops for one week during the summer months. GRCV provides young women the opportunity to explore, access and create music with the guidance of positive mentors. With the ultimate focus on building communications skills, GRCV strives to diminish sexism and other forms of oppression through creating a safe space for creativity and fun and for sharing resources and knowledge. We believe that every person deserves to love and believe in themselves regardless of economic status, sexual orientation, gender, race, religion or size and that every person deserves the opportunity to develop the necessary skills to move through their lives with confidence and success. 

What happens at camp?

GRCV provides a supportive space for 30-35 female youth to help build self-esteem through music creation and performance. Throughout the week, campers learn a key instrument and are coached through the experience of playing within a band setting. Campers also attend workshops with talented female mentors in subjects such as Songwriting, Self-Defense, Image and Identity, Zine-Making, Screen-Printing and Gear Education including gear set up and maintenance.

At camp there are performances by experienced female musicians, on-site conflict management for bands, and one-on-one instrument instruction sessions with the youth.

The week finishes with the ultimate experience of playing a live show at a local venue, in front of an audience of family, friends and screaming fans.

Learn more about GRVC 


Thank you for your support in building self esteem in female youth through music creation and performance and Girls Rock Camp Vancouver!

story:
PHIL DOUBLET

To those who have heard Phil play guitar, the experience is memorable.  

Phil Doublet is a Christchurch based musician who is at home playing blues and country music, genres in which he is highly regarded and also keeps busy as a music teacher, session player, performer and composer.

Phil has developed his skills now for nearly 3 decades, in concert, in the studio or just jamming around at home. Phil is one of that rare group of restless, artistic spirits who cannot sit around without either tapping his hands, feet, or grabbing a musical instrument from a corner and jamming out a tune. It is this very spirit that drives such people to be consummate experts of their instruments.

Phil has spent the majority of his time as a session musician for others. He has enough original material to fill 3 albums and now with enough encouragement & “helpful” pressure from those around him he’s ready to record his debut album. 

By contributing toward Phil's debut album you'll be helping make a lifelong goal come to fruition.  

 

_______________________________________________________________________________

 

THE PLAN

In the big scheme of things $5000 isn't a big budget for an album however with good 'can do' attitude Phil plans on putting it all to good use. The majority of the funds will go towards studio time, mixing, mastering, manufacturing and album artwork.

To get the most bang for your buck Phil will put his multi instrumentalist skills to good use by playing an assortment of string instruments himself. The album will be mixed & mastered at Nightshift Studios in Christchurch.

Any money left over will be put towards a decent marketing campaign, a release party & if we get well over $5000 we will look at making a music video.

All in all by contributing you're pretty much pre-purchasing your copy of the album. If you feel like being extra amazing you can even book Phil for a private gig!

Now of course if the fundraising isn't completely successful Phil will continue to make the album regardless - it may just be scaled back a little....but with good support I'm sure we don't even need to worry about that!

Phil has worked on numerous artists albums over the years as a session musician and this is a big step for Phil to put himself out there. For those who have seen Phil on stage there's no question about whether it's worth contributing.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have any spare cash at the moment but still want to help. Here's how you can:

  • Spread the word via Facebook 

  • Share the link with your friends or family that love music

  • There are handy share tools on this page!

 

Thanks for taking the time to read - it's much appreciated.

Cheers

story:
About Jing Lu

Jing Lu began studying yangqin (Chinese dulcimer) at age four, when she became known as a child prodigy. As a result of her outstanding performances and continued success, she received the highest scores in the country and was admitted to the Central Conservatory of Music for classical yangqin at the age of twelve. Lu received her B.A. in Music Performing Arts from the top music conservatory in China, the Central Conservatory of Music (CCOM).  Upon graduation, Lu decided to continue her studies in the United States. She is currently a third-year student at Columbia University and will receive her M.F.A. in Stage Management in May 2013. Current credits include: ASM for Three Women and AK-47 Sing-Along in the 2010 New York Fringe Festival; SM for Broken Wings, Washing Away, and Birthday Triage; PSM for the musical Golden Poplar in Beijing’s Poly Theatre; PA for Flambé Dreams and PA/Wardrobe Supervisor for A Letter to Harvey Milk at the New York Musical Theatre Festival; PA for Golden Child at Signature Theatre.

 

What is the Yangqin?

The original meaning of the words “yangqin” is different from its modern meaning. The character for “yang” has an original meaning of “foreign”, as the instrument’s origins can be traced back to Persia. However, the character “yang” has developed over history to also mean “acclaimed”. “Qin” simply means “zither”, so together “yangqin” has the meaning of “acclaimed zither”. It is believed that China discovered the dulcimer more than 400 years ago via the Silk Road. The origins of the dulcimer might be linked back to the European clavichord, which may have been adopted and later transformed as it was introduced into Eastern communities. The yangqin is similar to the Western piano in how fundamental it is to China’s musical repetoire. The yangqin is performed either solo or with instruments like the erhu, pipa, and dizi.

 

About the Performance

Jing Lu possesses twenty years of professional stage experience and is one of the few concert yangqin performers residing in New York. This performance presents a dialogue between Eastern and Western musical traditions; provides a great opportunity for spreading Chinese Dulcimer in New York; in addition to traditional Chinese works, Lu will also play pieces from the Western classical repertoire, such as Csárdás, Asturias (Leyenda), and Flight of the Bumblebee. She will also perform together with pipa player Zhou Yi.

 

About Special Guest Zhou Yi

“She has an impressive command of the instrument and of a broad range of its classical, folk, and modern musical literatures…” – The Boston Globe

Zhou Yi has performed in The Peony Pavilion, The Orphan of Zhao and Ghost Lovers at the Lincoln Center Festival, Wen Ji: Eighteen Songs of Nomad Flute at Asia Society, and Second Visit to the Empress with Shen Wei Dance Arts. She has performed in the 2002 and 2004 Spoleto Festival and the 2005 American Dance Festival.

 

About Composer Benoit Granier 

Benoit Granier is a French composer living in Beijing, China. He has studied composition with Artur Gervasony, Guy Rebel, Donnacha Dennehy, Roger Doyle as well as Fergus Johnston at Trinity College, where he completed his Ph.D. in Computer Music and Composition. 
After working in diverse institutions in both Beijing and Singapore, he settled down at the Centre for Electro Acoustic Music of China (C.E.M.C.), a part of the Beijing Central Conservatory of Music. He is currently teaching Computer Music, and Composition, Digital and interactive Media.

His work has been featured in various festivals, such as Boston’s Music and Culture Diplomacy Symposium, The Beijing Modern Music Festival, The Beijing Musicacoustica Festival, The Gainsville Electronic Music Festival, The International Computer Music Conference, Open Fader, The Santa Fe Festival of Electro-Acoustic Music, and Sounds Electric ‘05.

Over the past ten years, Granier has also been active as both a composer and visual artist. He has written for a large range of instruments, including both solo works and pieces for large orchestra. He has also worked extensively for Mixed Media and Pure Electronics, and recently developed an interest in composition for mixed ensemble that regroups classical formation and traditional forces.

 

What you get 

Benefits of Your Support; This performance will introduce your ears to the exotic charm of the yangqin and allow you to better understand the musical traditions of the Eastern world. This is an opportunity to enjoy Chinese classical repertoire performed by one of the most outstanding yangqin players.

 

Your Support

This performance is an opportunity to not only support one of the world’s best performers of Chinese classical music, but also to finally open the stage to include yangqin. Please support us in our mission to introduce New Yorkers to Chinese music and culture and to share the beauty of this instrument. We hope this performance will pave the way for New York’s most renowned venues to continue performing Chinese music for large audiences. Your support goes directly toward covering the costs of renting Carnegie Hall, designing promotional materials, hiring a production staff, transportation, and compensating the hard work our composer and musicians. Thank you for taking the time to read this and we greatly appreciate any support you can provide.

Our goal is to raise $4500

Fees for concert hall: $4300

Fees for the composer: $1500

Fees for the musicians: $300x2=$600

Fees for the costumes: $3200

Fees for the photographer: $300

Fees for the poster/program/flyer designer: $500

Live recording: $2000

Fees for other production: $100

Fees for car rental: $100

To support us with a payment through credit card or PayPal, just click on the "Contribute Now" button near the top or bottom of the page.  ANY donation amount is accepted.

 

My Thanks 

Thank you for being a part of my journey! Through your donations, or by passing on the link to this "The Bridge" Jing Lu Dulcimer Recital in New York campaign to your family, friends, and music aficionados around the world - I will be able to fulfill my passion.

I am very grateful!

 

Help me spread the word!  Send tweets, post on Facebook, text, blog or email your contacts.  Tell them to visit www.indiegogo.com and search Jing Lu’s Dulcimer to help her to make her dream come true.  

 

The Bridge

Jing Lu Chinese Dulcimer Recital

Weill Recital Hall at Carnegie Hall

Tuesday May 7, 2013 at 8:00 PM

Tickets: $20-50  Student/Senior $15

carnegiehall.org

CarnegieCharge 212-247-7800

Box Office at 57th and Seventh

 

Check out my website:

http://www.jingluarts.com/

 

Check out my MEDIA coverage:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X0MqL9kIlDs

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q4VVsIzngnQ
story_txt:
About Jing Lu
Jing Lu began studying yangqin (Chinese dulcimer) at age four, when she became known as a child prodigy. As a result of her outstanding performances and continued success, she received the highest scores in the country and was admitted to the Central Conservatory of Music for classical yangqin at the age of twelve. Lu received her B.A. in Music Performing Arts from the top music conservatory in China, the Central Conservatory of Music (CCOM).  Upon graduation, Lu decided to continue her studies in the United States. She is currently a third-year student at Columbia University and will receive her M.F.A. in Stage Management in May 2013. Current credits include: ASM for Three Women and AK-47 Sing-Along in the 2010 New York Fringe Festival; SM for Broken Wings, Washing Away, and Birthday Triage; PSM for the musical Golden Poplar in Beijing’s Poly Theatre; PA for Flambé Dreams and PA/Wardrobe Supervisor for A Letter to Harvey Milk at the New York Musical Theatre Festival; PA for Golden Child at Signature Theatre.
 
What is the Yangqin?
The original meaning of the words “yangqin” is different from its modern meaning. The character for “yang” has an original meaning of “foreign”, as the instrument’s origins can be traced back to Persia. However, the character “yang” has developed over history to also mean “acclaimed”. “Qin” simply means “zither”, so together “yangqin” has the meaning of “acclaimed zither”. It is believed that China discovered the dulcimer more than 400 years ago via the Silk Road. The origins of the dulcimer might be linked back to the European clavichord, which may have been adopted and later transformed as it was introduced into Eastern communities. The yangqin is similar to the Western piano in how fundamental it is to China’s musical repetoire. The yangqin is performed either solo or with instruments like the erhu, pipa, and dizi.
 
About the Performance
Jing Lu possesses twenty years of professional stage experience and is one of the few concert yangqin performers residing in New York. This performance presents a dialogue between Eastern and Western musical traditions; provides a great opportunity for spreading Chinese Dulcimer in New York; in addition to traditional Chinese works, Lu will also play pieces from the Western classical repertoire, such as Csárdás, Asturias (Leyenda), and Flight of the Bumblebee. She will also perform together with pipa player Zhou Yi.
 
About Special Guest Zhou Yi
“She has an impressive command of the instrument and of a broad range of its classical, folk, and modern musical literatures…” – The Boston Globe
Zhou Yi has performed in The Peony Pavilion, The Orphan of Zhao and Ghost Lovers at the Lincoln Center Festival, Wen Ji: Eighteen Songs of Nomad Flute at Asia Society, and Second Visit to the Empress with Shen Wei Dance Arts. She has performed in the 2002 and 2004 Spoleto Festival and the 2005 American Dance Festival.
 
About Composer Benoit Granier 
Benoit Granier is a French composer living in Beijing, China. He has studied composition with Artur Gervasony, Guy Rebel, Donnacha Dennehy, Roger Doyle as well as Fergus Johnston at Trinity College, where he completed his Ph.D. in Computer Music and Composition. After working in diverse institutions in both Beijing and Singapore, he settled down at the Centre for Electro Acoustic Music of China (C.E.M.C.), a part of the Beijing Central Conservatory of Music. He is currently teaching Computer Music, and Composition, Digital and interactive Media.
His work has been featured in various festivals, such as Boston’s Music and Culture Diplomacy Symposium, The Beijing Modern Music Festival, The Beijing Musicacoustica Festival, The Gainsville Electronic Music Festival, The International Computer Music Conference, Open Fader, The Santa Fe Festival of Electro-Acoustic Music, and Sounds Electric ‘05.
Over the past ten years, Granier has also been active as both a composer and visual artist. He has written for a large range of instruments, including both solo works and pieces for large orchestra. He has also worked extensively for Mixed Media and Pure Electronics, and recently developed an interest in composition for mixed ensemble that regroups classical formation and traditional forces.
 
What you get 
Benefits of Your Support; This performance will introduce your ears to the exotic charm of the yangqin and allow you to better understand the musical traditions of the Eastern world. This is an opportunity to enjoy Chinese classical repertoire performed by one of the most outstanding yangqin players.
 
Your Support
This performance is an opportunity to not only support one of the world’s best performers of Chinese classical music, but also to finally open the stage to include yangqin. Please support us in our mission to introduce New Yorkers to Chinese music and culture and to share the beauty of this instrument. We hope this performance will pave the way for New York’s most renowned venues to continue performing Chinese music for large audiences. Your support goes directly toward covering the costs of renting Carnegie Hall, designing promotional materials, hiring a production staff, transportation, and compensating the hard work our composer and musicians. Thank you for taking the time to read this and we greatly appreciate any support you can provide.

story:
Who is Micah's Rule?

Micah's Rule is a vocal trio originating from Wilmington, NC. Made up of Alto: Mary Anne Hewett, Baritone: Greg McCaw, Contralto: Chasity Scott, and singing the very best in inspirational, gospel, southern gospel, black gospel, country, and rock stylings with powerful voices and intricate harmonies. Group name originates from the prophet Micah 6:8, "He has told you, O mortal, what is good; and what does the Lord require of you but to do justice, and to love kindness, and to walk humbly with your God?" (NRSV)

What We Need

It is time for us to finally record our first long play recording project. We are all local community volunteers, all barely making ends meet for a livelihood and are unable to provide the capital ourselves to accomplish such a project. We are also all highly trained, gifted, and experienced musicians/singers, and do not care to do anything less than the very best on this project.

On Saturday, October 13, we signed a project contract with the legendary Producer, Mark Moseley, Nashville, TN, Moserite Records, and of legendary Moserite Guitar fame (www.soundcontrolstudio.com)! In addition, we secured simply the finest pianist in the business for the project, Grammy and Dove Award winner, Gordon Mote (www.gordonmote.com)!
 
On Sunday, November 11, we will sojourn back to Nashville and go to work on this project from Monday, November 12 through Tuesday, November 20. We have been successful in raising half the funding necessary to complete our project, and paid half down with the signing of contracts. We need your immediate assistance in raising the other half!

Our goal for this campaign is $20,000. Part of the original $20,000 we've already raised, however, is actually in the form of a $15,000 matching challenge pledge made by a few very dear friends here in Wilmington. They have generously agreed to match dollar for dollar what we raise in this online campaign, up to $15,000! So, every dollar you donate will actually be like two dollars donated! If you donate $100, it will be like donating $200! Please help us meet this pledged funding match!

The Impact of Your Kindness

Wherever Micah’s Rule appears, and for whoever listens to our music, it is our hope that ALL will experience the uplift of loving embrace no matter what their situation of “otherness” might be. We bring a message of justice, mercy and humility, packed in copious amounts of faith, hope and love! And, when we say “ALL” we really, really do mean ALL!

We Would Like to Bless You in return for Your Kindness

For every $50.00 you donate toward our goal, up to $1,000.00 we’d like to give you one of our CD’s, fully autographed by each member of Micah’s Rule. When you give as much as $1,000.00, that’s a total of 20 autographed CD’s to distribute to your friends and family.

When you give $500.00 or more, in addition to at least 10 autographed CD’s, we’ll name you on the CD credits and on our website as a member of our “Sponsor’s Club”.

When you give $1,000.00 or more, in addition to 20 autographed CD’s, we’ll name you on the CD credits and on our website as a member of our “Founder’s Club”.

When you give $2,000.00 or more, in addition to 20 autographed CD’s, we’ll name you on the CD credits and on our website as a member of our “Producer’s Club”, and Micah’s Rule will perform a complimentary special live appearance at a private or public event at your request.*

When you give $4,000.00 or more, in addition to 20 autographed CD’s, we’ll name you on the CD credits and on our website as a member of our “Executive Producer’s Club”, and Micah’s Rule will perform a complementary special live appearance at a private or public event at your request.*

* = Certain limitations apply in agreement to a private or public appearance by Micah’s Rule. No major holidays; date subject to Micah’s Rule availability; any expenses incurred for travel, meals or accommodations must be supplied by the booking party; event must not violate any standards or sensitivities of the members of Micah’s Rule, and must be in keeping with Micah’s Rule’s mission as found in Micah 6:8.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help us with funding at this time, please consider helping us get the word out to others you know that may be able to by sharing the link to this campaign with them directly, or via email, or via Facebook. Also, perhaps you would consider going to our website and pre-purchasing one or more of our soon to be released CD's! The link to this campaign is www.indiegogo.com/micahsrule ; Link to our website: www.micahsrule.com ; Link to our Facebook Page: www.facebook.com/micahsrule ; Link to our Twitter: www.twitter.com/micahsrule .

story:
****PLEASE LEAVE SIZES IN A COMMENT. THANK YOU!****

We are an apparel brand using skateboarding, music & art to combat human trafficking. We need your help to launch our Fall '13 line.

SOUND: Free from moral defect; upright.

The Sound Movement was built off the vision between Jordan Lovelis & Chris Weigele. After years of skateboarding together, their passion to fight human trafficking came full circle. They came together to collaborate in order to make steps towards real change against this injustice.

Phase 1 of how we are going about this is explained in this short film:

We realized that in order to make a difference in the long run, we need sustainable income. This is where the clothing line comes in. We will fund our fight against trafficking through the clothes we sell. The more we sell, the more resources we will have to make a difference around the globe.

By contributing to this campaign your are helping produce our first line.

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Mark Kaplan, from Dallas, Texas. Although, many of you know me as Naked Lens Photography. I document such subcultures as burlesque, body suspension and the Burn community. Photography is my passion; and I share my photos with the world free of charge - http://nakedlens.org

  • The StrobePack is my latest project that fuses photography, music and interactive art. This man /machine combination breaks down the wall between observer and participant, creating more interesting images and an experience for both subjects and observers.

  • Donating to this project not only funds the StrobePack and its journey to Burning Man, but the equipment necessary for Naked Lens Photography to continue into the foreseeable future..

What We Need & What You Get

  • The bulk of the funding will go towards refreshing my photography equipment, specifically two camera bodies with battery grips, two new strobes, additional radio triggers, batteries and a solar power collection unit for rechargeable batteries. (Yes I’m trying to reduce my carbon footprint by going solar)

  • In keeping with the interactive nature of the StrobePack, the perks are primarily aimed at allowing donors to passively interact with the citizens of Black Rock City, through audio messages and music. Of course this funding goes beyond Burningman.

    Through your help Naked Lens Photography can continue to be a resource of free images for many upcoming events.

  •  If the goal isn’t met, any funds will still be applied directly towards photography equipment for the journey. It is my intention to start initially with one camera body and grip, and then move to accessories. As funds permit, I will be adding the additional camera. Any money above the goal will be used for high-grade  equipment, to better withstand the environment of the Playa and possibly more additions and modifications to the StrobePack..

The Impact

  • Simply put, active participation over simple observation makes better photographs; the nature of the StrobePack compliments natural curiosity and invites rather than repels interaction. Additionally, its conspicuousness helps to reduce the “Big Brother” effect. 

  • I feel that my photography both treats its subjects with the respect that they deserve, and provides those outside of the communities a window that will hopefully lead to understanding.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Although the primary goal for this campaign is the journey to Burning Man and collection of images to follow; all of the equipment will be used far beyond that.

story:
Hello IndieGogo!

We are The Brooklyn Blues Project, a NYC-based classic blues band!  Formed in 2011 by five die-hard blues lovers, the BBP (as we like to call ourselves) is all about digging into the best blues tunes ever recorded, by the best artists to ever take up the art—from Robert Johnson and Little Walter, on down to B.B. King, Eric Clapton, The Allman Bros., and more.  By following in the footsteps of these kinds of legends, we seek both to grow as musicians, and to make our audience happy in a way that only the blues can.

The Recording

In the short time we’ve been together, we’ve gotten some very positive attention in the city’s blues scene.  Now, like so many artists before us, we’re looking to get into a recording studio and lay down our interpretations of some classic tunes.  But making an album costs money, which is where lovely-you come in!

The Breakdown

Luckily, we are all city dwellers, and the wonderful recording studio we have our hearts set on is local, so there’s no issue of transportation or housing.  However, our research division (ahem) tells us that covering the cost of recording—from the initial tracking, to the mixing, to the final mastering—on through the actual, physical reproduction and distribution of the album, will run around $8000.  To wit:

-Studio Time (Richard Fabrizio, Engineer): ~$4000

-Mastering (Audio Mastering & Mixing Studio): $700

-CD Replication (Discmakers.com): $1000

-UPC (to legally sell the album): $50

-Download Cards (Soundtrax): $300

-Digital Distribution (iTunes, Spotify, etc): $50

-CD Distribution (CDBaby, Amazon): $1000

-Photo Session (Stefan Tonio, Photog): $250

-BBP T-Shirts: $300

-Custom BBP Guitar Picks (a big hit with fans so far): $50

-Bumper Stickers: $50

-E-blasts (ReverbNation): $15

The Rewards

In return for your support, you will get more than just the satisfaction of helping to usher more good blues music into the world; we also have a ton of treats and prizes for those who pledge, from BBP guitar picks, to signed merch, to one-on-one lessons with band members, and even private performances!

Love and Blues!

Holly, Nick, Marlon, Donald, and Paul

story:
Who we are

Fort York are Connor Lavelle, Kyle Fulton, Dan Lefebvre, Rory Lavelle and Nick Kewin: a group of great friends who love music. We've known each other since we were kids going to sleep-away camp together every summer, where we taught each other how to write and play music. 2 years ago, we finally had the chance to spend some time recording the songs we'd worked on for ages thanks to the help of some old friends. The end was result was Feels Like Then, an 8 track EP that we're incredibly proud of. 

Feels Like Then was a community effort supported by friends and family at every step - recording, producing, mixing, mastering, packaging and distributing. It took over 2 years to get the album out, even though all the songs were written. While it was a success, this time we want to get the music out into the world sooner and without having to rely as much on the generosity of the same few people that helped us in the past. We're so excited that a site like Indiegogo exists that can help us achieve this! 

Why we're doing this

We're hoping that through this campaign, and the EP it hopefully funds, that we'll get the attention of a label, who feel as strongly about our songs as we do. But more than that, we're just eager to share the best version of our new songs with the friends and fans we already have, and we've learnt that unfortunately, this isn't something done cheaply. 

What we need 

In order to record and release this album, we need to pay for:

- Studio Time
- Production
- Mixing
- Mastering
- Promotions and Marketing

We've gotten all our estimates together, and this is going to cost us $3,500.

What you can do

We'd ask that you give our music a listen, and if you like it, consider donating a bit to our project. As your donations come in, we'll start recording! 

What you get

Check out our incentives - they're coool!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to our campaign, we'd love it if you considered one of these options:

  • Get the word out about our campaign (you can use Inidiegogo's Share tool for this purpose!)
  • Connect us to blogger and media friends of yours who might be interested in covering our story.
  • Join our community by following us on Twitter and 'Liking' us on Facebook.

 

Thanks so much for the support!
story_txt:
Who we are
Fort York are Connor Lavelle, Kyle Fulton, Dan Lefebvre, Rory Lavelle and Nick Kewin: a group of great friends who love music. We've known each other since we were kids going to sleep-away camp together every summer, where we taught each other how to write and play music. 2 years ago, we finally had the chance to spend some time recording the songs we'd worked on for ages thanks to the help of some old friends. The end was result was Feels Like Then, an 8 track EP that we're incredibly proud of. 
Feels Like Then was a community effort supported by friends and family at every step - recording, producing, mixing, mastering, packaging and distributing. It took over 2 years to get the album out, even though all the songs were written. While it was a success, this time we want to get the music out into the world sooner and without having to rely as much on the generosity of the same few people that helped us in the past. We're so excited that a site like Indiegogo exists that can help us achieve this! 
Why we're doing this
We're hoping that through this campaign, and the EP it hopefully funds, that we'll get the attention of a label, who feel as strongly about our songs as we do. But more than that, we're just eager to share the best version of our new songs with the friends and fans we already have, and we've learnt that unfortunately, this isn't something done cheaply. 
What we need 
In order to record and release this album, we need to pay for:
- Studio Time- Production- Mixing- Mastering- Promotions and Marketing
We've gotten all our estimates together, and this is going to cost us $3,500.
What you can do
We'd ask that you give our music a listen, and if you like it, consider donating a bit to our project. As your donations come in, we'll start recording! 
What you get
Check out our incentives - they're coool!
Other Ways You Can Help


If you can't contribute to our campaign, we'd love it if you considered one of these options:

Get the word out about our campaign (you can use Inidiegogo's Share tool for this purpose!)
Connect us to blogger and media friends of yours who might be interested in covering our story.
Join our community by following us on Twitter and 'Liking' us on Facebook.

 
Thanks so much for the support!

story:
Check out these awesome 25 second videos supporting Search & Restore's Jazz2012 campaign:

Joshua Redman: http://vimeo.com/32796855
Medeski, Martin & Wood: http://vimeo.com/32557967
Chris Dingman: http://vimeo.com/32481605
Deerhoof: http://vimeo.com/32759407

*****

Search & Restore is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization dedicated to the new jazz and improvised music scene, grown out of a love for improvisation and bringing audiences and artists together in new ways. Since founded in 2007 by Adam Schatz, it has grown into one of the most exciting new jazz organizations around.

With the $75,000 raised last year through Kickstarter, S&R created a welcoming, dynamic new home for the new jazz and improvised music scene with SearchAndRestore.com and presented the Winter Jazzfest, Undead Jazzfest, and the Spontaneous Construction series at the Blue Note.

Now Search & Restore has huge plans for 2012. We hope to strengthen our infrastructure and presence as a non-profit, and take increased steps towards bringing this music to more people around the world. Rather than become reliant on large donors or grant funding, we are attempting to identify a participatory audience through our fundraising. If 8,000 people give $25, we'll have our entire 2012 budget taken care of, supported by 8,000 fans of the music. It's cheap! It supports a good cause! It connects a fan base for the music! It's TAX DEDUCTIBLE! So if you are excited by what we're doing, please donate $25. We believe in the power of word of mouth, so if you believe in us, send this on to 10 people. 

Now, of course, you are welcome to donate more than $25. We are incredibly grateful for all the support we've received so far, and feel a true commitment to everyone who gives to Search & Restore. We promise to give back with creative presentations of the new jazz and improvised music that is growing in New York and beyond.

To find out more about Search & Restore, and see many of the videos we've shot so far, head over to http://SearchAndRestore.com, and sign up for the email list to be kept in the loop.

Search & Restore's 2012 Plan is below, where all the money we're trying to raise will be going. Below that is a press release for the new website and fundraiser as well.

Thank you so much for your support! Without it, we would not be able to continue.

THE SEARCH AND RESTORE 2012 PLAN


Here To Stay: A Residency Project

Once a month, Search And Restore will present a 3-night run for different artist, either three of their different groups, or the same group for all the nights, giving artists who would never have a chance to showcase for more than one or two nights a chance to grow musically with an audience. Each night will have a different supporting group, exposing them to a larger audience as well.

House Concert Series

An improvised house concert series focusing on higher production value audio video, with three artists each performing a short solo set then a collaborative one. There will be a small audience present, but the focus will be on documenting the spontaneous experience with multiple camera angles and multi track audio. Funds raised will be used to pay the artists, record recording expenses, and use Search And Restore.com as a way to distribute the content to fans of improvised music around the world.

 

Search And Restore.com

Search & Restore will continue to document live shows throughout the city and building artist pages for the performing musicians within SearchAndRestore.com, constantly expanding the home base for the scene online.

 

Festivals

Funds raised for the Winter & Undead Jazzfests will allow us to have a basic budget to better compensate the artists, pursue more marketing approaches, and drive us to take exciting risks with programming and alternative performance spaces. We’ll also be developing relationships outside of New York and researching the best ways to bring these festivals to new cities and countries, such as San Francisco, Madison, Washington DC, Boston, and Portland.

Operating Costs

Search & Restore is a young organization, and we are in need of a proper office space as well as a few additional employees to ensure these new programs are carried out and promoted properly. We will also be hiring a full time publicist and grant writer, and develop a more cohesive marketing plan for the website so that we can reach new jazz fans who love the music but don't have a way of accessing it on a frequent basis.

Podcast: Making It Up As We Go

A weekly podcast series interviewing artists from all ends of the spectrum about improvisation will move between dialogue and live performance. Through this we aim to create more content to engage fans of the music with the artists online, and to provide a new method for the general public to hear how these artists approach improvisation and the music as a whole.



PRESS RELEASE!!

Jazz Organizers Search & Restore Announce New Web Site, And A Second Major Fundraising Campaign

 

Gumption is an old fashioned word, so it’s odd that it aptly fits the ongoing efforts of the squad behind Search & Restrore, a new-fangled team of arts advocates bent on raising the visibility of modern jazz. With the much-anticipated relaunch of its Web site (www.searchandrestore.com), and the kick-off of its second major fundraising campaign, the S&R team, led by musician/organizer/entrepreneur Adam Schatz, is proving that their mission remains fueled by a blend of vision and effort.

 

The new searchandrestore.com is packed with the fruits of the organization’s 2011 labors. Last year, as reported by the New York Times, Wall Street Journal and other major publications, Schatz and company successfully reached their goal of raising $75K through Kickstarter. Their promise was to further their work by documenting a wealth of live performances by artists on the far-reaching New York jazz and improvisational music scene. They’ve done so; the new site holds terrific-looking concert clips by such innovative artists as Fred Hersch, Joe McPhee, Nels Cline, and Matthew Shipp. This kind of content, shot at clubs and music spaces around the city, brings immediacy to the listening experience. Devoted fans and newly interested viewers now have a much richer experience when it comes to understanding an artist’s latest moves.   

 

It’s a really exciting feeling,” says Schatz. “Creating something that wasn’t there before is cool. Reaching audiences around the world who know the scene exists, but don’t know where to find out more about it, is a thrill. And so is the flip side: reaching all the people don’t even know this fantastic music exists in the first place.”

 

You can see a one-time-only ensemble of Uri Caine, Jenny Scheinman, Theo Bleckman and Todd Sickafoose crossweave all sorts of intricate lines during one of S&R's "Spontaneous Construction" evenings at the Blue Note - a marvel of improvisation. Over 50 high-def clips have been uploaded to individual artist pages, and more are on their way. In total, they help tell an increasingly nuanced story about how this music was made at the beginning of the new millennium.

 

Search & Restore wants to bring even more new listeners to the music in 2012. That’s why they’re announcing a fundraising campaign with specific donation goals. For 30 days, from November 10 to December 10, they’re seeking 8000 individual donors to participate by pledging $25 towards their mission. 

 

Those who pledge will enjoy immediate premiums. Each day of the campaign will be sponsored by a discrete group of 20 artists who’ll reward donations with a download of 20 original works. Further: Each day will see the premiere of a video featuring a short improvisation from each artist. It will also be that artist's day to explain the fundraiser to their fans, creating an inclusive and exponential approach towards fundraising and audience-identification. 

 

The resultant $200K will be earmarked for the continuation of the video performance campaign and the Web site upkeep, as well as upgrades to the ongoing concert promotion efforts (S&R have a major hand in the Winter JazzFest and Undead Jazz Fest), the launching of a podcast interview series, the establishment of a “house concert series” that will offer refined audio and video aesthetics while providing unique concert intimacy, the formalization of publicity department, securing much-needed office space, and the establishment Each is a logical upgrade for a team bent on bringing the music to a larger population.

 

"We want to keep growing as fast as we have been, but we want to get it right - bolster some of the structure," concludes Schatz. "The music, the musicians, and the audience deserves nothing less. I think at this point people understand what we're going for, and they want to participate on some level. The door is open right now."

story:
Hi, I'm Jon

    I am an independent country artist, who was born and raised in South Jersey. I fell in love with music at an early age and began to learn how to play music shortly after. I've always been in bands so I have been playing out and performing for the past few years.

    About 5 years ago I started listening to country music and that was it, I was hooked. So being a musician and all I decided to continue my journey as a solo artist and I said to myself, "hey, why not play country, it's something I love." So here I am today writing my first country record.

 
 

 What I Need, What You Get

    A lot of you know that recording an album can get very expensive. It's not just recording, it's pressing, mixing, mastering distribution and promotion. Last September I flew down to Nashville to record 2 songs, which are currently my two singles that I've recently put out. I funded that whole trip by myself, but this one I wont be so fortunate.

    This time I need your help. The $2500 will only cover recording cost but I am going to attempt to pay out all of the other costs on my own. If you contribute there are a bunch of great rewards that vary for each ammount of funds you contribute. Even if you can only contribute ten dollars or just spread the word, your contribution is greatly appreciated!

 

 The Impact

    By helping me you're not only allowing me to go forth and achieve my dream of making my own country record but the reason that I make music is because of you the people. There are no short cuts when it comes to making a record and I can promise you that you will not be disappointed! I will do what ever it takes to make this something that you will love and enjoy as much as I will.

Another Way For You To Help!

    Another way for you to help with the making of this record is to help by spreading the word. With all of the social networking platforms out these days they're the best way to let people know whats going on! So if you have a minute please take the time to share this page with all of your friends! Thank you, and God Bless!

story:
We are The Sacramento Arts Collective, aka The SAC. Currently we are trying to generate funds for a building we have been leasing for the last couple months. Inside we have been renovating, cleaning, building, etc. Now we need some help with the final stages.

Our vision is simple. A hub for every kind of artist. Currently we are opening a music venue, classrooms, and a store for local artist to sell their goods. We need your help because we want a push to finally get our doors open. We are constantly being asked by the public when they can play and when they can put their goods in our store. We just want to finally have a final date set because of such demand.

Its our goal to have a place that changes the dynamic of the Music and Art industry. We want a place where a person can come in, learn to paint, use our supplies to paint it, and finally sell it there. We want a place where a musician can come in, rehearse, record an albumb, and have a place to sell it. This in a way gives everyone a chance to become an artist because simply, if you create or have ideas, you ARE an artist.

For those who can't donate. Spread the word. Pass this along to anyone and everyone who you think could. Actually, even the ones you know who can't cause chances are they know someone who can. Start getting involved in your local scene. Make some noise next time your local schools are trying to cut music and art funding.

At the end of the day, our want is simple. Self-expression is one of the most important things on the planet. It leads to ideas. It leads to imagination. It leads to creativity and individulality. If you agree, then give helping hand. HELP FEED THE ARTISTS!!!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mike Bravener and at the age of 40 I left my job as a full-time clergyman to enter the entertainment business. I have been doing my Elvis Impersonation now for 11 years and have never been to Vegas. This year I was 1 of only 30 Pro Elvis Tribute Artists to perform in Las Vegas in July at what was The Hilton Showroom. I will also be performing in and around Las Vegas for promoters.
I have been squeaking by as an entertainer but have yet to get a big break. I still teach guitar, and work at a bookstore to bread on the table. I'm hoping something happens soon.

What I Need & What You Get

 

I need to fly my wife and I to Las Vegas, and have a little cash for food and hotel while I'm there. The promoters have given us a cheap hotel rate and will help to feed us, but there will be some costs

At my age of 51 I realise that Elvis was 42 when he passed away and with the shape I'm in and my looks I can still do a legit tribute for another 8 years or so, that's why I got invited! I also have a cd called "Coverin Hank" that I just released and with your contribution of $20.00 I would love to send you an autographed copy! I have gotten excellent reviews on this self recorded project and it has hit the stores yet. It features 11 Hank Williams Senior tunes and 3 of my original songs. 1 of those tunes made it to the Top 20 new songs for New Brunswick last month on CBC radio

If I don't reach my  goal, I will use the funds to towards my next full length cd of original songs. I will start recording that in the fall of 2013. BUT I WILL REACH MY GOAL!!

The Impact

 

  • At 51 I still have a dream! That dream is to make a full-time living at bringing smiles to people's faces
  • I would love to tell people that yes I have performed in VEGAS on the same stage Elvis did for his VEGAS years
  • Help me make this a reality because these offers don't come every day. With over 30,000 pro Elvii in the world, the promoters asked only 30 - that is an incredible honor.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this time please tell your friends and remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

If you can't contribute at this time please tell your friends and remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

THe Balcony Scene started a few years ago, and now it is time for the first release. The Balcony Scene is a indie folk type, and is a solo project of Justin Moody.

What We Need & What You Get

Five Dollars will get you a download copy of the album and much thanks!

 

Ten Dollars will get you a hard copy, and download copy of the album.

 

Twenty Dollars will get you a T-Shirt, Hard Copy, Download copy, and a special Balcony Scene Sticker!

 

Anything above twenty dollars will be greatly appreciated, and well worth your ears!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, do not worry. You can help by spreading the word, or this link. You can check out my facebook page, and show it to friends!

story:
Who we are

Halocene is a 100% independently run band. We self-manage and self-produce everything ourselves. We've opened for bands like Blink 182, Fall Out Boy, Jimmy Eat World, Warped Tour, and more with no record labels (just hard work and fan support)! We are happy to announce that March 1 of 2013, we will be setting off on our first co-headlining US tour with the Epic Proportions Tour! *We even get to ride on a full sized TOUR BUS!! 

What We Need

We're trying to raise a minimum of $1,000. This will go a long way! Especially since some of us are quitting our jobs to tour.

We get requests from you (our fans) constantly to tour and come to your town. Please help us fund our project so that we can continue to grow and make our way into every corner of the country, if not globe!

What You Get (Exclusives!)

We're releasing a new limited edition Halocene Covers album (Volumes 1 and 2) free to our fans who help fund this tour. Think of this campaign as a CD launch, and a tour launch!

*Great for fans of: A Day To Remember, Four Year Strong,Taylor Swift, The Beatles, Katy Perry, Britney Spears, Whitney Houston, Maroon 5, Usher, Yellowcard, Rihanna, punk rock, Christmas songs, and more!

Over a dozen new unreleased tracks, as well other limited edition grabs (shirts, bracelets/wristbands, b-sides, posters, etc)!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Try using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Blast us around on Facebook

And that’s all there is to it!

story:
Yoga and music are about making connections. We connect yoga with music and yogis and musicians with community.

We're very excited about making this music CD and in fact we've already started. But a lot of the times when independent artists make CD's, they take out expensive loans which often times get paid out of the artists pockets. So VISA becomes the producer, and takes a lot of the profits.

We'd like to try a new model, so in the spirit of connecting people, we are reaching out to our wonderful community of yogis and musicians. We're not asking for handouts. Everyone who contributes gets CD's, downloads and other goodies for their money.

This way, everyone gets involved, everyone benefits and we keep our money in the community, so we know where it gets spent. Most of the money we intend to receive will be directly going to the project costs solely.

Speaking of which, here's a breakdown of where the money will go:

Manufacturing (1,000 copies)   $1,100

Recording $1,500 (thanks to generous discounts of friends! Jason Sonier is our sound engineer for the project)

Photography, video and design $500

Marketing, publicity and administration $500

Indie Go Go/ Pay Pal fees $300

So a bare-bones production like this still costs $3,600 or more. With the funds collected from this IndieGogo campaign, we'll be able to make the CD, everyone will get their copies and we'll all be prosperous!

Should we make more than the alloted amount here, it'll all go into furthering the development of the product. Things like:

- Paying artists to create our album art

- Travel costs to spread the Ottawa Yoga Community love beyond this city

- Postage costs for sending the kit beyond Ottawa

- Pay guest musicians on album

Our intention is to let this be a beacon of light to highlight what the blossoming Yoga Community in Ottawa is capable of creating collectively. We plan to travel and share this music nationally and internationally. We want to share the love and bliss of the duo of yoga and music with anyone who is open to this transformative experience.

Devin and Tara have been collaborating on live music and yoga classes since 2007. The beauty of their collaboration is the depth of Devin's extensive and eclectc array of musical experience and practice; along with Tara's extensive and thorough study of the science of sound, yogic chant, and the depth/correlation of specific chants/sounds and yoga postures. She believes that the pairing of a sound or chant sensitive music soundtrack with a typical yoga flow can deepen the effects of the practice within the yogi on both a physical, mental, spiritual and ethereal level.

We are born with the rhythm of our heart, and we are vibrational beings.

And so positive or healing sound coupled with intentional movement is the recipe for bhakti and asana bliss. Feedback repeatedly shared from students who have attended Bhavan2 classes state, "That was the BEST class I've ever had in my life. I feel amazing." or "I come to this class in a cloud, and I leave feeling uplifted and transformed."

If music has the power to bring so many people together, Bhavan2 works to bridge the gap of positive sound with positive movement.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

We repeat! Please, please, pretty please with sprinkles and cherries spread the word!

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.
