story:
LES ARTS SOLIDAIRES: C’EST FINI!

Vicky Paradis, Abel Maxwell, Annie St-Pierre et David Muipatayi sont passionnés autant par les causes sociales que par toutes les formes d’arts. Sachant que les écoles de notre province proposent à leurs étudiants une multitude de programmes artistiques, ils ont conçus un concept de spectacle original de sensibilisation contre l’intimidation mais aussi en apporter des solutions. Durant un spectacle musical d’une durée d’une heure, les artistes en profiteront pour sensibiliser les jeunes contre ce fléau qui affecte plusieurs vies autour de nous. Au delà de la sensibilisation, les artistes désirent offrir un suivi durable et personnalisé par l’intermédiaire d’un Site web qui sera à la disposition de chaque jeune afin d’échanger avec les artistes.


L’INTIMIDATION est un problème relationnel qui consiste à avoir recours à la force et à la violence pour faire souffrir l’autre. L’enfant qui intimide apprend à utiliser la force et l’agression pour contrôler ses pairs. L’enfant victime d’intimidation se trouve coincé dans une relation où on abuse de lui; il aura besoin d’aide pour que cesse l’intimidation. Cette forme d’agression peut être physique, verbale ou non verbale; l’intimidation peut avoir lieu dans un face à face, elle peut se faire dans le dos de la victime ou via internet (cyberintimidation). Les actes d’intimidation prennent diverse formes, y compris l’exclusion, le bavardage malveillant, le harcèlement racial et sexuel ou l’homophobie.



LES OBJECTIFS

Adhérer au projet C’EST FINI! c’est…

  • Sensibiliser les jeunes (élèves) contre ce fléau qui dure depuis trop longtemps;
  • Entretien de 30 à 45 min. entre les jeunes et les artistes avant ou après les spectacles;
  • Créer un suivi et une sensibilisation constante pour les jeunes à l’aide d’un Site web (courriels et vidéos) Les artistes auront l’opportunité de répondre aux élèves par des messages d’encouragements audio-visuels personnalisés;
  • Fournir des bracelets promotionnels C'EST FINI! Où sera inscrit le Site web de la campagne, cela donnerait un sentiment d'appartenance et de soutien aux jeunes. Les bracelets seront distribués gratuitement après chaque spectacle pour établir le lien entre les jeunes et les artistes.

Le Site web sera interactif animé par les artistes afin de permettre aux élèves de se ressourcer en cas de besoin avec des conseils et des messages d’encouragements.


DÉROULEMENT DU PROJET

  • Rencontre entre les jeunes et les artistes avant ou après les spectacles
  • Spectacles de 4 artistes de 4 styles musicaux différents sur la même scène
  • Suivi par courriel et Site web avec les élèves intéressés
  • Messages d'encouragements par le biais de vidéos personnalisés adressés aux jeunes par l'artiste de leurs choix
  • Donner la possibilité aux élèves de créer un profile sur le Site web pour sécuriser les réponses qui leurs sont adressées par l'artiste de leur choix

Les artistes fourniront à chaque école participante des outils de promotion (affiches, bracelets de sensibilisation, pamphlets de sensibilisation, etc.)



QUAND LES ARTS SE METTENT AU SERVICE DE LA JEUNESSE…

Chaque artiste qui participe à ce projet a vécu différents styles d'intimidations ici au Canada ou ailleurs dans le monde. Aujourd'hui, en temps qu'artistes émergents et influents ils s'unissent pour contribuer au bien-être des jeunes au sein de leurs communautés.

L'ORIGINE DE LEUR MOTIVATION

VICKY PARADIS – Adulte contemporain

Ayant connu la scène musicale dès l'âge de 4 ans, l'enfance de Vicky Paradis n'a rien de commun. Elle a vécue des choses extraordinaires mais, également une pression accrue de son entourage qui s'est transformée en quelque sorte à l'intimidation. N'ayant pas droit à l'erreur, cette pression a pesée sur elle durant de longues années. Cette pression constante s'est aussi étalée sur les bancs des écoles sous forme de jalousie et de rejet.

Les parents de Vicky Paradis découvrent son talent dès l’âge de 4 ans. En 1988, alors qu’elle a seulement 6 ans, elle signe son premier contrat de disque. En 1993, à l’âge de 10 ans, elle lance son premier album solo avec l’étroite collaboration de Rick Allison (Lara Fabian), Marc Beaulieu (Roch Voisine) et Eddy Marnay (Céline Dion)  


ABEL MAXWELL – Pop / R&B

La musique et les textes d'Abel inspire et motive de ne jamais baisser les bras face aux embûches de la vie. La persévérance et l'amour du prochain sont les portes-flambeaux de ses textes. Abel Maxwell croit en toute sincérité que l'estime de soi est l'arme ultime contre l'intimidation et la violence chez nos jeunes. Il veut à la fois divertir et éduquer pour de meilleurs lendemains dans une perspective collective et positive.

Abel Maxwell commence le piano au tendre âge de six ans en passant par les conservatoires nationaux de Lyon et d’Amsterdam. Arrivé au Canada en 2007, Abel inspire à travers sa musique aux couleurs de la soul-pop et jazz.. En 2010, il participe au festival international de Jazz de Montréal, en 2011 au festival de Jazz de Québec, en 2012 au festival international de jazz d’Ottawa avec le pianiste international Miguel de Armas (Cuba).


ANNIE ST-PIERRE Pop / Rock

Annie a subi l'intimidation, l'abus verbal et sexuel dès son jeune âge. Pétrifiée par la honte et le manque de considération, son refuge a été la musique. Annie croît sincèrement que sa passion musicale qui en grande partie aide et encourage à se sortir des situations difficiles et à surmonter la pente et solidifier un estime de soi.

Annie St-Pierre est une chanteuse, élevée dans la région d'Ottawa qui tire son expérience vocale du ''Gospel''. Depuis sa tendre enfance. Son rêve est de pouvoir encourager de nombreuses vies avec sa voix et sa musique.


DAVID MUIPATAYI (ZPN) – Musique urbaine – Rap / Hip Hop

Après plus de 10 ans au service de la francophonie ontarienne, ZPN a toujours été près des jeunes par le biais d'albums, de spectacles scolaires et d'ateliers d'écritures. David est un citoyen du monde, il a vécu en Afrique, en Europe et maintenant en Amérique du nord. Tous ces déplacements lui ont permis d'avoir une perspective de vie multidimensionnelle et une grande ouverture d'esprit. Toutes ses expériences lui ont permis de comprendre le malaise et le sentiment de solitude qu'un jeune peut ressentir parce que lui même s'est retrouvé à plusieurs reprises étranger donc, des fois mis de côté.

Son premier album solo, intitulé «Le masque de Z», paraît en 2003 et lui vaut plusieurs honneurs, dont le prix Trille Or de la Découverte de l’année et une nomination au Gala de l’Adisq. En 2006, ZPN récidive avec un deuxième album, «Sacrifices» En 2011, il revient avec PREMIÈRE CLASSE et continue de faire réfléchir le monde sur le racisme, la guerre, la violence, le respect de la femme 

Les fonds amassés serviront à:

FINANCER LA TOURNÉE

- monter un Site Web interactif

- la location d'équipements musicaux pour la tournée scolaire

- la production des bracelets CFINI

- la production des T-shirts C FINI 


LA TOURNÉE SCOLAIRE DÉBUTERA EN MARS 2014



Voici les contreparties que les artistes proposent:

25$: VOUS OBTENEZ 2 BRACELETS (EN SILICONE) OFFICIEL DU PROJET C FINI - 4 BILLETS V.I.P. 2 ADULTES  2 ENFANTS (POUR DES SPECTACLES HORS RÉSEAU SCOLAIRE) AVEC SIÈGES RSERVÉS À L'AVANT SCÈNE.


50$ : 2 BRACELETS - 4 BILLETS V.I.P. 2 ADULTES  2 ENFANTS (POUR DES SPECTACLES HORS RÉSEAU SCOLAIRE) AVEC SIÈGES RSERVÉS À L'AVANT SCÈNE - 1 CD D’UN DES 4 ARTISTES DE VOTRE CHOIX - 5 POSTERS DU PROJETS AUTOGRAPHIÉS 

100$ : 2 BRACELETS - 4 BILLETS V.I.P. 2 ADULTES  2 ENFANTS (POUR DES SPECTACLES HORS RÉSEAU SCOLAIRE) AVEC SIÈGES RSERVÉS À L'AVANT SCÈNE - 5 POSTERS DU PROJETS AUTOGRAPHIÉS - L'ALBUM DES 4 ARTISTES (4 ALBUMS)

200$ :  2 BRACELETS - 4 BILLETS V.I.P. 2 ADULTES  2 ENFANTS (POUR DES SPECTACLES HORS RÉSEAU SCOLAIRE) AVEC SIÈGES RSERVÉS À L'AVANT SCÈNE - 10 POSTERS DU PROJETS AUTOGRAPHIÉS - L'ALBUM DES 4 ARTISTES (4 ALBUMS) - 5 T-SHIRTS OFFICIELS DU PROJET C FINI

500$ : POUR LES ENTREPRISES - VOTRE LOGO ET LIEN SITEWEB DE VOTRE COMPAGNIE SUR LA PAGE PRINCIPALE DU SITEWEB OFFICIEL DU PROJET - MENTION ET REMERCIEMENT DE VOTRE ENTREPRISE APRÈS CHAQUE SPECTACLE - LOGO DE VOTRE ENTREPRISE SUR LES COMMUNIQUES DE PRESSE 

1000$ : SPECTACLE PRIVÉ  D'UNE HEURE (OUTAOUAIS - OTTAWA) POUR L'EXTÉRIEUR DE CES  2 RÉGIONS DES FRAIS SUPLÉMENTAIRES SERONT EXIGÉS

1250$ : RÉSERVÉ AUX CONSEILS SCOLAIRES – 1 SPECTACLE D’UNE HEURE - AVANT OU APRÈS LE SPECTACLE UN ATELIER DE VOTRE CHOIX (CHANT, MUSIQUE OU ÉCRITURE)


Si les 75,000$ ne sont pas amassés, nous réviserons le nombre des spectacles à la baisse.


L'IMPACT

Nous sommes devant un besoin universel, la lutte contre l'intimidation dans les écoles. Nous pensons que c'est de notre devoir de citoyen de nous impliquer activement  afin d'éradiquer  ce fléau qui empoisonne le bien être de certains jeunes dans nos écoles et qui pourrait avoir des répercussions néfastes pour leur avenir.  

Chaque artiste participe déjà activement dans les écoles sous forme d'ateliers de  musique, écriture et de chant 

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, vous pouvez quand même contribuer en::

  • faire passer le mot au sujet de notre campagne.
  • en utilisant les outils de partage IndieGoGo!

Son premier album solo, intitulé «Le masque de Z», paraît en 2003 et lui vaut plusieurs honneurs, dont le prix Trille Or de la Découverte de l’année et une nomination au Gala de l’Adisq. En 2006, ZPN récidive avec un deuxième album, «Sacrifices» En 2011, il revient avec PREMIÈRE CLASSE et continue de faire réfléchir le monde sur le racisme, la guerre, la violence, le respect de la femme 
Les fonds amassés serviront à:
FINANCER LA TOURNÉE
- monter un Site Web interactif
- la location d'équipements musicaux pour la tournée scolaire
- la production des bracelets CFINI
- la production des T-shirts C FINI 

LA TOURNÉE SCOLAIRE DÉBUTERA EN MARS 2014
Voici les contreparties que les artistes proposent:
25$: VOUS OBTENEZ 2 BRACELETS (EN SILICONE) OFFICIEL DU PROJET C FINI - 4 BILLETS V.I.P. 2 ADULTES  2 ENFANTS (POUR DES SPECTACLES HORS RÉSEAU SCOLAIRE) AVEC SIÈGES RSERVÉS À L'AVANT SCÈNE.
50$ : 2 BRACELETS - 4 BILLETS V.I.P. 2 ADULTES  2 ENFANTS (POUR DES SPECTACLES HORS RÉSEAU SCOLAIRE) AVEC SIÈGES RSERVÉS À L'AVANT SCÈNE - 1 CD D’UN DES 4 ARTISTES DE VOTRE CHOIX - 5 POSTERS DU PROJETS AUTOGRAPHIÉS 
100$ : 2 BRACELETS - 4 BILLETS V.I.P. 2 ADULTES  2 ENFANTS (POUR DES SPECTACLES HORS RÉSEAU SCOLAIRE) AVEC SIÈGES RSERVÉS À L'AVANT SCÈNE - 5 POSTERS DU PROJETS AUTOGRAPHIÉS - L'ALBUM DES 4 ARTISTES (4 ALBUMS)
200$ :  2 BRACELETS - 4 BILLETS V.I.P. 2 ADULTES  2 ENFANTS (POUR DES SPECTACLES HORS RÉSEAU SCOLAIRE) AVEC SIÈGES RSERVÉS À L'AVANT SCÈNE - 10 POSTERS DU PROJETS AUTOGRAPHIÉS - L'ALBUM DES 4 ARTISTES (4 ALBUMS) - 5 T-SHIRTS OFFICIELS DU PROJET C FINI
500$ : POUR LES ENTREPRISES - VOTRE LOGO ET LIEN SITEWEB DE VOTRE COMPAGNIE SUR LA PAGE PRINCIPALE DU SITEWEB OFFICIEL DU PROJET - MENTION ET REMERCIEMENT DE VOTRE ENTREPRISE APRÈS CHAQUE SPECTACLE - LOGO DE VOTRE ENTREPRISE SUR LES COMMUNIQUES DE PRESSE 
1000$ : SPECTACLE PRIVÉ  D'UNE HEURE (OUTAOUAIS - OTTAWA) POUR L'EXTÉRIEUR DE CES  2 RÉGIONS DES FRAIS SUPLÉMENTAIRES SERONT EXIGÉS
1250$ : RÉSERVÉ AUX CONSEILS SCOLAIRES – 1 SPECTACLE D’UNE HEURE - AVANT OU APRÈS LE SPECTACLE UN ATELIER DE VOTRE CHOIX (CHANT, MUSIQUE OU ÉCRITURE)




Si les 75,000$ ne sont pas amassés, nous réviserons le nombre des spectacles à la baisse.

L'IMPACT

Nous sommes devant un besoin universel, la lutte
contre l'intimidation dans les écoles. Nous pensons que c'est de notre devoir de
citoyen de nous impliquer activement  afin d'éradiquer  ce fléau qui empoisonne le bien être de
certains jeunes dans nos écoles et qui pourrait avoir des répercussions
néfastes pour leur avenir.  


Chaque artiste participe déjà activement dans les écoles sous forme d'ateliers de  musique, écriture et de chant 
Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, vous pouvez quand même contribuer en::

faire passer le mot au sujet de notre campagne.
en utilisant les outils de partage IndieGoGo!

story:
Ray Condo was a country-swing, rockabilly legend, and one of the more colourful characters of Toronto's Queen Street (80's and 90's) scene.  I'm Gayle Hurmuses, a documentary photographer, and for 19 years, I had the great pleasure to co-manage, book and publicize his band The Hardrock Goners. I also photographed, filmed and video-taped the band for nearly two decades. With Ray's passing in 2004, I assembled an exhibition of 20 images: “I wish that it had been a dream” as a tribute. To mark the 10th anniversary of his passing, I will be using those photographs as the foundation of Ray Condo’s Rock ‘n’ Roll Party! a memoir about Ray and his bands, The Hardrock Goners and The Ricochets.

This 40 page book  would include 50 – 70 images, personal recollections, and shared stories about Ray and the community around him. To make this happen, I need your help.

Publishing the Memoir will require $15,000 to cover the cost of producing and distributing the book. Ray was an important part of Rockabilly history and I want to produce a book that paints a picture of who he was, from the inside. As a fan of Ray Condo, or rockabilly, you can help make that happen and get some cool stuff for yourself…most importantly, the book!

I’m also offering some photographic prints from the memorial exhibition "I wish that it had been a dream", animation cels from "Barroom Crazy", a limited edition t-shirt, a "Zelig Edition" of the book, and more. Perk packages include mailing costs within North America and Europe, other locations may require additional postage.

Your contribution will help selecting, scanning, and preparing images for print, writing, editing, book design and layout, distribution, promotion, developing the website, and it will help ensure that there is an archive of Ray Condo history in print for future fans of the music.

Although it won’t be possible to thank you enough for your contribution, I’m going to try. Within 14 days of your contribution and confirmation of your address, you will be sent a limited edition postcard hand signed by me thanking you. There will be pages on both the book and the website thanking contributors to the project by name, (unless you wish to be ‘anonymous’) and with your book you will receive a frameable, hand-signed Certificate of Appreciation.

Meanwhile, thanks just for reading this!

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~

Regarding the budget, contribution levels were set to cover postage costs throughout Canada, the US, and Europe. 

The campaign budget was set to allow for the books to be produced regardless of the amount that is collected by the campaign. 

If I get the full amount, it will allow me to budget for two months of research and development (scanning new images, writing, and design), in addition to the time spent mailing out the books...and I'll be able to print a quantity of books (2500) that will allow me eventually to be fully compensated for my time. 

If the goal is not met, then the books will be printed on demand, at a much higher rate, and I'll end up needing to donate my time to the project....and won't have the ability to recover my labour costs down the line. 

I won't be collecting compensation for my time until the hard costs of printing & mailing are covered. 

I'm often asked why I am doing this, so a longer note on my motivations follows the section on Ray. 

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~

Ray Condo (Tremblay) died on April 15, 2004, just a month short of his 54th birthday on May 16, almost 19 years to the day after we met. From our first meeting to his death, Ray was a mentor, friend and an inspiration to me and to countless others. It’s time that he was honoured with a book about his life and art.  

Ray lived life without compromise, never doing anything that didn't have meaning to him on a personal level. Sometimes he'd do things that drove his friends nuts, and would neglect to do things that would lead to the success his talent merited.  

In performance he was always electrifying, and every show was amazing no matter how sick he might be... in 1986, I was in Vancouver for The Hardrock Goners entire 6 week engagement at Expo 86. The band played shows every day and night but one. At the end, Ray's voice was tired and showing the strain... but he was still a wild man on stage, tapping into the very core of rock and roll.  

As his childhood friend Andy Tait commented, "Ray always seemed so frail and weak... but you would go on tour with him and see what his life on the road was like and be shocked at just how strong he had to be to live like that...it's strange to think he's gone."

Ray may be gone, but his spirit lives on. The campaign to create the book began on August 10, 2013 and has already gained 410 active fans. The Indiegogo campaign launched 5pm on the Saturday of the Labour Day long weekend, to coincide with a Rockabilly festival in Montreal and in 5 days, collected $1020 in contributions from around the world. This happened with an advertising spend to date of $25.

Pictures that will be used in the book were shot in Toronto at The Cameron House, The Horseshoe, and Sneaky Dee's, as well as at my home; others were shot in Montreal, Vancouver, England, Wales, and Las Vegas, and span the period from 1986 -1999.

His death left an empty space in the world of country swing, and a hole in the hearts of his many friends, but his legend lives on and will be made tangible with the publication of this book.

 

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~

My reasons for doing this project are varied and deep, but the story below is a powerful driver.  

As mentioned above, Ray and I were friends for 19 years, and I used to co-manage The Hardrock Goners in the late 80s and early 90s. I partly did this because I was a huge fan and wanted to see them perform more often, and partly to learn the skills needed for my own work as a documentary photographer/videographer. 

Consequently, I photographed them extensively. Ray and I spoke of this work in one of our last conversations. After the European/Australian tour, he and the Goners planned to do a 3 city mini tour to celebrate the 20th anniversary of the band. I was going to organize an exhibition of photographs of the band to coincide.

At that point, I had pretty much given up actively doing anything photography related. Ray was on me to do more new work and to exhibit again...and to put some of the work in book form. I was excited about getting back to it by putting that show on. 

We had also spoken of his desire for fame and his frustration at its elusiveness…and then he brought up his heart problems. He’d had two heart attacks in the previous few months and was struggling to live the kind of whole-grain, ascetic lifestyle that would have helped him avoid further issues.

There is a lot more to that conversation that is worth telling a story about, but that will likely end up in the book and it’s probably better to write it at leisure than simply to dash it off...although this letter may serve as the basis of my personal statement, which is really missing from the indiegogo page...what is there is more of a project pitch.

In the end though, I made a gallows joke that cracked him up, and promised him that if he died before he became famous, I’d do my part to help make it still happen. So, that’s two promises in one conversation that I still owe him.

It’s nearly 10 years later, and one promise is partially fulfilled. I did have the show, although being rushed by Ray’s death, it was not exactly what I had wanted. Completing the second half of the first promise is part of keeping the second promise.

Gayle Hurmuses

story:
Thank you all for the support you've shown me! If you'd still like to donate i can assure you i will put the donations to good use :)! I'm so incredibly astounded by the support everyone has shown for my work!

** ATTN: Please note which print option you would like in the comments area after you donate! :] Also will ship overseas!



Welcome!

Thank you for visiting my Indiegogo!

So i'm kind of new to the whole photography world... actually... very new. But in the last 8 months i'd like to think i've accomplished quite a lot! I'm about to be 20 years young and i've already shot for a couple magazines + have begun testing with agency represented models from some of the top agencies in Los Angeles! I never expected to get so infatuated with photography, but now it literally consumes my life. I don't think there's a day that i haven't spent at least an hour honing my craft and trying to improve my work.

Unfortunately a boy can only shoot so many models on a plain, white wall, in his apartment for so long before it gets dramatically boring and stale and -- well, flat. With some stand alone lights i will be able to keep the creative juices flowing and continue to add more and more depth to my portfolio of work!

So that's where YOU come in! =D 

I'm trying to build a mini studio in my apartment so i can continue to grow as a photographer and an artist. What does "mini studio" entail you ask?

• Backdrop stands -- the things you put that giant roll of paper on to make pretty pictures
• Strobe Lights -- the equivalent to a giant flash -- like the one on your iPhone. Yes...

And last but not least...

• Backdrop Rolls -- basically giant sheets of colored material that make the background!

The only problem is... I seem to have ventured into one of the most expensive hobbies known to man kind. So if i ever want to construct this studio I'm going to need a bit of help! 

Even if i can't fund raise the entire amount that i am seeking for this project any amount will help me achieve this end goal sooner rather than later! I don't need "pro gear" to create beautiful photos. Even cookie cutter equipment is better than nothing at this point! I pride myself on being ingenuitive. Is that a word?!

What You Get And What I Need!

As i said before... i'm seeking a total of $1000. Yeah. Steep. I know. WELCOME TO THE LIFE OF A STARVING ARTIST! 

If i personally had a credit card i would be surviving on nothing but ramen. Thus i do not. So financing is not an option!

In the off-chance that i don't fund the entire amount -- even a minimum of $50 will help! That's an entire backdrop roll!

So WHY should YOU help ME!?  -- because i'm awesome for starters... 

Also because i'm going to give away cool prints, photo shoots, photography / photoshop lessons and share all of my cool tips and tricks with you... or take you out to coffee because i'm cool like that!

The Impact

This is my future. I couldn't really imagine myself doing anything other than photography. I live and breathe photography now. I might have to ACTUALLY marry my camera if that ever becomes legal. Probably not. 

This gear will probably be used for years to come until i can afford to fork out money of my own for some upgrades! 

So whether you think i'm really bad and i have no idea what i'm doing..... or you enjoy my work. Even a $1 would mean the world to me!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're broke as a joke -- like me... i'd love you forever if you shared this with some of your friends or your friend's friends... or your friend's friend's friends... yeah you get the point!..

story:
OUR PROJECT

 "The Delphi Trio: Live" will bridge the gap between the arts of Studio Recording and Live Performance. The Delphi Trio will record two live concerts of the same repertoire, and release a professional début album drawn from both concerts with minimal editing. The album will capture the excitement and engagement of live performance while maintaining professional audio standards. 

With this project, the Delphi Trio will promote the authenticity and power of live performance, both in the immediate San Francisco Bay Area and throughout North America, and inspire listeners to attend more live performances in order to experience the magic of live music. 

The recording will be released in December 2014.

Motivation

"… Musicians resent that the perfection of the recording studio has crept into the expectations for the concert hall. It takes away their freedom to eschew technical perfection for the sake of achieving a musically expressive moment."

-Blier-Carruthers, Amy. Article. "The Performer's Place in the Process and Product of Recording." University of Cambridge (2013): 6.

The demand for live performance is ever-growing in North America. Yet, one could argue that recorded music is more easily accessible, and more affordable, than live music. Despite this, audiences attend live concerts to connect emotionally and spiritually to music, where studio recordings frequently offer stiffness, sacrificing artistic experience to achieve clean takes. Performers in our modern world feel pressured to deliver immaculate performances of technical perfection rather than exploring the reaches of their creative potential. This attempted flawlessness frequently comes at a cost to the musicians' emotional engagement, spontaneity, and artistic risk-taking.

We believe that the discerning listener recognizes this difference in artistic freedom and openness. In recording and releasing "The Delphi Trio: Live," we want to bring the essential energy and experience of live performance into recording while achieving the highest audio quality. The performances on this recording represent our commitment to and passion for the power of live performance.

 What your involvement means

In supporting our project, you become our audience. You help us bring out the power and emotional connectivity of live performance. An attentive audience brings an essential element to a live performance. We, as performers, feel the real hunger and desire of the individual listener to connect emotionally as we perform, giving us fuel and inspiration to communicate. It is a truly symbiotic relationship!

Many aspects of our project are supported through your generous donations. Through private donations and grants, we have already secured funding for more than 40% of our expenses, and through your generous support, we can continue to raise the rest! Here is a detailed breakdown of our budget, or in other words, where your money will be going.

 

Our superstar recording and production crew! Producer Jason O'Connell $1000, recording engineer Melodie Myers $1500, Videographer $1500, Piano technician $600, Graphic Designer Zelie Berube for album cover art $1500.       

Our publishing agent! CD production by CD Baby. $1408 total + $129 shipping = $1537 (this includes 1000 CDs with jewel cases and inserts, barcode and registration with SoundScan, worldwide “Pro” level distribution) learn more at www.cdbaby.com.

Our equipment! Programs (60 ct) @ $2/ea (10 pgs @ $0.20/ea) = $120, Posters to promote concerts at local vendors (20 posters @ $5 ea = $100)    Senn 8020 Pair Mics (@$173/wk), Royer Ribbon mics (@$312/wk), Interface UFX (@$360/wk) = $845  

Total production costs: 8702

Secured: 3152

Needed: 5550


WHO ARE WE?

The Delphi Trio Mission Statement 

The Delphi Trio is dedicated to the exploration and performance of great chamber music. Guided by the highest artistic ideals, the Trio’s mission is to give voice to the authentic, essential spirit of a composition, acting as a conduit between composer and audience. In sharing their boundless enthusiasm for music and the complex journey that leads from first rehearsal to performance, the Delphi Trio invites the larger community to engage their own powers of reflection and communication.

About the Ensemble

Praised for “…spot-on ensemble playing and a beautifully blended sound…” (San Francisco Classical Voice) and “...rich, committed string tone, dazzling pianism, rhythmic flexibility, and risky tempi...” (Sarasota Herald Tribune) the  Delphi Trio has become a powerfully eloquent voice in the world of chamber music.

Following a triumphant orchestral debut in Beethoven’s Triple Concerto op.56 with the San Jose Chamber Orchestra led by George Cleve, the Delphi Trio has concertized throughout the United States and Canada including performances at the Artist Series Concerts of Sarasota, Great Lakes Chamber Music Festival, WFMT Studios Chicago, Dakota Sky International Piano Festival, and the Banff Centre for the Arts.

2014-2015 season highlights include the Trio's second year as Ensemble-in-Residence at the Bear Valley Music Festival, appearances at Chamber Music Society of Little Rock, Chamber Music Sundays at Three presented by Southeast Missouri State University, the April in Santa Cruz Festival of Contemporary Music, performances in collaboration with Scott Parkman and American Music Century, and the release of the Trio's debut recording, featuring works by Haydn and Arensky.

The Delphi Trio is grounded in the immensely rich classic repertoire for piano trio and is committed to the exploration of its deep, lasting meaning for performers and audience alike. The Trio sees contemporary music as a natural extension of the standard repertoire and is dedicated to the music of our time. Championing works by Henry Cowell, Pierre Jalbert, and Joan Tower, Delphi has given acclaimed world premieres of Max Stoffregen's Coyote Plan (2013) and Sahba Aminikia's Deltangi-ha (2012) and Shab o Meh (2014). The Trio has commissioned William Bolcom to write his first piano trio, to be premiered during the 2015-2016 season.

The Delphi Trio believes chamber music is an ideal model for education. As faculty of the Crowden School's Summer Chamber Music Workshops for Youth and Adults, the Trio regularly coaches and mentors musicians of all ages. Delphi is committed to supporting young artists as they begin their careers and have established the Emerging Artist Program to guide collegiate students through their first independent public concertizing experience.

In addition to their work as a trio, Jeffrey, Liana, and Michelle perform in solo recital, larger chamber music, and as soloists with orchestra and believe in the symbiotic relationship between solo and collaborative work. They have individually performed with artists such as Robert Mann, Bonnie Hampton, Anthony Marwood, Menahem Pressler, and Paul Katz.

Liana Bérubé, Michelle Kwon, and Jeffrey LaDeur are graduates of the University of Toronto, Stanford University and the Eastman School of Music respectively, and formed the Trio while studying in the prestigious Chamber Music Program at the San Francisco Conservatory of Music. They count among their mentors Henk Guittart, Bonnie Hampton, the St. Lawrence Quartet, and Stephen Prutsman, and have worked with Peter Wiley, Pedja Muzijevich, and Pamela Frank.

As an ensemble, the Trio has always made food and friendship a priority and believe that these elements are at the heart of great chamber music. The ensemble is built on trust and communication; to that end, each Delphi rehearsal starts in the same way: a meal, conversation, and music. 

 

THE CONCERT SPACE

Use of the Maybeck Recital Hall was generously offered in-kind by its owners for the Delphi Trio's recording project. Maybeck Recital Hall, also known as Maybeck Studio for Performing Arts, is located inside the Kennedy-Nixon House located at 1537 Euclid Avenue in Berkeley, California, USA. It was built in 1914 by Bernard Maybeck. The hall seats up to 40 people and was designed upon commission for the Nixon family, local arts patrons who wanted a live-in studio for their daughter Milda's piano teacher, Mrs. Alma Kennedy. The room is paneled in unfinished clear-heart redwood, which contributes to an unusually rich and warm, yet bright and clear acoustic quality. Maybeck originally designed the space to accommodate an 1898 7-foot Bechstein, but its current resident is a 7-foot Yamaha rebuilt with Steinway parts.

In 1923, the hall was destroyed in a hillside fire. It was rebuilt quickly by Maybeck. Milda Nixon lived at the residence until her death in 1981 at the age of 92. Her adopted son, Charles R. Fulweiler, then held the house for several years. In 1987, the house was purchased by jazz pianist Dick Whittington, who opened the hall for public recitals.

Between 1989 and 1995, Concord Records produced 42 solo piano recitals in Maybeck Recital Hall. Each recital featured a different jazz pianist, and all 42 recordings were released on CD. Concord also recorded 10 jazz duets at Maybeck during the same time period, which were also released as a series of CDs sold by Concord. 

To learn more about the Maybeck Recital Hall, please visit the website at The Maybeck Studio Website. 


FURTHER INVOLVEMENT

We appreciate your involvement in our project and mission, whether it is through this campaign or not. For any inquiries, comments, or other ways you can support, please visit our website and be sure to sign up for our mailing list!

The Delphi Trio Website

You can also email us at info@delphitrio.com, follow us on Twitter at @delphitrio, or like us on Facebook at The Delphi Trio on Facebook.

The Delphi Trio is fiscally sponsored by Fractured Atlas, which means that your donations are all tax-deductible! If you would like to know more or donate outside of this campaign, please visit our donation page at The Delphi Trio on Fractured Atlas.
story_txt: OUR PROJECT "The Delphi Trio: Live" will bridge the gap between the arts of Studio Recording and Live Performance. The Delphi Trio will record two live concerts of the same repertoire, and release a professional début album drawn from both concerts with minimal editing. The album will capture the excitement and engagement of live performance while maintaining professional audio standards. With this project, the Delphi Trio will promote the authenticity and power of live performance, both in the immediate San Francisco Bay Area and throughout North America, and inspire listeners to attend more live performances in order to experience the magic of live music. The recording will be released in December 2014.Motivation"… Musicians resent that the perfection of the recording studio has crept into the expectations for the concert hall. It takes away their freedom to eschew technical perfection for the sake of achieving a musically expressive moment."-Blier-Carruthers, Amy. Article. "The Performer's Place in the Process and Product of Recording." University of Cambridge (2013): 6.The demand for live performance is ever-growing in North America. Yet, one could argue that recorded music is more easily accessible, and more affordable, than live music. Despite this, audiences attend live concerts to connect emotionally and spiritually to music, where studio recordings frequently offer stiffness, sacrificing artistic experience to achieve clean takes. Performers in our modern world feel pressured to deliver immaculate performances of technical perfection rather than exploring the reaches of their creative potential. This attempted flawlessness frequently comes at a cost to the musicians' emotional engagement, spontaneity, and artistic risk-taking.We believe that the discerning listener recognizes this difference in artistic freedom and openness. In recording and releasing "The Delphi Trio: Live," we want to bring the essential energy and experience of live performance into recording while achieving the highest audio quality. The performances on this recording represent our commitment to and passion for the power of live performance. What your involvement meansIn supporting our project, you become our audience. You help us bring out the power and emotional connectivity of live performance. An attentive audience brings an essential element to a live performance. We, as performers, feel the real hunger and desire of the individual listener to connect emotionally as we perform, giving us fuel and inspiration to communicate. It is a truly symbiotic relationship!Many aspects of our project are supported through your generous donations. Through private donations and grants, we have already secured funding for more than 40% of our expenses, and through your generous support, we can continue to raise the rest! Here is a detailed breakdown of our budget, or in other words, where your money will be going. Our superstar recording and production crew! Producer Jason O'Connell $1000, recording engineer Melodie Myers $1500, Videographer $1500, Piano technician $600, Graphic Designer Zelie Berube for album cover art $1500.       Our publishing agent! CD production by CD Baby. $1408 total + $129 shipping = $1537 (this includes 1000 CDs with jewel cases and inserts, barcode and registration with SoundScan, worldwide “Pro” level distribution) learn more at www.cdbaby.com.Our equipment! Programs (60 ct) @ $2/ea (10 pgs @ $0.20/ea) = $120, Posters to promote concerts at local vendors (20 posters @ $5 ea = $100)    Senn 8020 Pair Mics (@$173/wk), Royer Ribbon mics (@$312/wk), Interface UFX (@$360/wk) = $845  Total production costs: 8702Secured: 3152Needed: 5550WHO ARE WE?The Delphi Trio Mission Statement The Delphi Trio is dedicated to the exploration and performance of great chamber music. Guided by the highest artistic ideals, the Trio’s mission is to give voice to the authentic, essential spirit of a composition, acting as a conduit between composer and audience. In sharing their boundless enthusiasm for music and the complex journey that leads from first rehearsal to performance, the Delphi Trio invites the larger community to engage their own powers of reflection and communication.About the EnsemblePraised for “…spot-on ensemble playing and a beautifully blended sound…” (San Francisco Classical Voice) and “...rich, committed string tone, dazzling pianism, rhythmic flexibility, and risky tempi...” (Sarasota Herald Tribune) the  Delphi Trio has become a powerfully eloquent voice in the world of chamber music.Following a triumphant orchestral debut in Beethoven’s Triple Concerto op.56 with the San Jose Chamber Orchestra led by George Cleve, the Delphi Trio has concertized throughout the United States and Canada including performances at the Artist Series Concerts of Sarasota, Great Lakes Chamber Music Festival, WFMT Studios Chicago, Dakota Sky International Piano Festival, and the Banff Centre for the Arts.2014-2015 season highlights include the Trio's second year as Ensemble-in-Residence at the Bear Valley Music Festival, appearances at Chamber Music Society of Little Rock, Chamber Music Sundays at Three presented by Southeast Missouri State University, the April in Santa Cruz Festival of Contemporary Music, performances in collaboration with Scott Parkman and American Music Century, and the release of the Trio's debut recording, featuring works by Haydn and Arensky.The Delphi Trio is grounded in the immensely rich classic repertoire for piano trio and is committed to the exploration of its deep, lasting meaning for performers and audience alike. The Trio has commissioned William Bolcom to write his first piano trio, to be premiered during the 2015-2016 season.The Delphi Trio believes chamber music is an ideal model for education. story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone!

My name is Pam Millar and I am just a small town girl that lives in northern Ontario, Canada and I love making music.  I am married and have 2 kids, 2 dogs, 2 horses and 1 cat.  I am a Registered Nurse, I work in palliative care and I love my job! My experience has provided me with the outlook of “LIFE IS SHORT SO LIVE IT TO THE FULLEST!”

In 2010, I was able to check something off my bucket list when I released my debut CD, “Small Town Girl”.  The CD sold well and after putting a band together, we toured locally and decided to record another CD “Country Rebel” which I released in 2013.

I have grown so much as an artist over the past few years and I now have an opportunity to work with a professional producer and professional players on an amazing new project.  Until now, I have covered the costs of the previous projects but this time, the cost is more than what my family and I can afford independently……….but I still so badly wanna do the project so I am asking for HELP! 

I am extremely excited to be able to work with the calibre of professionals on this project and I would be so very grateful for any assistance you could provide. 

Remember folks, life is short so LIVE IT TO THE FULLEST!!

DARE TO DREAM!

What I Need & What You Get

So let’s break it down for ya folks:

The cost of studio rental, producer, players, mastering, artwork and travel cost “lotsa” money.  I am trying to raise $10 000 to cover the cost of recording the album. 

But what do you get out of it?

Happy Harmony: $1 – My Sincere Thank You

My ability to continue making music lays in the fans hands!  If my music has entertained you, made you smile or made you wanna jump up and dance, I would be happy to have you contribute any amount you can.  The perk for this level is my sincere thank you for your support!

Delightful Duet: $15 – Digital Download

I will hand address an envelope and mail you a personalized thank you note and a card so you can digitally download my new album!

Thrilling Tempo: $25 – The Real Deal

Want your own autographed copy of the new album?  I will hand address a sturdy CD mailer and send you an autographed physical copy of my new album with a personalized thank you note!

Sweet Serenade: $50 – The Trilogy

How about getting all three Pam Millar albums?? I will hand address a sturdy CD mailer and send you an autographed physical copy of my three albums including Small Town Girl, Country Rebel and the new album as well as a personalized thank you note!

Merry Medley: $150 – Party with Pam

Wanna hear the new album before it’s released?  Attend a pre CD release listening party with me plus take your autographed copy of the new album home with you after the party!

Reverberating Rhythms: $300 – Executive Producer? What? What?

Achieve Executive Producer status on the new project!  Your name will be listed on the album cover as Executive Producer, plus the “Party with Pam” perks and the “Trilogy” perks!

Breathtaking Beats: $1000 – Private House Concert

Be entertained in your home with a private acoustic house concert with my guitarist and I.  An up close and personal chat and concert for you and your friends, plus the “Executive Producer” perks and “Trilogy” perks. (Distance of venue must be within 100 kms of Burk’s Falls, ONT, Canada).

Magnificent Maestro: $2500 – Full Band Concert

A rockin’ outlaw country concert for you and your friends!! Venue decided and provided by the contributor plus you get the “Executive Producer” perks and “Trilogy” perks. We will bring the PA, the lights and our gear, you provide the venue ~ invite your friends and let’s PARTY!!  (Distance of venue must be within 100 kms of Burk’s Falls, ONT, Canada).

Other Ways You Can Help

Alrighty folks…..maybe you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help me to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign by sharing my campaign on Facebook or in an email.

story:
5000$. C'EST LE VÉRITABLE OBJECTIF À ATTEINDRE ET IL N'EST PAS TROP TARD! Vous pouvez quand même faire une contribution même si la date butoir est passée.

5000$. THAT'S THE REAL GOAL FOR US AND IT'S NOT TOO LATE! You still can contribute even if the deadline is passed. 

(see english below)

Le projet

Video Phase, c'est l'association de deux musiciens-créateurs, Julien-Robert et Julien Compagne. Nous créons des spectacles multimédia qui mélangent à la fois musique, vidéo et technologie. Le but étant de vous faire vivre une expérience nouvelle où la musique et l'image ne font qu'un. 

Nous travaillons sur notre nouveau spectacle, Lumens, qui sera une véritable performance "live" en immersion visuelle et sonore, avec des écrans et des hauts-parleurs devant et autour du public, et un visuel 3D interactif programmé avec un logiciel de jeux vidéo.  

Nous sommes de la génération qui a grandi avec les jeux vidéos, la télévision et les  technologies numériques. Les spectacles que nous créons ont ces références, mais s'adressent à tout le monde. Video Phase s'est produit une vingtaine de fois avec son premier spectacle et espère avec Lumens aller encore plus loin et rejoindre un public de plus en plus nombreux.

Vous pouvez visionner trois extraits du futur spectacle avec Q-Balls, Cube it, et Roll. 

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Bien que Video Phase soit habituellement autonome, nous avons besoin de vous pour nous aider à atteindre notre but final et donner vie au projet. Votre soutien nous permettra de le mener à terme, et (si possible) de faire un enregistrement professionnel de la première. Voici comment nous voulons procéder : 

3000$

C'est le minimum dont nous avons besoin pour mener à bien notre mission. Cela  nous permettrait d'engager les collaborateurs nécessaires au projet et l'équipe technique, d'acheter le matériel nécessaire à la fabrication de nos instruments et de louer les 2 projecteurs supplémentaires qui sont nécessaires au spectacle. L'enregistrement du spectacle serait un enregistrement d'archives. Mais alors, que pourrions-nous faire avec plus? C'est là que ça devient intéressant...

5000$

Voici l'objectif à atteindre! En plus de pouvoir terminer le spectacle, nous pourrions faire une promotion digne de ce nom, et une captation multi-angles de la première par un vrai réalisateur. Captation multi-angles interactive que vous recevrez alors en exclusivité! 

Chaque dollar dépensé ira directement dans la production et la réalisation de Lumens et de son enregistrement exclusif.

(Choisissez votre contrepartie en haut à droite)

Budget

Budget minimum : 3000$


Budget élargi : 5000$


D'autres façons d'aider

Diffuser notre lien Indiegogo autant que possible. Envoyez-le à vos amis, postez-le sur Facebook et sur Twitter. Prenez part à l’histoire de Video Phase : suivez notre progrès et impliquez votre famille et vos amis. Voici le lien à partager :

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/video-phase-lumens

Si vous avez des questions ou des suggestions, contactez-nous sans hésiter à info@videophase.net

Merci de votre soutien! 

___________________________________________________


The project

Video Phase is the combination of two musicians/creators, Julien-Robert and Julien Compagne. We create multimedia shows that combine music, video and technology. The purpose is to make you live a new experience where music and visual are one. 

We are now working on our new show, Lumens. It will be a real "live" audio/visual immersive performance, with screens and speakers surrounding the audience, and a 3D interactive visual coded with a video-game software.   

We are a generation who grew up with video-games, television and new technologies. The shows we are making are referencing to them, but are thinked for everybody. Video Phase performed his first show around twenty times et we wish with Lumens that we will go further and will reach a larger and larger audience.

you can watch three teasers of the future show with Q-Balls, Cube it and Roll. 

What we need and what you get 

Usually, Video Phase self-finance his projects, but now we need your help to reach our objectives and make Lumens come to life. With your support we will be able to complete the show, and (if possible) to make a professional recording of the premiere. Here's how we want to proceed :

3000$

That's the minimum we need to achieve our goal. With this budget, we will be able to hire the experts we need, to hire the technicians for the premiere, to buy the materials to build our virtual instruments, and to rent the 2 projectors for the show. The show recording is this scenario we be minimal. Now you're asking what we can do with more? That's where the fun begins...

5000$

That's the real target! With this budget, we will be able to promote the show and to have a professionnal multi-angle video shooting made by a real film director. You will then receive an exclusive copy of this video! 

Every single cent raised will go directly into the production of Lumens and his recording

 (Go Select-A-Perk at the top right!)

Budget

 Minimum budget : 2000$


Extended budget : 5000$


    Other ways you can help

    Spread our Indiegogo link everywhere. Email it to friends, Facebook it, Tweet it. Become part of our Video Phase story : check on our progress, and get your friends and family in on the story as well. Here is the link to spread:

    https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/video-phase-lumens

    If you have any questions or suggestions, please contact us at info@videophase.net

    Thanks for your support! 

    Video Phase

Diffuser notre lien Indiegogo autant que possible. Envoyez-le à vos amis, postez-le sur Facebook et sur Twitter. Prenez part à l’histoire de Video Phase : suivez notre progrès et impliquez votre famille et vos amis. Voici le lien à partager :
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/video-phase-lumens
Si vous avez des questions ou des suggestions, contactez-nous sans hésiter à info@videophase.net
Merci de votre soutien! 

___________________________________________________

The project


Video Phase is the combination of two musicians/creators, Julien-Robert and Julien Compagne. We create multimedia shows that combine music, video and technology. The purpose is to make you live a new experience where music and visual are one. 
We are now working on our new show, Lumens. It will be a real "live" audio/visual immersive performance, with screens and speakers surrounding the audience, and a 3D interactive visual coded with a video-game software.   
We are a generation who grew up with video-games, television and new technologies. The shows we are making are referencing to them, but are thinked for everybody. Video Phase performed his first show around twenty times et we wish with Lumens that we will go further and will reach a larger and larger audience.
you can watch three teasers of the future show with Q-Balls, Cube it and Roll. 



What we need and what you get 
Usually, Video Phase self-finance his projects, but now we need your help to reach our objectives and make Lumens come to life. With your support we will be able to complete the show, and (if possible) to make a professional recording of the premiere. Here's how we want to proceed :
3000$

That's the minimum we need to achieve our goal. With this budget, we will be able to hire the experts we need, to hire the technicians for the premiere, to buy the materials to build our virtual instruments, and to rent the 2 projectors for the show. The show recording is this scenario we be minimal. Now you're asking what we can do with more? That's where the fun begins...
5000$

That's the real target! With this budget, we will be able to promote the show and to have a professionnal multi-angle video shooting made by a real film director. You will then receive an exclusive copy of this video! 
Every single cent raised will go directly into the production of Lumens and his recording
 (Go Select-A-Perk at the top right!)

Budget

 Minimum budget : 2000$









Extended budget : 5000$












Other ways you can help
Spread our Indiegogo link everywhere. Email it to friends, Facebook it, Tweet it. Become part of our Video Phase story : check on our progress, and get your friends and family in on the story as well. Here is the link to spread:
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/video-phase-lumens
If you have any questions or suggestions, please contact us at info@videophase.net
Thanks for your support! 
Video Phase

story:
Summary

If I'm being honest, I'm terrified to do this. I've been putting this off for far too long. But I've finally decided it's time. Time to take a risk. Time to record again. It's been a while.

If there is anything I think I do well, it's song writing. I'm so excited to share this project with you all.  Would you consider helping?

So here's what I need.....

  • I'm hiring the best producers and engineers I know from my days in the band life.
  • I'm hiring some of my favorite musician buddies from various bands/worship teams. Both local and across the country.
  • I promise this will be unlike anything you've heard from me or my years with OMS. I'm so excited!

Other Ways You Can Help...

If you can't help financially, would you consider sharing this link, spreading the word, etc. I have a goal of 5k to do this right. I know that's a hard goal but I believe this endeavor will be well worth it.
I need all the help I can get.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Alexandra Ludwig and I'm the conductor and artistic director of Flux Ensemble. The formation of Flux is a long-term dream coming true. My idea for this group was that the repertoire should inform the makeup of the ensemble, not the other way around.  While you may never hear Flux as the same group twice, you can be guaranteed performances including new works in new ways, and old works in new ways. Our first concerts will take place February 8th and 9th, 2014 and will benefit the Berkshire Hills Music Academy www.berkshirehills.org and Flux itself. Our forces will include string orchestra, chamber chorus, and arch guitar (listen to our soloist Peter Blanchette here http://youtu.be/LzP5xGcKa1k )
with music by Byrd, Mozart, Arvo Pärt, and arrangements of tunes from the British Isles by Blanchette.Can you help us cover the basic costs of putting this on? Our musicians and singers are already donating their time and artistry.

What We Need & What You Get

This is a benefit concert, but not all things can be donated. Please consider making a contribution towards, or underwriting, our first project. (Donations accepted in all amounts, not just those listed in the special boxes!) This is a small and specific campaign:

$1700 total

Performance rights and instrumental parts for Pärt's Berlin Mass - $680

15 choral scores for Pärt's Berlin Mass - $250

All Saint's Church space rental - $245

ASCAP license - $200

Misc. expenses - $225

Miscellaneous expenses include things like publicity material copying, program copying, the mailing of parts and study CDs to the musicians and chorus members, shipping of the instrumental parts to and from the publisher. If we surpass our goal, that money will go towards honorariums for the kind souls who are helping me design our website and logo.

Donations $25 and above will garner a free ticket to the concert. All donor's names will appear in the program, categorized by amount given (please let me know if you'd like to remain anonymous). If your company would like to be an underwriter, your logo/advertisement will be given visual priority on the front of the program - if done soon, you will appear on our promotional poster as well. If your company would like to run an advertisement, please contact me personally as there will be separate protocol. A donation in someone's name or memory will garner an advertisement-size place in the program with a message of your choice.

One further note. This concert is also a benefit for the Berkshire Hills Music Academy, so if you donate here to the operating costs, please consider them and look for their wish list at the door (I believe they're seeking gently used or new ipods, music stands, etc).

The Impact

The long-term goal for Flux Ensemble is to file for 501(c) non-profit status by the end of 2014. This will enable me and the board to raise money to cover all future costs and to pay the musicians. But I wanted to birth this project through music so that we all had a wave to ride on.

I want to take a moment to thank all the people who already have helped.  So many have shown great enthusiasm: composers and players have approached me with exciting repertoire ideas, singers and musicians want to get on board as soloists, and friends have offered help on the administrative front. I am experiencing a communal show of love and support.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are a composer, please be in touch about your current work or future commissions.

If you'd like to serve on the board, drop me a line.

If you have skills that you'd like to share with the group (ie Feldenkrais, Alexander Technique, Eurythmics), let's talk.

And please feel free to share this with anyone you might think would be interested in lending a hand. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Jon's new headshot!

                                          Deanna's new headshot! 


Open Letter to Family, Friends & New Friends as Jon Sill and I Begin to Pursue Our Life's Work

I am Deanna Davis from Spokane, Washington; a professional singer, actor, and voice teacher and aspiring to a performing and teaching career in the Twin Cities. Since joining a children's chorus at age 6, my love for music has evolved and expanded. I have an eclectic performing taste: music theater (Golden Era all the way up to contemporary), light opera, professional choruses, early music, and art song. I love creativity and relish opportunities to perform new compositions and collaborative projects with emerging artists. 

                                                         Deanna's Resume

       

Deanna as "Doralee Rhodes" with Samuel Hartley in 9-5 at Lincoln Community Playhouse

Also a member of The National Association of Teachers of Singers (NATS), I have an understanding of vocal pedagogy, a solid teaching technique and comprehensive knowledge of classical and commercial repertoire. I have taught courses in French, Italian, and English Diction at the University of Nebraska as well.

To listen and watch me sing, view my resume, or to find information on how you may take lessons with me, please visit my website at deannalynndavis.com

Jon Sill of Manchester, Iowa and I met singing in choir at the University of Nebraska - Lincoln about two years ago. Recently we became engaged! Jon is an adept theatrical and musical coach as well as performer. It has been a thrill to see how skillfully he melds himself with roles and music. Jon has already made an appearance on Playbill's website for starring in the new musical Banjo Boy, the story of Meredith Willson who wrote The Music Man. Jon's dream is also to establish himself as a singer and actor in the Twin Cities. As young as he is, Jon recently received the honor to play the emotionally complex role of Jean Valjean in the Lincoln Community Playhouse production of Les Misérables.  

                                                          Jon's Resume

 
Jon as "Meredith Willson" in Randy Hobler's Banjo Boy at the Stephen Sondheim Center of the Performing Arts

For more information about the two of us, visit our website and follow our progress at dnjmeetminneapolis.com

Deanna and Jon's Campaign

Our Goal
As we enter the highly competitive world of musical performance, we need to focus as much time and energy as possible on rehearsing, voice and acting lessons, auditions and networking. In order to be fresh, remain focused and responsive to sudden opportunities we need to approach time after our campaign without the distraction of non-related work. We have savings that we are applying to the effort but that will not be sufficient. We need to develop a kind of "fellowship" as a supplemental financial resource to maximize our chances for success.

Our goal is to raise $5,000 by January 1, 2013! 

Why Performing Arts?
After years of training, experience, and anticipation we finally get to pursue what we live to do: PERFORM! Communicating insights that words alone cannot is what we do. Jon and I have been deeply moved and changed through music and theater. Consequently, we will strive to move and change our audiences. We will move and change you. 

The Friends and Family Artist's Fellowship
As we have prepared to launch our careers in Minneapolis, it has become increasingly clear to us how the necessity of providing for our daily life could become a distraction in our effort to effectively acquire new roles and performance opportunities. The numerous expenses directly related to enhancing our ability to this industry will compound our already tight budget. Tending to the everyday obligations carries a large potential for compromising the success of our endeavor.

Traditionally, an artist fellowship or grant would be sought from various foundations and institutions. However, remembering how the love and support of our friends and family was central to the success of our development time and again over the years, we thought it important to turn once again to that source at this critical time. We are who we are because of the people we hold closest. We want you to become an integral part of our effort

Our Pursuit Commences
Currently we are seeking out musical theater productions and companies, professional choruses, liturgical music opportunities, new compositions, collaborative works, summer theaters, local festivals and concerts. I will be establishing a private voice studio with Jon as a coaching partner.

Our Commitment to Succeed
Performing is the vocation to which Jon and I have committed ourselves. We will have much better chances landing roles and gigsin this extremely competitive industry with your help. Jon and I are more than up for the challenge.

Dissection of Financial Goal

Your contributions will create an artist's fellowship that will help cover:

  • $590 rent per month
  • $150 food expenses per month
  • $20-65 per week for transportation to and from auditions, lessons, rehearsals
  • $250-1,000 health insurance coverage
  • $50-65 per voice lesson for each of us weekly
  • $10-30 accompanist fees for weekly rehearsals and auditions
  • $30-75 per week for the cost of food
  • $250 recital venue rental for the recital we put on upon our fundraiser completion
  • $145 website/promotional fees

Indirectly, when you contribute you will be providing us valuable time. We will use that time to:

  • Practice >> maintain our talent and skill
  • Take lessons >> better our talent and skill
  • Audition >> offer our talent and skill
  • Rehearse >> apply our talent and skill
  • Perform >> communicate art; the ultimate goal

How You Will Benefit

Jon and I appreciate any and every contribution - no matter the amount. If 100 people contribute at least $50 - we will reach our goal. The itemized list exceeds that $5,000 goal and we would love to exceed that number. However, as we are able to invest more time in auditioning, our hope is that the $5,000 will be supplemented.

Incentives of Contributing
Your willingness to contribute tells us you believe in us and artists like us. To thank you for your support, here is what we will do for you:

  • $1 & up : We will send you personalized recordings of Jon and myself singing. You may choose between recordings of us singing show tunes, aria and art song, or both! 
  • NEW INCENTIVE! $50 & up: We will write little jingle with a message in it JUST FOR YOU! It will be fun and hopefully make you smile.
  • $100 & up: In addition to the basic incentive, you may request 3 songs that we will also record for you. If we are in your area, we can also offer to perform 3 songs of your choosing at an event.
  • $500 & up: On top of the perks just listed, Jon and I will put on a concert or cabaret in your honor depending on when we are in your area.
  • Check in regularly to our website dnjmeetminneapolis.com to keep up with our journey.

Jon and I have appreciated the jobs we have worked outside of music and theater. We have each gained an excellent sense of work ethic and people skills which we will apply to our careers. Even if we do not reach our entire goal, the contribution you make will still allow us to focus more on singing and acting.

How Everyone Will Benefit

A large portion of talented and skilled artists struggle to survive. When you donate to our cause - you are donating to the arts. Not only do you believe that art belongs in the world, but you agree that the level of quality is even more important. The financial aspect is appreciated. The thought behind the contribution is equally appreciated.

Jon and I have already been hired professionally in cities around the U.S. and know this is not a far-fetched goal. When you contribute, you stand behind us and help to push us forward. We will seize every opportunity we can. Jon and I are reliable performers and markedly skilled. We love the music you love. We love the theater you love.

If You Cannot Donate

We understand if you are not able to make a monetary contribution. You may still help if you wish! Here are a few ways you may forward our cause:

1. Spread the word about this campaign to create our artist's fellowship! Your words are extremely valuable.

2. We will accept gifts in kind such as:
         -Recording equipment like a digital recorder, microphone, and editing software.

         -Help or service with our websites and publicity.  

3. Connect us with folks you know in the music and theater scene in Minneapolis and St. Paul! Networking will be huge for us.           

       

Thank you to April Egly of April Egly Photography for the beautiful engagement photos which we have showcased on this campaign.

Jon and I thank you for all you do.

story:
SHORT SUMMARY (Details at Bottom)

The Hawai'i Sacred Choir is under the 501(c)(3) umbrella organization, the Pacific American Foundation, a verified non-profit corporation with the IRS, so your money is 100% tax-deductible. 

We have sung our hearts out for three years, now going into our fourth concert year.  We've supported ourselves with membership dues and donations from the community.  We've produced three live concert DVDs and our video "A Hawaiian Hallelujah."  (See “Resources” page or YouTube--Yes, that's actually us singing the audio!)

We model our choir after the King's College Choir from Cambridge, UK.  People worldwide watch them, especially at Christmas.  We sing the same university-level music—even our 8-year-old choirboy and choirgirl trebles!

England is the "Holy Grail" of choirs worldwide.  The highest achievement a choir can attain is to sing in a top English Cathedral.  We sent an audition recording last year to Ely Cathedral, the 7th-longest cathedral in the world—longer than Westminster Abbey!  Our audition was approved, and we were invited to be their "Choir in Residence" for one week taking over their choir duties from July 5 to 15, 2014.  We are officially on their calendar. 

We are established with Richardson and Gray, UK choir tour specialists, and we have already made deposits to them and to United Airlines for the choir's expenses. 

So we've put it out there.  We believe in ourselves.  We're on Ely's calendar, we're putting in hours every week learning the music, and we've plunked down our deposits.  At this point we've got everything covered but the balance of the tour money.  Now we must raise $160,000 in order to finish paying for our tour.  Whatever you give is TAX-DEDUCTIBLE.  And if you donate now, you can claim the deduction on your 2013 taxes!


THE IMPACT

There is no other choir in Hawai'i like us with choirboys and choirgirls singing with adults.  We are the first Hawai'i choir to be invited to sing in an English cathedral. 

It was 150 years ago that King Kamehameha IV and Queen Emma, blown away by what they experienced in English cathedrals, returned to Hawai'i and created St. Andrew's Cathedral to share this with the people of Hawai'i.  By sending a Hawai'i choir back to sing in an English cathedral, we are bringing it full circle.


WE INVITE YOU TO BE PART OF IT!

Going to England are 34 singers, a choirmaster, and an excellent organist.  (That's Ely's organ console in the photo.)  

The choirmaster and the organist are not being paid for their duties beyond their travel and tour expenses.

Singing in our choir are choristers from age 8 to 73.  Some have traveled, but many have never been off the island of O'ahu.  Some never would have been able to travel if it weren't for this choir tour.  And they're not just going as tourists—they're going to sing in an internationally known cathedral!  Your support will give them a trip that will be a LIFETIME MEMORY—one they will tell their grandchildren! 

We will spend most of the time fulfilling our choir duties at Ely Cathedral, renowned for its acoustics and architecture.  You will have seen it in The King's Speech; Elizabeth, the Golden Age; and The Other Boleyn Girl.

We will make a "pilgrimage" to King's College in Cambridge.  We will also visit Christ Church College at Oxford, where we will share a meal at their Great Hall, which was the inspiration for Harry Potter's Hogwarts Hall.


WHAT IF I'M NOT ABLE TO DONATE A LOT OF MONEY?

Then you're in good company.  Send us $5. Or $1.  But you can REALLY help us by sending this link to everybody you know via email, Facebook, Pinterest, Twitter—whatever social networking you can.  That's how this whole thing works.  Even if you can't donate very much, somebody in your social network may be able to.  But they won't know about us if you don't tell them.  Soon.  Our campaign ends before the end of November, so please help us get the word out.  Do a good deed and feel warm and fuzzy about it. 


WHY DO WE EXIST?

Because singing is a fundamental part of being a human being.  EVERYBODY should sing.  (And not just in the shower.)  Studies have proven that singing develops brainpower in children and prevents dementia (including Alzheimer's) in adults.  It turns out that we all NEED to sing! 

Schools have been cutting music programs, so many of our kids have no place to learn music or to sing.  Adults are also looking for somewhere to sing. 

That's where we come in.  We hold open auditions every year, and we agree to train anybody from age 7 on up who can sing in tune and who is willing to work hard, commit to a rigorous rehearsal schedule, and share the ecstasy of experiencing the world's greatest choral music with the community.  There is just no other experience like it. 

We love all kinds of singing, but our niche is sacred choral music.  We sing at the university level, and we don't "dumb it down" for the choirboys and choirgirls who are our trebles.  This is not a children's chorus singing along with an adult choir.  Our choir's soprano parts are entirely handled by our choirboys and choirgirls, just as it has been done in English cathedrals for centuries.  And the kids can't get enough of it! 

We are a hard-working group—but we love it!  We rehearse every week (trebles twice a week), we sing Evensong services at Honolulu's Cathedral of St. Andrew, we sing concerts, and we dedicate ourselves to preparing to sing at Ely Cathedral next July.

We are putting in the time to build our music into something extraordinary.  Again, that is really us singing the audio track to our video.  Kids as young as 8 years old singing the Hallelujah chorus.  Check it out.  Can you hear the love and the joy?

Help us make history!  We will make you proud.  Please help send us to England.  You will change lives forever. 


WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

It costs money to send 36 people to England for a week!  We are hoping with all our hearts that this crowd-funding campaign will help us.  We see others doing it successfully, so we know it can be done.  We think this is exciting and could actually help us achieve our goal. 

So we want to reward your TOTALLY TAX-DEDUCTIBLE gifts with some "Mahalo" perks from our choir.  You can see them in the "Select a Perk" panel to the right. 

These perks represent our dedication and our hard work, and they are offered to you with much aloha.  

For a $50 donation, you will receive one of our official choir T-shirts with our Hawai'i Sacred Choir logo on the front.  It's colorful and unique, just like we are!  

On the back is one of our favorite sayings: "Choir is a Team Sport."

The holidays are almost here.  Wouldn't you love to get in the mood with beautiful Christmas carols playing in your home?  You can watch a colorful DVD of one of our live Christmas concerts in a Hawai'i cathedral as a program to savor and enjoy with your loved ones.

Look at our Hawai'i choristers singing joyously just for you!  Can local Hawai'i choirboys and choirgirls, high school kids, college students, parents and grandparents really sing university-level music?  They can if they work hard enough and have the right training with an amazing choirmaster!  You really have to see it to believe it. 

Our DVDs are also a tasteful choice to play as background music for your holiday gatherings.  Listen to the pure sounds of choirboys and choirgirls singing with adults—together in perfect harmony! 

Would you like to give a larger gift (remember, it's tax-deductible!) and receive an original photo of the choir signed by every single chorister? 

Or have us sing at your event sometime during the next year?  It's not too early to plan to have us sing next year's Christmas party for you or your company!  If you want us for this year's Christmas party—talk to us.  For a large enough donation, we will pull out all the stops. 

We can sing for your after-Christmas event with beautiful rest-of-the-year music!  Would your church or company like us to sing at your fund-raiser?  Would you like us to sing at a special private party?  A wedding?  A memorial?  If you want something heavenly, call upon us.  That's what we do.

We can send a select chamber group, or we can arrange to have the whole choir come if you would like to donate at that level. 

The big-bucks perk for a TOTALLY TAX-DEDUCTIBLE $10,000 donation is a signed photo of the entire choir at Ely Cathedral holding up a huge banner with "Mahalo to [your company or organization] from the Hawai'i Sacred Choir" on it.  In addition to the signed photo, we will all sign the banner, and you can display both the banner and the photo as a token of our everlasting gratitude.  You will also get a DVD. 

Okay, so how are we going to do this?  What do all our contributors get for their money?  We consider you to be investors, so here is our budget. 

Hawai'i Sacred Choir England Tour Budget for 36 People:

*501(c)(3) Fiscal Sponsor

SHORT SUMMARY (Details at Bottom)
The Hawai'i Sacred Choir is under the 501(c)(3) umbrella organization, the Pacific American Foundation, a verified
non-profit corporation with the IRS, so your money is 100%
tax-deductible. 

We
have sung our hearts out for three years, now going into our fourth concert
year.  We've supported ourselves with membership dues and donations from
the community.  We've produced three live concert DVDs and our video
"A Hawaiian Hallelujah."  (See “Resources” page or YouTube--Yes,
that's actually us singing the audio!)

We
model our choir after the King's College Choir from Cambridge, UK. 
People worldwide watch them, especially at Christmas.  We sing the same
university-level music—even our 8-year-old choirboy and choirgirl trebles!

England is the "Holy Grail" of
choirs worldwide.  The highest achievement a choir can attain is to sing
in a top English Cathedral.  We sent an audition recording last year to
Ely Cathedral, the 7th-longest cathedral in the world—longer than Westminster
Abbey!  Our audition was approved, and we were invited to be their
"Choir in Residence" for one week taking over their choir duties from
July 5 to 15, 2014.  We are
officially on their calendar. 

We
are established with Richardson and Gray,
 UK choir tour
specialists, and we have already made deposits to them and to United Airlines
for the choir's expenses. 

So
we've put it out there.  We believe in ourselves.  We're on Ely's
calendar, we're putting in hours every week learning the music, and we've
plunked down our deposits.  At this point we've got everything covered but
the balance of the tour money.  Now we must raise $160,000 in order to
finish paying for our tour.  Whatever you give is TAX-DEDUCTIBLE. 
And if you donate now, you can claim the deduction on your 2013 taxes!


THE
IMPACT

There
is no other choir in Hawai'i
like us with choirboys and choirgirls singing with adults.  We are the
first Hawai'i
choir to be invited to sing in an English cathedral. 

It
was 150 years ago that King Kamehameha IV and Queen Emma, blown away by what
they experienced in English cathedrals, returned to Hawai'i and created St.
Andrew's Cathedral to share this with the people of Hawai'i.  By sending a
Hawai'i choir
back to sing in an English cathedral, we are bringing it full circle.


WE INVITE YOU TO BE PART OF IT!

Going
to England
are 34 singers, a choirmaster, and an excellent organist.  (That's Ely's
organ console in the photo.)  

The
choirmaster and the organist are not being paid for their duties beyond their
travel and tour expenses.

Singing
in our choir are choristers from age 8 to 73.  Some have traveled, but
many have never been off the island
 of O'ahu.  Some
never would have been able to travel if it weren't for this choir tour. 
And they're not just going as tourists—they're going to sing in an
internationally known cathedral!  Your support will give them a trip that
will be a LIFETIME MEMORY—one they will tell their grandchildren! 

We
will spend most of the time fulfilling our choir duties at Ely Cathedral,
renowned for its acoustics and architecture.  You will have seen it in The King's Speech; Elizabeth,
the Golden Age; and The
Other Boleyn Girl.

We
will make a "pilgrimage" to King's College in Cambridge.  We will also visit Christ Church
College at Oxford, where we will share a meal at their
Great Hall, which was the inspiration for Harry Potter's Hogwarts Hall.
