story:
Hi, everyone!  Welcome to my Indiegogo campaign!  I’m very excited about moving forward toward making a long-time dream a reality. And with your help, I can do just that!

I feel so fortunate to have enjoyed many years in the professional operatic world and one of the great blessings of my life was the creation of a documentary film called Laundry and Tosca that chronicled my calling to sing.  Laundry and Tosca has been seen around the world and I was deeply blessed to receive an award for my vocal work in the film in Milan, Italy. 

I would never have guessed that another adventure awaiting me would be using my voice for ministry. I've traveled to numerous locations the United States and recently up into Canada presenting Embraced by God, a ministry program born out of the film that honestly addresses the pain of dying to self in order to bend to the will of God, allowing God to reshape and redefine our desires and the amazingly abundant life that can result. I continue to be incredibly grateful and humbled by how deeply the presentation resonates with people. 

I invite you to visit my website, http://marciawhiteheadusa.com/biography/  to learn a bit more about my background and the Embraced by God page,  http://marciawhiteheadusa.com/embraced-by-god/ to hear me sing music that has been particularly meaningful to me, including Give Me Jesus and an aria from the opera, Turandot.

As I travel, people tell me they would love to take home a CD that contains songs from the program including You’ll Never Walk Alone, The Lord’s Prayer and Give Me Jesus, and are very surprised that I don’t already have a CD to offer them.  I’ve always wanted to make sure that any recording project I take on is a very high quality studio recording and funding a project like that has always been outside my means.

One of my favorite words is “collaboration,” which is probably why I loved working in the operatic field so much. One certainly can’t do opera alone!  So I’m very excited that Indiegogo has offered me the opportunity to invite you to partner with me in ministry and collaborate in creating my first extended play CD that will be entitled Give Me Jesus. 

Recording dates have been set for January 11-14, 2014 in Southern California and the CD will be available by late March.  I'm working with a producer I’ve known for years and trust implicitly and the funds needed for this project include:

Studio, engineer, mixing and mastering fees: $3,600.00

Producer, arranger, musician fees:  $2,500.00

Recording rights:  $900.00  

Album photography: $600.00

Album artwork, design and layout:  $500.00

Duplication for 1,000 CDs: $975.00

Airfare, lodging, rental car etc: $700.00

Any funds raised over the total stated will be used for other needs like additional recording rights, packaging and shipping costs, photo session make-up artist, etc.

Like Indiana Jones stepping off the precipice and praying that the ground would form itself under his feet, I’m asking if you would prayerfully consider partnering with me in this new adventure and becoming part of the support that forms itself under my feet as I step out in faith to create my first extended play CD. Thank you for believing in me and in this project that means so much to me. My prayer is that Give Me Jesus will bless, encourage and uplift you. Thank you from the bottom of my heart and may God will bless you in unexpected ways!

story:
Short Summary

What’s that, you say? You’ve memorized all the songs on your old Kimo album? You lost it, it broke, someone stole it? Or you just wore it out? Maybe, your ex took it when she left you on the side of the road, brokenhearted, without pants? 

Well, help is on the horizon, friends, because I can at least help you with part of that. I have got a whole mess of songs just ready to be pressed onto my sophomore CD—some of them aim at soothing that broken heart of yours, and others at breaking someone else's. Every 100th album sold will include a pair of pants for those of you stranded on the side of the road (boy, that's gonna be hard to keep track of :). Plus, I'm just itchin to get out on the road (can you say TOUR!!) with these tunes and meet all y'all fine folks that have helped to make this happen!

See that video above? That song "Up, Up and I" will be featured on this album. The video was the co-winner of the 2011 48Hour Music Video Project (LaRae Productions). That's just one of the many gems that my long time friend and recording engineer/producer Ryan Martino and I have put together for y'all. 

Some of my other proudest accomplishments include:

-Winner of 2010, 2011, 2012 and 2013 Best Solo Artist in Local iQ's Smart List Reader's Poll!!!! 
-Co-Winner of 2010 Local iQ Smart List for Best Singer/Songwriter
-Winner of 2010 Alibi's Best of Burque for Best Singer/Songwriter
-Opening act for several national acts including Disappear Fear, Laurie Carson, Martin Sexton, Roger Manning, Sister 7, Caroland Wonderland, Eric McFadden, Nathen Maxwell, Carla Bozulich, among many rockin' others. 


What I Need & What You Get

In order to help you out with this new Kimo CD, I need you to help me. But don’t freak out—this is just how this whole circle of life thing works. I need some dough so I can get this album, perks and tour funded and off the ground. Your funds will go toward paying for studio time and mastering, album reproduction, some new strings, and those get-the-word-out activities that cost money, like advertising and merch. This is also how I plan to pay for your PERKS and my TOUR. With your funding, you are helping the healing of your brokenhearted pantslessness, and putting me closer to the end goal of travelling all over the states to see Y'ALL!!!  Totally worth it, right? You click a couple of buttons here, and before too long, you’ve got your new album, me coming to a town near you soon, maybe some pants, and all is right with the world again :) That's awesome :)

Plus, the CD release party is already scheduled!! (Check the links below for more details!!)

**Y'all, please keep in mind the funding amounts aren't the only available. ANY amount that you can give will be greatly appreciated and rewarded. The given amounts you see here are just a way of separating the perks. :)


The Impact

I don't know if you've ever seen a live Kimo show, but, it can be really, really fun. You never know what's gonna happen! Every venue brings out a different shade of me and my music. My soulful, passionate lyrics, beautiful melodies, and rockin’/crazy spirit can become a part of your daily life, and you can help me bring it to OTHERS, when you help to fund this campaign or share this link! I really need your help to get my music out to a broader audience!

Think about this—your funding to this album and tour will help save the brokenhearted and pantsless folks across the country as well as getting this music out to a much broader audience. Your impact on the world could be, literally, boundless (I really wanted to say pantsless:)). 


Other Ways You Can Help

Your wallet was in those pants? Damn economy and workin 3 jobs? I hear ya!!! No worries!!!! That’s alright. Here are some other ways you can help:

·  Send the link to this page to everyone you know, especially your REALLY rich      uncle/aunt/friends.

·  If you’re in the Albuquerque area, stop by and check out one of my shows.

·  Follow me HERE:

    ReverbNation: www.reverbnation.com/kimoliscious

    Facebook: www.facebook.com/kimolisciousmusic OR 

                      www.facebook.com/pages/Kimo/125261817508891                                     

    Twitter: @kimoliscious OR www.twitter.com/kimoliscious


Kimo's Tidbits

Hailing from Texas originally, Kimo comes from a talented musical family. Her background provided the opportunity to become a skilled and versatile musician at an early age. 
She brings her talent and wit to every performance. Intelligent and heartfelt lyrics imbue her acoustic grooves with an ethereal quality that is both captivating and genuine. Her humorous and down-home rapport with audiences insures her growing appeal. With her debut release "Those Crazy Fallin' Down Things" she aspires to create music that will be a necessary component of everyone's music collection. 
Kimo has been playing professionally in Albuquerque, New Mexico for over 22 years, honing her skills. She has received considerable attention and recognition by the local music community. 
Her music, above all, but personality, humor, genuineness and professionalism guarantee an enjoyable and entertaining performance every time. You will not want to miss a Kimo show!

Follow me HERE:    ReverbNation: www.reverbnation.com/kimoliscious    Facebook: www.facebook.com/kimolisciousmusic OR                       www.facebook.com/pages/Kimo/125261817508891                                         Twitter: @kimoliscious OR www.twitter.com/kimolisciousKimo's TidbitsHailing from Texas originally, Kimo comes from a talented musical family. Her background provided the opportunity to become a skilled and versatile musician at an early age. She brings her talent and wit to every performance. Intelligent and heartfelt lyrics imbue her acoustic grooves with an ethereal quality that is both captivating and genuine. Her humorous and down-home rapport with audiences insures her growing appeal. With her debut release "Those Crazy Fallin' Down Things" she aspires to create music that will be a necessary component of everyone's music collection. Kimo has been playing professionally in Albuquerque, New Mexico for over 22 years, honing her skills. She has received considerable attention and recognition by the local music community. Her music, above all, but personality, humor, genuineness and professionalism guarantee an enjoyable and entertaining performance every time. You will not want to miss a Kimo show!

story:
Short Summary

So as people know i was joining a band in the states and they ensured me that i would be able to get over , they told me too sell my belongings to make abit of money and it would all pan out , recently after trying to put money into moving over there they decided it was a unrealistic decision , leaving me with nothing , i sold my whole drum kit , my guitar , playstation and all the games , an amp and a double pedal , so i am now left with no musical equipment what so ever and i cant really afford to get it all back.

What I Need & What You Get

all i need is enough to buy a new kit and some cymbals so i can get back into a band over here in the UK as i have had 2 Offers from bands that are on the uprise,as i miss playing in a band and creating music , this can help me get back on track with doing what i love.
which ever small perk you choose i will abide by and it will mean so much to me that you have helped.

Even if you don't want a perk and can just donate a small amount , even £1 i will be grateful <3

The Impact

Music is my life and not being able to do anything with it outside of college is really going to kill me and as i am trying to find a job i would like something to do that can help me earn some cash instead of sitting around , like playing pub gigs and doing promotion

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this and help me get my kit back ! <3

story:
The DanDan Noodles are growing up...

At least that's what we'd like to think anyway. It's been a fun journey for the last 4.07 years, and, first and foremost, we'd like to thank you for supporting us and our music throughout that time. What started out as a shy, awkward-acoustic duo has grown to a still-awkward-but-a-little-more-comfortable-with-it duo. We believe now is the time to record a full and proper album with all the fixin's, and new songs as well! We decided to call it "Tangerine", and we need your help to bring this plant to life. If you have never heard us before, check out our youtube and/or bandcamp to see what we are about! 

youtube.com/thedandannoodles

thedandannoodles.bandcamp.com (Free download of our demo "Bounces") 


What We Need & What You Get

We have been blessed to have previously recorded with Dustin and Jeff over at JiveMind Studio (jivemindmusic.com), and we loved it so much that we wanted to record the album with them. We are aiming to raise 2,500 dollars to cover all recording, mixing, and mastering costs for digital release. All funds will go toward that purpose. In the chance of an overabundance of giving and love, we would use any surplus for physical copies of the LP to release into the environment. We also have some perks in exchange for funds that we hope are to your liking. 


The Impact

The wonderfullness of the human life is in the presence of both the good times and the bad times. We try to capture the emotions that we feel, whether it be a sweet melancholy, a longing wish, an exasperated confusion or just an unbridled joy in little pop song nuggets to remind us that it is all of these gifts that make life as precious as it is. Life is rarely pretty in its many moments, but it is beautiful overall. We're grateful that we can use music to bring people together, and, if only for a moment, to enjoy the presence of being. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would so appreciate it if you could share this project with friends and help us get the word out there. We would even be grateful for prayers and positive thoughts.  Also, if any of you have any ideas on cover art, let us know. We're open to all ideas! Thanks again for your support, and let's hug the next time we see each other. 

Love, 

DanDans

story:
Hey friends! 

Just Nick, here. I've been playin' folky/punk tunes for almost 2 years now. It's been a wild journey so far, and it's about to get wilder. I'm going on tour this August and would like to be able to have shirts to sell to help fund my adventure. 

What I Need & What You Get

This practically works like a pre-order. We're not able to make it out to every possible place we'd like to play this August, and I'd like to make my stuff available to everyone out there. 
For 10$ (and shipping costs) you'll get the coolest shirt ever, along with some stickers, buttons, and a download code for my upcoming tour demo. 

This shirt features the infamous 'Squirtle-squad" and comes in black and white, or tie-dye. 

Along with the physical merch, you'll also have my gratitude. My friends and supporters that I've met in the DIY community are the greatest, and they never cease to impress me with their kindness. I want to play tunes and book shows for the rest of my life, and I wouldn't be so damn confident about it if it weren't for you guys. 

These'll ship out as soon as they're done, and you'll be able to rep "folkémon" *hehe* in no time! 


My tunes: http://nickwuebben.bandcamp.com/

My blog: http://nustjick.tumblr.com/

P.S. Thanks to Wyatt Stanton for the shirt design!

story:
Short Summary

I've written and played for over a decade but never really recorded professionally. This funding will help me finish what I have just started. I started out and currently just doing Solo Acoustic Singer/Songwriter styles, but this EP will have the sound of a full band behind me and a great up-beat and rockin' style which I'm excited to see the finished product of... but that's not going to happen without some help from you...


This is the first professional recording project I've taken on and I'm excited to hear what we've done getting started, but now its time to run to the finish. Your contributions and perks go 100% to helping me fund the remaining costs of the studio and production time/efforts.


What We Need & What You Get

Simply put, you can donate by clicking on one of the "perk" options that you have an interest in. My goal is to raise $1,200. This pays for the remaining studio time and work needed to finish the EP as well as paying Indiegogo's fee of Crowd Funding this.

If I don't reach the entire goal, the funds received will go as far as I can take them in trying to finish the project in the future when I can raise enough funds to finish it. But let's not let that happen!

I've got some great PERKS you can see to purchase that will help reach my goal and also provide some fun and entertainment for you,


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help, I understand. None of us are made of money and we've all seen our own ups and downs in life. If you can't contribute, please do me a solid and at least share this with your friends and family. Maybe they can contribute $5 or $10... or more if they want. But thank you in advance for at least sharing this project and helping me reach my goal.

story:
Hi.  We are The Lied To's. 

Thanks for checking out our Indiegogo page


We are Susan Levine and Doug Kwartler, two singer-songwriters who have recently come together to form the duo The Lied To's.  We are asking for your help to fund the production and promotion of our debut cd. 

We are sure you have seen many crowd funding campaigns for musicians in the last couple of years.  As you may know, the music industry has changed a lot in the past decade and in some ways it's easier for songwriters to get their songs out to the people, but in many ways it's a lot harder to make a living at it.

So what we and other musicians are doing is asking our fans to help advance funds to us in exchange for perks and products like cds, posters, concerts, credits in liners notes and/or other great rewards (which you'll see here in our campaign).

Both of us have had some cool accomplishments in the past in our solo careers.  Susan has won songwriter awards and has played at some of the most prestigious music festivals across the country and Doug has had song placements on major network tv shows and has also played at top venues around the country. Just a few weeks ago, The Lied To's played a show to a full house at the legendary Bluebird Café in Nashville, TN.  We have received excellent feedback and feel there's a buzz growing around our duo!

By contributing to our campaign and others like ours, you will not only help us continue to create music for you, but you are also helping to put music and art out into the world.

Our goal is to raise $6,000.  Fortunately, Doug is a music producer with a studio just outside of Boston, so our recording needs will be taken care of at his Hollow Body Studios.  But we still need to raise money for the following:

PERKS:

Duplication, radio promotion, publicity/advertising and touring in support of the record. 

So...some of the perks we are offering are things like:

Autographed copies of our cd
Tickets to our big cd release show at Club Passim in Cambridge, MA
A concert in your home
Recording time at Doug's "Hollow Body Studios"

and more.  (see the perks list!)

story:
It's been nearly 3 years since I have released any new music. That's a long time. But during that time, I experienced a lot. I suffered from love lost, experienced the joy of new love found, taken countless road trips, adopted a new fur baby, became reunited with my best friend, enjoyed an inspirational cowrite on a rooftop in New York City, and found myself and my life's purpose. During those 3 years I wasn't always inspired by my music, and I agonized over prolonged writer's block. And then... it all came flooding to me in a dream.

 

This new album, Mind Games, is me. It's my life over the last 3 years. It's that place inside where my true self was hiding.  Every heartache, every epiphany I've had... it's right here in this project.  Words can't describe, and I can hardly contain, my excitement to share it with the world, but I need your help. I know many of you have been with me from the very beginning, watching me grow, and offering your love and support, your kind words asking when and how you can help. Here is your chance. I need your help to bring this project to a resolution, and, ultimately, to life.

 

I am currently in the studio, nearly halfway through this project. Some of you may remember the release date was initially October. Then it was November. Then it was December. Now it's just seemingly interminable. My previous album was recorded in a living room with virtually zero overhead, so to be quite honest, I had no idea what I was getting into trying to pursue a professionally produced album. It seems every little obstacle that can rear its ugly head finds its way to me and this album.  However, each little bump in the road is a blessing in disguise (see what I did there?), as it provides checks and balances to keep my head on straight during this process, and serves as a reminder not to over do it. Nonetheless, I have had to keep pushing the release further and further back, and my funds are dwindling as a result.

 

The ever-present paradox of recording is that the less money you have, the longer it takes. Meanwhile, the longer it takes, the more money it costs! I'm asking those of you who can, to please be an active part in the creation of this vision, so that it no longer has to be put on hold or drawn out and kept from you.

Here is how your generous contributions will be applied to this project:

  • Mixing/Mastering
  • The Remainder of My Studio Time
  • Remainder of Compensation for Studio Musicians
  • Photography
  • Album Art and Design
  • Disc Pressing/Packaging
  • Promotional Material (Posters, stickers, T-shirts, etc.)

My goal is to release this album in the spring of 2013 at the very latest, which leaves me only a few months to get this together. With your help, it CAN be done! To make it worth your while, I have included some great perks for you to claim in return for your contributions!

Thank you to everyone who is already involved in the creation of this album, and to those of you who will be involved by making your generous contributions!

For those who cannot help financially, you can help by spreading the word to others who may be interested in supporting independent music!

I am so, so excited to share this piece of my soul with you, and I could never do what I do without the love and support that you all bestow upon me! I love you all!

xo

Dannica

www.dannicalowery.com

story:
KJazz 88.1 FM needs your help to Save Our Jazz in our local schools near the Long Beach, CA area.  KJazz is kicking off the program with two student music concerts to benefit, support and extend music programs in and outside the classroom. Student groups from Oak Middle School, Woodrow Wilson Classical High School, JazzAngels, and the Jazz Studies Program at Cal State Long Beach will be performing at this 2-part concert series.

KJazz would like to invite local schools and student jazz groups to showcase their musical talents at the first annual KJazz Save Our Jazz Festival.

  • This 2-part special concert series will take place at KDB in Long Beach on February 17th and 24th, 2013 and offer opportunities for students and families to play, learn, share and inspire. 
  • Every $ we raise after we reach $2,500 will be donated to the school programs and proceeds from all tickets sold by the schools will go directly to their music programs!

We are using Indigogo to get the word out to help fund this amazing student concert series and to help cover venue rental, staffing, production costs, and local marketing.

Our objective for Save Our Jazz is to educate, inspire and develop new musicians, by giving them a place to showcase their talents.  As music programs are dwindling in schools, it is crucial that we find ways to develop the talent of young jazz musicians. With the help of individuals, foundations, and corporations, we hope to provide an opportunity for our youth to express their talents and encourage artistic growth both as an individual and as a group.  These student concerts will not only offer young musicians the encouragement they need, but also the financial resources necessary for their programs to continue.  

Education programs are facing budget cutbacks across the country, raising concerns about support for school music programs. Thank you for your help with this special project and we hope to create a summer series to support more schools in our area (with your help)!

Share with a friend to get the word out and use the Indiegogo share tool!

story:
The first thing I want to say is: THANK YOU! 

Thank you, everyone who has been at my shows, taken home a cd, shared my music with a friend, or made a financial contribution. Your support has been critical and also incredible.

The second thing is: I have so much HOPE!

The craziest things happened for me the last couple of years, and I know believing was the foundation of it all. So I'm reaching out to you in hope, with the belief that this new project is leagues ahead of my previous work and what needs to happen, will happen. I need your help!

I know not everyone is able to give at the moment. Believe me - I've been in a position where even $5.00 would have left me hurting. But please know you can still help tremendously. All you need to do is share the link to the campaign! Word of mouth is the most effective, most powerful marketing. I've always discovered my favorite artists through friends of mine.

With that said...

Money is a sensitive issue.

I will be honest: I am very insecure about these kinds of campaigns. It twists me up inside, and yet, I also know this is the only way for me to press forward.

One of my fears is that I will create a chasm between me and all my friends, fans and family when it appears that I simply don't want to use my own money to fund the album. I'm also afraid of a "failed" campaign (people gave, but the set goal wasn't reached), and being unable to fulfill all the perks for those who did give. 

I have given, and will continue to give, everything that I have for this - and every other - project I take on. But there comes a point when everything I've given, it just isn't enough. I have made a full personal effort to make all my projects happen. And I sincerely hope that you'll stand beside me now.

______________________________

Here are the numbers broken down for you. 

$500/song x 11 songs = $5,500

$500/video = $500

Mastering complete album = $500

*Printing physical copies (for pledgers/release) = $700

Grand total: $7,200

Should the campaign exceed this base number, all other funds will go toward promotion/radio campaigns. 


*Note: physical copies will only be given to pledgers, and those who attend the cd release party. I will not be printing copies of this album to sell at shows in 2014. The album will remain digital. The full album download will only be available to pledgers, and those who attend the release party. Each song will be released as a single, once a month, to the public – in other words, unless you pledge, the full album cannot be collected until each song has been dropped (1 year).

______________________________

The first single on AWAKENING, ' The River & The Rain,' was released Nov. 29, 2011. I still recall vividly playing it publicly for the first time in Oct. 2011 at Caffe Mela. If someone had told me all that would transpire in the year to follow, I would have laughed in disbelief.

I still wonder if it all really happened, or if I just visualized it so often that I stopped being able to tell the difference between dreams and reality.

But I have proof!

I played for Brandi Carlile!

I have a blast every time I play, and getting up on stage is always a dream-come-true. But anyone who's spent ten minutes with me knows that Brandi Carlile is my one-and-only. I will forever treasure the night I got to play for her at my favorite venue in Seattle. She hugged me! And signed my guitar! And I still repost the picture like a douche!

Also, sitting in the green room with Peter Bradley Adams while he taught me a harmony to sing with him was surreal. Life is a strange, strange thing.

As I've said in the past, I can't do this without you.

Regardless of money, I can't do this without you. The funds needed for the album are only one part of the whole.

You make my dreams come true. Thank you.

Music is powerful. As always, I hope to offer something inspiring, comforting and beautiful to the world. And you can help me do that.

Whether this is funded or not, I still have so much hope for the future! Seriously good things are going to happen in 2014, and you can be a part of that with me. Just you watch and see. 

 Here's the official video for the first single, "Whiskey Sea," shot by Jason Tang:

Share the video and pick up the MP3 free, here...

Love,

Kate Lynne Logan
story_txt:
The first thing I want to say is: THANK YOU! 
Thank you, everyone who has been at my shows, taken home a cd, shared my music with a friend, or made a financial contribution. Your support has been critical and also incredible.
The second thing is: I have so much HOPE!
The craziest things happened for me the last couple of years, and I know believing was the foundation of it all. So I'm reaching out to you in hope, with the belief that this new project is leagues ahead of my previous work and what needs to happen, will happen. I need your help!
I know not everyone is able to give at the moment. Believe me - I've been in a position where even $5.00 would have left me hurting. But please know you can still help tremendously. All you need to do is share the link to the campaign! Word of mouth is the most effective, most powerful marketing. I've always discovered my favorite artists through friends of mine.
With that said...
Money is a sensitive issue.
I will be honest: I am very insecure about these kinds of campaigns. It twists me up inside, and yet, I also know this is the only way for me to press forward.
One of my fears is that I will create a chasm between me and all my friends, fans and family when it appears that I simply don't want to use my own money to fund the album. I'm also afraid of a "failed" campaign (people gave, but the set goal wasn't reached), and being unable to fulfill all the perks for those who did give. 
I have given, and will continue to give, everything that I have for this - and every other - project I take on. But there comes a point when everything I've given, it just isn't enough. I have made a full personal effort to make all my projects happen. And I sincerely hope that you'll stand beside me now.______________________________
Here are the numbers broken down for you. 
$500/song x 11 songs = $5,500$500/video = $500Mastering complete album = $500*Printing physical copies (for pledgers/release) = $700Grand total: $7,200Should the campaign exceed this base number, all other funds will go toward promotion/radio campaigns. *Note: physical copies will only be given to pledgers, and those who attend the cd release party. I will not be printing copies of this album to sell at shows in 2014. The album will remain digital. The full album download will only be available to pledgers, and those who attend the release party. Each song will be released as a single, once a month, to the public – in other words, unless you pledge, the full album cannot be collected until each song has been dropped (1 year).______________________________The first single on AWAKENING, ' The River & The Rain,' was released Nov. 29, 2011. I still recall vividly playing it publicly for the first time in Oct. 2011 at Caffe Mela. If someone had told me all that would transpire in the year to follow, I would have laughed in disbelief.
I still wonder if it all really happened, or if I just visualized it so often that I stopped being able to tell the difference between dreams and reality.
But I have proof!
I played for Brandi Carlile!
I have a blast every time I play, and getting up on stage is always a dream-come-true. But anyone who's spent ten minutes with me knows that Brandi Carlile is my one-and-only. I will forever treasure the night I got to play for her at my favorite venue in Seattle. She hugged me! And signed my guitar! And I still repost the picture like a douche!
Also, sitting in the green room with Peter Bradley Adams while he taught me a harmony to sing with him was surreal. Life is a strange, strange thing.
As I've said in the past, I can't do this without you.
Regardless of money, I can't do this without you. The funds needed for the album are only one part of the whole.
You make my dreams come true. Thank you.
Music is powerful. As always, I hope to offer something inspiring, comforting and beautiful to the world. And you can help me do that.
Whether this is funded or not, I still have so much hope for the future! Seriously good things are going to happen in 2014, and you can be a part of that with me. Just you watch and see.  Here's the official video for the first single, "Whiskey Sea," shot by Jason Tang:Share the video and pick up the MP3 free, here...Love,
Kate Lynne Logan

story:
Once you've backed this project with a donation of $10 or more, send a copy of your receipt to info@thisisschematic.com and I'll send you Fluorescent as a personal thank you for your support!

************************************************************************

My name is Dave Elkins and I am the creator of Schematic.

What exactly is Schematic?

www.thisisschematic.com

Schematic is a culmination of creativity, art, thought, struggle, frustration, faith, innovation, and connection. Schematic is the plan to share these things through a community that we create together. Schematic listens to you and meets you where you are because Schematic is you! If you are an artist, a musician, a graphic designer, a photographer, a painter, a film maker, a writer, a poet, etc; if your passion is simply listening to music or discovering new art, spreading the word about new music, connecting people, helping others in need, serving your community, then welcome to Schematic. Schematic is the community of artists, creatives, musicians, and people who simply enjoy connection through relationship and rely on each other to fulfill each others needs. In short, Schematic is meant to be a microcosm within the music and art industry that relies on grassroots growth through community.

Schematic will operate on four pillars:

Schematic Studios

Schematic Records

Schematic Management

&

The Schematic Community

 

The Schematic Community will be a public web based application where artists will find their audience and build a network of opportunities for development.  The Community will facilitate a new relationship between the artist and the audience as well as connect artists together.  It will be opportunity for music fans to find new music and champion it with tools we can provide.

This indiegogo campaign is our attempt to raise funds in order to build a new type of community for emerging artists to reach their new audience, the Schematic Community.

I moved to Nashville back in January of 2011 for a specific reason. After spending almost 10 years in the trenches with my bandmates

www.facebook.com/mae

my interest for the music business and it's future grew and I decided to place myself in the center of Music City.  I wanted to learn and grow in this business being in the thick of the landscape.  I wanted to be part of change the industry is both resisting and birthing and watch the control fall back into the hands of the artists and the creators.  If I had the chance to be one of the factors behind this change, nothing would make me more fulfilled.

Since moving here, I have built my studio, produced several artists and records, begun managing a few bands, and launched Schematic Records. 

I've also been putting together an idea for a web application that will service the needs of the emerging artist, help manage the business aspects easily, and facilitate the relationship between the artist and the audience all culminating to 360 degrees of artist development, not taking 360 degrees of an artist's income!

http://www.npr.org/blogs/therecord/2010/11/24/131574836/you-ask-we-answer-what-exactly-is-a-360-deal

This app also finds a new way to get music from emerging artists into the ears and hands of a community looking for new music, new art, new creativity, and new opportunity.  

I've partnered with young web designers who believe in Schematic's vision and have taken the vision as far as it can go. 

It is now time to design, create, and facilitate the Schematic Community.

Amanda Palmer was right when she said, "This is the future of music," and that "We are the media."  

With crowdfunding methods, social networking tools, and media platforms from PledgeMusic to ReverbNation, the opportunities for DIY artists to create something, set a goal, and connect directly to their audience is quickly taking over the music business model.  So it is possible for more artists to turn their creativity into a physical/digital product that can be shared/distributed with it's base.

Yet there are plenty of 360 deals being signed, royalties keep finding their way into the wrong pockets, and the shelf life of the aspiring artist gets shorter and shorter.  

Why?

You can generally go one of two ways: 

Search for that label deal, the criminal contract where you give a high percentage of all net profits away, take an advance on an incredibly high interest loan, sell your rights away, and cross your fingers hoping for success before the label implodes or simply gives up on your project.  

Or you could finance the creation of your artwork by yourself with the help of your fanbase, spend the budget you grow together on creating, packaging, and shipping your product, own your rights, but then what?!  
Too often, the momentum stops soon after you've accomplished your creative goal, but before you've really hit the streets promoting and marketing your brand and your product. Artists raise just enough money to create their art but not enough to market it and grow their fanbase.

At least when you sign one of those god-awful deals, with one of those faceless labels, your music, your art, your brand, gets pumped into a machine where hundreds of projects are marketed every year.  Sure, you could get lost in the shuffle, especially if you're not generating the kind of income to keep "the machine's" attention, but at least contractually, you have some attention.  You just had to give away about 80-90% of the income that will be made off of your art away to get that attention.

So essentially both options have their drawbacks.  

Own your rights but take on the responsibility of marketing, distribution and business or sell your rights, cross your fingers, hope for the best and work for peanuts.

But with the Schematic Community, you will finally get the perks of the independent artist and the strengths of a label and marketing team.

We already have established Schematic Studios, Schematic Records, & Schematic Management & Mentoring.  

The next step is to create the Schematic Community.  

Schematic Artists will always retain ownership of their artwork as Schematic only licenses products from their artists allowing them to profit from their creations over a lifetime.  This provides an opportunity for artists to build careers off of their creativity not flashes in a pan. 

Schematic Management will not take commissions off of gross percentage but rather net receipts. This simply means that if you aren't profiting, neither is Schematic Management.

These are just two of the fundamentals Schematic operates on.

Schematic is a BIG idea!

So throughout this campaign, I will be answering questions, explaining the mission of Schematic in greater detail, sharing stories of my experience in the music industry, and giving you an opportunity to share your thoughts, stories, and opinions.

If all of this sounds like a good idea to you, if you would like to help build the Schematic Community, thank you! Your donation will go much further than the making of one record or one product. You will help create an opportunity to give emerging artists the chance to build their creativity, talent, and dreams into a career with longevity and not just a quick 15 minutes of fame.

If you are only interested in getting new music from "The guy from MAE," that will work too! I've been writing, recording, and producing new music for the last two years and have been waiting for this moment and this platform to share it with you! Check out my new song, "Stand" right here:

 

Stand by IAMSCHEMATIC

 

My new EP, Fluorescent is done and yours to listen to. I am now working on a full length album called, Color (n.) Inside The Lines. I'll do my best to finish this music before the end of 2012. As soon the album is complete, it will also be yours, as for now, donating to Schematic's indiegogo campaign will be the only way for you to get this music.

 

Fluorescent from This Is Schematic on Vimeo.

 

Thank you so much for your interest and for your support! Please spread the word in every way that you can and help us build the Schematic.

Together we will create the diagram and the plan.

-Schematic / Dave Elkins

***The Fluorescent EP is now available! Once you have backed our project please send your receipt to info@thisisschematic.com and we will send you a high quality digital download of "Stand" or the entire EP as a thank you gift.  Color (n.) Inside The Lines is in production right now.  We will send you the album as soon as it's finished!***

***************************************************************

There is a web design company in Brooklyn called Social Studies I have been working with for some time now. If we hit our goal, I will be able to bring a real budget to their team of talented creatives. We will partner together to see the vision and functionality of the Schematic Community come to life.

www.wethesocial.com

My cousin Andy Mellon is the founder of Social Studies. He spent a couple of years working with MAE and witnessed us produce, manage, and label ourselves. He managed all creative marketing aspects of the band from tour production to album artwork to video and web development. He has seen and been a part of the behind the scenes process of marketing and managing a band. I believe he will be the perfect man to spearhead the creation of the Schematic Community!

•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••
 
Once you've backed this project with a donation of $10 or more, send a copy of your receipt to info@thisisschematic.com and I'll send you Fluorescent as a personal thank you for your support!

THIS PROJECT IS NOT LIVE This is only a draft that the creator has chosen to share.

story:
Short Summary

Hello There! We are Plantation and thanks for checking out our Campaign! So now that you found us let me tell you more about the project your about to support!

Plantation is a 4 piece Hard Rock band based out of Philadelphia, PA. The band consists of founder Patrick Fiore on Guitar, Corey Presner on Vocals (and sometimes bass), Ben Torpey on Drums and Matthew Williams on Bass. The band was founded in 2011 by Fiore in Vineland, NJ. He chose the band name Plantation based on the concept of wanting to plant a seed of positivity through music and creating a Plantation of awakened fans (The Plant Nation), and his lifelong dream of owning a self-sustaining commune/recording studio!

Now that you know a little bit of background about us et me tell you why you should help us out.

In this day an age the music business is in a complete state of disarray. Large record companies have corrupted the magic that is making music and replaced it with watered down hallucinations of heros past. Rock and Roll barely exists on a mainstream level and when it does it lacks the soul and passion that made it immortal, but you don't have to settle for the boring crap anymore... If you don't want to.

This campaign is very important for many reasons:

  • First and Foremost, by supporting our effort your showing the record companies that your tired of hearing the same 4 songs over and over again. Thus showing them you are willing to support artists you find and like on your own.
  • Secondly, Your helping 4 guys realize their dream of making records.
  • Finally, Your Supporting Rock & Roll!

So if you believe in rock and roll & like our music please donate!                                   What We Need & What You Get

The funding we require for this EP will breakdown as follows:

Recording/mixing/Mastering- $3250

CD Pressings- $2000

Cd Artwork- $500-$700

Digital Download Cards-$350

As you can see we asked for much less then what it will actually take to pay for the entire project. We realize that times are tough and the holidays are upon us! Any amount of funding we raise would be an enormous help to our cause. 

The Impact

When it comes down to it we are just 4 broke guys trying to do what we love. Most of us took up extra jobs to help pay for this record. Every dollar we earn from this campaign helps to validate the hard work and life force we put into creating our art. We really appreciate each one of  your donations!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. If you believe in our dream but can't contribute monetarily please show this page to everyone you know! Everyone who sees this is just another person who can help us share our art with the WORLD!

story:
What is this, the semi-short version

This is a fundraiser to help two DIY (Do It Yourself) queer punx in Sweden, Sanna and Sabina, release the first record on their small record label Crush & Create Records, that they started the summer of 2013.
We believe that dreams are meant to be followed even if you're poor and that is why we started the record label --it's our dream. It is also very much needed since there is no such thing as a queer feminist label in Sweden, maybe not even a label that is calling themselves feminist in the first breath. 

The record It is going to be available on a wonderful, touchable 7 inch vinyl, and also digitally because we're that tech savvy..


What?

  • 35 days to raise $1100
  • Two bad ass queer punk bands, each get one side of the vinyl
  • "Abolish Straightcore" – 250 physical copies to start
  • Great cover art, ear blasting political music and an extensive insert with lyrics and other goodies

Why?

  • To help spread queer punk, that has little space in the punk scene in Sweden
  • Be a part of creating community for queer punx, in Sweden, all over Europe and the world
  • The best alternative to capitalism you'll find
  • We will love you forever


Maybe you've already made up your mind, but if you want us to persuade you even more, just keep reading!

(Please note that the long version can go on for hours, though we don't mind telling it please get in touch!)

What We Need & What You Get

We like lists, here's some more facts:

  • We need $1100 for the pressing of the record, this is done in the Czech Republic at a little DIY vinyl pressing place that we found (that's unsupportive to oppressive shit). All the money is going to the payment of 250 copies, and to start off the printing of the insert that we make and print ourselves.

  • Even if we don't reach the goal of $1100 we get the money that you give, every dollar/euro/svensk krona is important! We have some money but we need your help.

  • Apart from the joy of helping out to fund this life-changing project, you get eternal love and awesome perks --including the record, our second (re-)release of Canadian band Eekum Seekum's sold out "Glitterbomb", a zine, a mix of patches from our distro and more! (check out the list to the right)

The Impact

"Why is it important to have a queer feminist record label, and release a record?" you might ask.
Well, making music is a very powerful way of expressing oneself, playing and showing it to others are a way of creating community that sometimes even saves lives. This is no joke.

As gender-non-conforming people we know that A LOT of us are subject to discrimination and violence in our daily life. One could, without risking much, even argue that all of us have experienced the one or the other, or even both, at least once (but probably more than once).

Having community help us survive. Sharing our stories help us survive. Saving our stories on records help future queers survive.

Getting queer punk recorded and released help this process of community building/story sharing/hirstory creating. Having fellow queers and feminists doing this is crucial to even dare to think about making it reality.

A poor queer just like us? You can still help!

We understand that some of you that agree that this is an important project just can’t contribute with money, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Here are some ideas:

  • Make some noise! Share this fundraiser online on social media (you know facebook/tumblr/twitter/grindr/wherever you are). This means a lot!

  • Talk about it with your friends and in your zine!

  • Start your own band!

  • Start your own label!


Do you have a distro/queer space of any kind and wanna help us spread the record when it is out? Get in touch at queer at crushandcreate dot se!


Links!

Crush & Create Records on Facebook
Crush & Create Records website

Flocken on Facebook
Flocken on Bandcamp

FUK (Fucked Up Kueers) on Facebook
FUK (Fucked Up Kueers) on Bandcamp
story_txt:
What is this, the semi-short versionThis is a fundraiser to help two DIY (Do It Yourself) queer punx in Sweden, Sanna and Sabina, release the first record on their small record label Crush & Create Records, that they started the summer of 2013. We believe that dreams are meant to be followed even if you're poor and that is why we started the record label --it's our dream. It is also very much needed since there is no such thing as a queer feminist label in Sweden, maybe not even a label that is calling themselves feminist in the first breath. The record It is going to be available on a wonderful, touchable 7 inch vinyl, and also digitally because we're that tech savvy..What?
35 days to raise $1100

Two bad ass queer punk bands, each get one side of the vinyl

"Abolish Straightcore" – 250 physical copies to start
Great cover art, ear blasting political music and an extensive insert with lyrics and other goodies
Why?
To help spread queer punk, that has little space in the punk scene in Sweden
Be a part of creating community for queer punx, in Sweden, all over Europe and the world
The best alternative to capitalism you'll find
We will love you forever

Maybe you've already made up your mind, but if you want us to persuade you even more, just keep reading!(Please note that the long version can go on for hours, though we don't mind telling it please get in touch!)What We Need & What You GetWe like lists, here's some more facts:
We need $1100 for the pressing of the record, this is done in the Czech Republic at a little DIY vinyl pressing place that we found (that's unsupportive to oppressive shit). All the money is going to the payment of 250 copies, and to start off the printing of the insert that we make and print ourselves. 

Even if we don't reach the goal of $1100 we get the money that you give, every dollar/euro/svensk krona is important! We have some money but we need your help.

Apart from the joy of helping out to fund this life-changing project, 
you get eternal love and awesome perks --including the record, our second (re-)release of Canadian band Eekum Seekum's sold out "Glitterbomb", a zine, a mix of patches from our distro and more! (check out the list to the right)

The Impact"Why is it important to have a queer feminist record label, and release a record?" you might ask.Well, making music is a very powerful way of expressing oneself, playing and showing it to others are a way of creating community that sometimes even saves lives. This is no joke. As gender-non-conforming people we know that A LOT of us are subject to discrimination and violence in our daily life. One could, without risking much, even argue that all of us have experienced the one or the other, or even both, at least once (but probably more than once). Having community help us survive. Sharing our stories help us survive. Saving our stories on records help future queers survive. Getting queer punk recorded and released help this process of community building/story sharing/hirstory creating. Having fellow queers and feminists doing this is crucial to even dare to think about making it reality. A poor queer just like us? You can still help!
We understand that some of you that agree that this is an important project just can’t contribute with money, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Here are some ideas:

Make some noise! Share this fundraiser online on social media (you know facebook/tumblr/twitter/grindr/wherever you are). This means a lot!

Talk about it with your friends and in your zine!

Start your own band!

Start your own label!

Do you have a distro/queer space of any kind and wanna help us spread the record when it is out? Get in touch at queer at crushandcreate dot se!Links!Crush & Create Records on FacebookCrush & Create Records websiteFlocken on FacebookFlocken on BandcampFUK (Fucked Up Kueers) on FacebookFUK (Fucked Up Kueers) on Bandcamp

story:
I am a lyric soprano who, at the age of 17, was diagnosed with retinitis pigmentosa, a degenerative eye condition that leads to loss of sight and blindness. My sight has slowly deteriorated over the years and in October 2013 I was registered blind. Currently there is no cure, but science is constantly developing, so here’s hoping…

Several things have kept me strong through this transition: my passion for singing and music, along with the constant support from the Royal National Institution of Blind People (RNIB). So I asked myself how I could give something back to RNIB, and decided to produce an album of classical songs and operatic arias; a mixture of music that has led me to where I am today. However, I cannot do this without your help!

Why should you support my project? Well, you would not only be supporting me as an emerging musician, but you would also be supporting the RNIB and almost 2 million people, like me, with sight loss, who the RNIB help both emotionally and practically with their day to day lives. 

RNIB's vision is of a world where people who are blind and partially sighted enjoy the same rights, responsibilities, opportunities an quality of life as people who are sighted. Our mission is to challenge blindness by empowering people who are blind or partially sighted, removing the barriers they face and helping to prevent blindness. I want to help the to continue this invaluable work.


What will your money go towards?

Initially, your money will go towards the production of the CD, which will in turn raise money for RNIB. Money will go towards:

-  Time spent in the recording studio plus sound technician

-  Pianist fees

-  Mixing and mastering costs

-  CD production and duplication costs

-  CD artwork costs

-  Publicity costs

I am very grateful that some extremely gifted people are willing to give their talents for a reduced fee for this project, which means that I have been able to massively decrease the costs.

If I am unable to reach my target, I will use any money I have raised to complete the initial recording stage and then work towards raising the funds to complete the CD (artwork, production, publicity etc).


What do you get if you contribute?

Aside from my eternal gratitude, there are many perks that are available to you if you are willing to contribute towards my project...

Pledge £5 and you will receive a hand written thank you note from me

Pledge £10 and you will receive a download version of the album

Pledge £15 and you will receive a hard copy of the album

Pledge £25 and you will receive a signed hard copy of the album

Pledge £50 and you will receive a signed hard copy of the album plus an invite to the launch party

Pledge £100 and you will receive a signed copy of the album, an invite to the launch party and your name written in the 'Thank you' section of the CD booklet

Pledge £250 and you will receive a signed copy of the album, an invite to the launch party and your company logo included in the CD booklet

Pledge £500 and you will receive a signed copy of the album, an invite to the launch party, your name or company logo included in the CD booklet and I will perform at your wedding or other event

Please also help me by sharing my campaign with your friends and family, on Facebook, Twitter etc. Any help you can offer is invaluable, and I will be forever grateful.

story:
About me- My name is Jeri Barber. I am a junior in high school in rural upstate New York. I work hard for excellent grades. My love in life is music. I have been playing clarinet for six years and wish to continue on the music path into college. Throughout my musical experience, I have been first clarinet, president of band, librarian for choir, stage manager for drama club, and Drum Major for marching band. I have participated in area all state, all counties, NYSSMA, Syracuse University Honors band, SU Allegro band, SU Girls Leadership Academy of Music, and have been going to sumer music camps since 7th grade.  

Why I am Campaigning?

While perfoming clarinet at Syracuse University's youth programs, I was able to meet and get to know the SU band director. During one of our rehersals in September, he had asked me to perform in a band that he would be conducting for three weeks over the summer in Europe. This band consists of a select group of students from northeast United States and is hosted by the touring program of American Music Abroad. The tour will cost over $6000 and any money given will help greatly.  

Importance of perfoming in Europe-

This opportunity is a great honor for me. However, I will share this experience with my classmates and friends. Many people in the area that I live will never be able to afford a trip abroad. Perhaps my pictures and stories will help bring other cultures closer to home. For myself, I will include this trip on my college applications. I hope it will give me a better chance of being accepted into college. I would like to go to college for Music Business at SUNY Potsdam or Syracuse University.

Extra Facts about Performing in Europe-

I will meet in a central location this spring with the other selected students to recieve more information about the trip and the music we will be performing. While in Europe we will be performing at many different locations in Austria, Germany and Czech Republic. We will also be able to sight see in the city of The Sound of Music, cathedrals, and a concentration camp at Dachau.  

What Your Money Will be Used for-

I have to pay for everthing for this trip, including the cost of air travel, transportation, housing, food, water, new/nice clothing, passport, and extra clarinet supplies.

My Mom's imput-

I, as a mother, I am proud of my daughter's accomplishments. She is giving up her Christmas and birthday presents to use the money towards this trip. Our family is working hard as a group to gather the money which would allow my daughter to go  but we need some help financially. I thank you for your generous gift. I hope that someday she will be in a position to help others in return.

story:
Let's make a difference.

Hey guys, Berlo here.

Not many people are aware of this, but I was born with a very rare heart defect that required me to receive surgery at the very early stages of my life. My family were not sure if I would come out of that operation room alive. Their first born, potentially gone to something they had absolutely no control over.

Now, 22 years on, I am alive, living my dreams, extremely grateful for my health and I honestly would not be here today without the support and research from the Heart Foundation.

What our goal is?

Basically, I would love to print as many of these shirts as possible so that we can raise as much money as possible for the Heart Foundation. We are happy to get these made in as many different sizes as required and all profits will be given directly to the Heart Foundation.

What impact will this have?

The Heart Foundation saves lives and improves health through funding world-class cardiovascular research, guidelines for health professionals, informing the public and assisting people with cardiovascular disease.

While their work over the past five decades has helped reduce the number of deaths, cardiovascular disease (heart, stroke and blood vessel disease) remains one of Australia’s most devastating health problems.

Every little bit helps and we want to do anything to support this amazing organisation that helps save so many lives each year.

Other ways you can help?

We know some people just can’t contribute financially to this campaign, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Just letting your friends and family know about this campaign is a huge support for us.

story:
We'll just lay it out...

Hey there everyone, its Albany's organic jam band Formula 5, reaching out to our fans, friends, and family for your HELP! Over the last 2 plus years, we have been playing lots of shows all over the northeast and we even were able to scrape up enough money to put together our Self-Funded first EP of 6 tracks last year. As many of you know, playing and touring in a new, original band can be very costly and our budgets are quite small due to travel costs, equipment upgrades, and a multitude of other things.


Despite these financial obstacles, this time around we wanted to put together a true LP with 13 tracks on it and the feeling of a complete, cohesive album of our road-tested material. We decided to record at the beautiful Edie Road Studios in Argyle, NY and put a lot of time and thought into the tracks selected, the album artwork, the recording and mixing engineer, and many other nuances to make this album our best yet. This ambitious endeavor has proved to be a very difficult and costly one. While our fanbase continues to grow and we are playing bigger and better shows, the money coming in is not enough to self-fund an album of this size! We have finished about 75% of our recording but we need YOUR help to finish it and pay our studio bill! We are asking for any help you can give and we have some perks available to show our gratitude!

What We Need

Making an album can be a very expensive process. We have worked to try and create the best possible album we can without putting us 10K+ in debt. We are hoping to raise $5,000 to cover our costs but to give you a better idea of the costs associated with making an album here's a quick breakdown of the costs:

  • Recording and Mixing (Studio fees, engineer fees) - $3,000
  • Mastering - $400
  • Album Art - $500
  • CD Replication - $1,100

What It Means to Us

This project is incredibly important to us and feels like the culmination of our many years of playing music together and 2+ years playing together with Formula 5. Music is our lifeblood and we put everything we possibly can into making it better. Every dollar will be going into this album and this will help us to really grow as a band getting better gigs, better exposure, and numerous other perks as a band. 

We have offered up a multitude of different perks for those that wish to help fund our project. They range from a digital copy of our album to a private full-on electric rock show in your living room (or garage).

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that many people are not in a position to contribute financially. But don't worry, you can still help us out by spreading the word! Social media is king now and by simply telling some friends or sharing this funding project, it helps us out immensely!

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts, this has been an unbelievable ride for the past couple of years and we promise you that this album proves to be some of our best work yet and should help to propel us into the future. 

Also... Our album release party is scheduled for April 18th at Red Square with special guests The Hornitz and Suitable Groove!

- Joe, Bill, Mike, and Greg (Formula 5)

story:
Our Story

In 1982 the Brown Derbies were founded by Darryl Shrock, the famous Derby #1. The Derbies quickly become well known across the country for their unique arrangements and fun-filled performances. After feats such as performing for President Clinton in the White House, taking the state at Carnegie Hall, and bringing our music to London in 2012, we want to start 2014 off the Derby way with a trip to Europe--but we need your help!

The Impact

The Derbies are taking their music to Europe! We are always looking for ways to spread the Derby love. Whether we are workshopping with choral students at an international school in Amsterdam or singing in the streets of London, we just want to add a little more music in everyone's lives. 

What We Need & What You Get

While a trip to Europe will be amazing, we need your help to make it happen. The costs of flights and housing in Europe are very high and we need all the help we can get. In return you get different perks to show off your Derby love! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about our tour! We are trying to reach as many people as possible with our new album and love getting new fans. 

Get In Touch!

To learn more about us check out on our website, Facebook Page, Twitter, and YouTube Channel at the links below:

Official Website

Facebook

Twitter

YouTube Channel

story:
The world's First Smart Freedom Network. 

Connect your voice™ to the world without limitations. 

 The ultimate music, VoIP & live broadcast station for your life.


                             

All Your Favorite & Most Useful Features in One Place

Give your donations to the gloodzz smart freedom network project to continue the development of windows & android prototypes and develop for the other major platforms. We need your donations to establish the gloodzz data center San Francisco,  CA, USA. Gloodzz will be developed for all major platforms to give optimum experience for everyone in the world.



Anyone like to feel the freedom without limitations ? change the way you connect with your friends/ fans / customers. 

Let everyone to feel the freedom with Gloodzz, contributing via Indiegogo.

THE WORLD'S FIRST SMART FREEDOM NETWORK.


Bringing you the most useful smart features to connect your voice to the world.Biggest Freedom place for collect real fans/friends/customers, share voice clips, free HD VoIP calls, IM and live broadcasting.Explore, Listen, Share, Broadcast, Connect With Real People. Spend Your Time For Useful Things.

One Device, One Window , Smart Features.

  • Unlimited friends , Don't worry about your friends limit, gloodzz will not limit your community. Feel it like your home.
  • Use voice comment Feature to post fancy voice comments & text to voice feature for comment and story reading.
  • Free IM, HD VOIP , Voice clips / Music Sharing
  • Free HD screen sharing with gloodzz watch together.
  • Free unique country specified virtual caller id.
  • Free HD Video group calls up to 20 people
  • Free Live video or audio broadcast stations for your friends or fans/ business.
  • Unlimited voice & video mails
  • Smart control tools for internet bandwidth/speed to reduce your internet Bill
  • Free 100Gb on Cloud with world first biggest free storage allocation for one person

  • Free SMS to your friend's mobile in personal accounts.  This feature will be available for fan pages if your followers have subscribed to get your live updates.
  • chat history as a diary for future reading and it will give you easy access to find your history.
  • gloodzz will be developed as an Opensource project to give better experience for the all users.

Give your donations to the gloodzz smart freedom network project to continue the development of windows & android prototypes and develop for the other major platforms. We need your donations to establish the gloodzz data center San Francisco,  CA, USA. Gloodzz will be developed for all major platforms to give optimum experience for everyone in the world., gloodzz will be available for Windows/ Mac / Linux / Android / IOS /  windows phone / Blackberry / Symbian  with your valuable contribution. We hope most of the users will be able to access the gloodzz smart network to feel their benefits as gloodzz available for all major platforms.

Voice over IP (VoIP) was developed in order to provide the voice communication around the world. In most places, voice communication is quite costly.And don't have better video quality for video calls but very expensive or had limitations. Consider making a phone call to a person living in a country half the globe away. The first thing you think of in this case is your phone bill! VoIP solves this problem and many others.

Save your money begin with gloodzz freedom

If you don’t use VoIP for voice communication, then you are most certainly using the good old phone line (PSTN – Packet-Switched Telephone Network). On a PSTN line, time is really money. You actually pay for each minute you spend communicating on the phone. International calls are much more expensive. Since VoIP uses the Internet as backbone, the only cost you have when using it is the monthly Internet bill to your Internet Service Provider.But with Gloodzz, You are free to use the service with high quality free features. And you can optimize your internet speed, bandwidth with Gloodzz and reduce your monthly internet bills, this was one of most headache had for the most of VoIP users, cause the VoIP software eats lot of Mega bytes from your Internet package and you don't have any option to control your bandwidth while you are calling. That's why Gloodzz came as a solution to give you all controls of the service.

More than two persons, Free Life Time HD support with Bandwidth control, Listen & Share your voice.

On the phone line, only two persons can speak at a time. With VoIP, you can setup a conference with a whole team communicating in real time.But today most of voIP service providers charge a fee from the users for conversasion with multiple people, and charge for HD calls, They only give very low quality service for free. Thats why gloodzz comes with totally free rich features.Gloodzz is the only solution to reduce your internet bill controlling the internet speed while you are calling.

gloodzz gives you the most useful features for free. Spend Your Time For Useful Things.

Put simply, Quality of Service (QoS) in VoIP is the level of ‘quality’ offered by the VoIP service to place calls in a decent way. QoS varies according to technology. What I call good QoS for VoIP is the strict that can allow you to make a decent call without suffering from delays,weird sounds, noise and echo. You want to converse just like you would over a landline phone.But today all these features are only available for users who can pay for the services. Give your donations to the gloodzz smart freedom network project to continue the development of windows & android prototypes and develop for the other major platforms. We need your donations to establish the gloodzz data center San Francisco,  CA, USA. Gloodzz will be developed for all major platforms to give optimum experience for everyone in the world.










Anyone like to feel the freedom without limitations ? change the way you connect with your friends/ fans / customers. 

Let everyone to feel the freedom with Gloodzz, contributing via Indiegogo.
THE WORLD'S FIRST SMART FREEDOM NETWORK.


Bringing you the most useful smart features to connect your voice to the world.Biggest Freedom place for collect real fans/friends/customers, share voice clips, free HD VoIP calls, IM and live broadcasting.Explore, Listen, Share, Broadcast, Connect With Real People. Spend Your Time For Useful Things.

chat history as a diary for future reading and it will give you easy access to find your history.

Voice over IP (VoIP) was developed in order to provide the voice communication around the world. In most places, voice communication is quite costly.And don't have better video quality for video calls but very expensive or had limitations. Consider making a phone call to a person living in a country half the globe away. The first thing you think of in this case is your phone bill! VoIP solves this problem and many others.


Save your money begin with gloodzz freedom
If you don’t use VoIP for voice communication, then you are most certainly using the good old phone line (PSTN – Packet-Switched Telephone Network). On a PSTN line, time is really money. You actually pay for each minute you spend communicating on the phone. International calls are much more expensive. Since VoIP uses the Internet as backbone, the only cost you have when using it is the monthly Internet bill to your Internet Service Provider.But with Gloodzz, You are free to use the service with high quality free features. And you can optimize your internet speed, bandwidth with Gloodzz and reduce your monthly internet bills, this was one of most headache had for the most of VoIP users, cause the VoIP software eats lot of Mega bytes from your Internet package and you don't have any option to control your bandwidth while you are calling. That's why Gloodzz came as a solution to give you all controls of the service.



More than two persons, Free Life Time HD support with Bandwidth control, Listen & Share your voice.
On the phone line, only two persons can speak at a time. With VoIP, you can setup a conference with a whole team communicating in real time.But today most of voIP service providers charge a fee from the users for conversasion with multiple people, and charge for HD calls, They only give very low quality service for free. Thats why gloodzz comes with totally free rich features.Gloodzz is the only solution to reduce your internet bill controlling the internet speed while you are calling.
gloodzz gives you the most useful features for free. Spend Your Time For Useful Things.
Put simply, Quality of Service (QoS) in VoIP is the level of ‘quality’ offered by the VoIP service to place calls in a decent way. QoS varies according to technology. What I call good QoS for VoIP is the strict that can allow you to make a decent call without suffering from delays,weird sounds, noise and echo. You want to converse just like you would over a landline phone.But today all these features are only available for users who can pay for the services. Gloodzz will give you the all features free to feel your freedom.High quality music play stations. HD  broadcasting stations will be available with Gloodzz.
