story:
Short Summary

Dreams are for real is self own company T.Vincent wishes to develop on her successful journey as a writer.

This company would be a learning center, helping inspired artist/athletes to reach their dreams.

The idea for the name of the company originated  from a quote by Tupac Shakur (Rap artist/Poet),

"Reality is Wrong.  Dreams are for Real" (2Pac).

T.Vincent has always admire his words of wisdom.  

"There were times I almost gave up on my dreams...on life. Nevertheless, when I almost do, I hold my 'write' arm up and read these tatted words engraved in my skin for eternity" (T.Vincent).

What We Need & What You Get

  • dreams are for real. are looking  to raise $ 50, 000 to purchase equipment for the learning centre (the location will be in the Toronto Area with expectations to grow Canada wide).
  • We will provide a gymnasium for the athletes with accessible equipment
  • We will provide Office space/rooms for the artist 
  • Though we may not reach our target, all funds will still be used to purchase equipment.

The Impact

  • Our project 'dreams are for real.' is to help provide affordable services for under privileged youth and low income families. The focus of dreams are for real. is to help inspiring artist and athletes fulfill their dreams* 
    • Career Planning: Resume/Cover building, Career Search
    • Reading and Writing Workshops: English and French
    • Young Adult Clubs
    • Non-Profit Children Summer Camp
    • Free Mental Health Counselling   

* We are not agents, and we do not guarantee you will become famous. We are fellow dreamers looking to make a difference in people lives. Becoming famous would be great; However, why not consider finding other ways to live out your dreams?  

Risks & Challenges

Many companies, such as Tim Hortons offer great services and opportunities for  youth. The credit that Tim Hortons achieved  was and still is for being such a successful and well known business with great customer service. 

Also, through out the GTA, there are many community centres for adults, young adults, youth and children . 

These are a few challenges we face.

  • Nonetheless, they do not provide a centre for Youth, Children, Young Adults and Adults with affordable services
  • Extended after school hours
  • We will be open 7 days a week.
  • No age limit to young adult, or adult clubs/courses (each course will have its age range; ie. 6-12/13-16 /16-18/18- 25/25-40/40-60 etc. but will be offered for every person)
  • Open door policy

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • We accept physical donations for sports (equipment: Basketball, Soccer, Hockey, Tennis)
  • We accept physical donations for Arts (Computers, Tablets, Tables, Chairs, Studio equipment-Mics, Guitars, Turntables, ALL INSTRUMENTS  .
  •  Use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the dreams!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Dreams are for real is self own company T.Vincent wishes to develop on her successful journey as a writer.
This company would be a learning center, helping inspired artist/athletes to reach their dreams.
The idea for the name of the company originated  from a quote by Tupac Shakur (Rap artist/Poet),
"Reality is Wrong.  Dreams are for Real" (2Pac).
T.Vincent has always admire his words of wisdom.  
"There were times I almost gave up on my dreams...on life. Nevertheless, when I almost do, I hold my 'write' arm up and read these tatted words engraved in my skin for eternity" (T.Vincent). What We Need & What You Get
 
dreams are for real. are looking  to raise $ 50, 000 to purchase equipment for the learning centre (the location will be in the Toronto Area with expectations to grow Canada wide). We will provide a gymnasium for the athletes with accessible equipment
We will provide Office space/rooms for the artist  Though we may not reach our target, all funds will still be used to purchase equipment.    The Impact  Our project 'dreams are for real.' is to help provide affordable services for under privileged youth and low income families. The focus of dreams are for real. is to help inspiring artist and athletes fulfill their dreams* 

Career Planning: Resume/Cover building, Career Search

Reading and Writing Workshops: English and French
Young Adult Clubs
Non-Profit Children Summer Camp
Free Mental Health Counselling   

    * We are not agents, and we do not guarantee you will become famous. We are fellow dreamers looking to make a difference in people lives. Becoming famous would be great; However, why not consider finding other ways to live out your dreams?  
Risks & Challenges Many companies, such as Tim Hortons offer great services and opportunities for  youth. The credit that Tim Hortons achieved  was and still is for being such a successful and well known business with great customer service. 
Also, through out the GTA, there are many community centres for adults, young adults, youth and children . 
These are a few challenges we face.  Nonetheless, they do not provide a centre for Youth, Children, Young Adults and Adults with affordable services Extended after school hours
We will be open 7 days a week.
No age limit to young adult, or adult clubs/courses (each course will have its age range; ie. 6-12/13-16 /16-18/18- 25/25-40/40-60 etc. but will be offered for every person)
Open door policy    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  We accept physical donations for sports (equipment: Basketball, Soccer, Hockey, Tennis)
We accept physical donations for Arts (Computers, Tablets, Tables, Chairs, Studio equipment-Mics, Guitars, Turntables, ALL INSTRUMENTS  .  Use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the dreams!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
About Mark and the project:

I've been making music for a very long time.  (My first studio gig was in 1967, at age 5 - a spoken word part on a single that actually got released. )

I've made music of all kinds... Folk, Rock, Blues, Punk, Techno, Long-form instrumental and more. I've sung or played on albums and projects by a whole boatload of other folks, and even released some of my own stuff, which was very well received*.

Now, my Born Wired album is here.  I have devoted five years and much effort towards it, and it's the best rock and roll I've ever made - so I'm putting the same effort into making sure it really gets out there. 

That's not just important for this album - but also for the music I make in the future  (I already have two other albums underway!)

What I Need To Make This Happen...

Making an album is more than just playing, recording and mixing.  There are a whole bunch of other costs involved, including:

  • Manufacturing, printing, shrink-wrap and delivery of the actual discs and booklets
  • Digital distribution, so folks can get the album from the major online services
  • Promotion (to get the word out to podcasts, magazines, music blogs and websites), licensing (there are three cover songs on the album that have to be licensed) and copyrighting
  • Merchandise and shipping
  • Making a second, and possibly third, video to promote the album. (I've already made one video on my own dime, which will be released shortly before the album actually comes out.) 

I have shopped around to get the highest quality at the most reasonable price for each of these items, including shopping locally whenever possible. 

The cost to accomplish all of this is $5000.00.  Here's how it breaks down:

What You'll Get!

For me, the neatest part (besides getting it out there) is the things I get to share with you as part of this campaign.  I designed most every one of them.

The Born Wired album

If you get the digital download, you'll get some great music, a PDF of the artwork and booklet, and a little piece of my heart. If you get the CD, you'll get the album with an 8-page color booklet and a digital download.

The Born Wired t-shirt

This shirt is so cool that I can't wait to get one myself!  It's a very high-quality Gildan brand shirt with a big Born Wired logo on it, printed right here at Antilogy in Kingston, NY.

MJC Ironworks Strings

 

MJC makes awesome strings... they've been selling bass strings, which come in a very cool tin, for years now, and they have a devoted following (I'm one of their followers, for sure.) 

Well, they're starting to make guitar strings as well, and they've kindly offered to make a very limited-edition Born Wired set of guitar strings just for this campaign - and I get to design the packages!  I'm very touched that they believe in me that much. 
So you can get either the bass or the guitar strings - or both.

Born Wired stickers

Yep - two vinyl peel and stick Born Wired stickers!

MM Picks!!!

No kidding.  I custom ordered my own picks - they are lightweight picks, which help me prevent breaking strings when I play live (I used to break a lot of 'em 'til I switched.)

Credits on the album and video

Various levels of contribution here will get you a printed thanks or an executive producer credit on the album, or a thanks on the videos!

Listening party

I'm throwing a live listening party for the release of the album.  If you're in the NY/NJ area, you can attend, or participate online.

Handwritten Lyrics

There are a very limited number of these.. 'cause they're the actual sheets I wrote the lyrics on when I was hammering all of this out.  Sorry for the cross-outs - and the bad handwriting. :)

Cameo in the video

Yep - you'll appear in the next music video for Born Wired!  You'll either have to get to the New York area to participate, or we'll figure out another way to get you in. 

One of my GUITARS

Seriously.  This isn't a cheap copy I bought to give away for this campaign - it's really one of the guitars I used to make the album.  It's a deep blue first-generation Fender Squier Stagemaster, with a reverse headstock and a locking Floyd Rose tremelo - they are pretty hard to find (I searched for it for about 6 months before finding it), and even when you do, they don't all play nicely, and some have been beaten pretty badly.  This one plays like a dream, and one lucky person will get to live with it. 

I'll be just a little sad to say goodbye to it, but more than happy to see it go to someone who is willing to help me make all this happen.

(FYI - the marks on the body in that picture are sweat and finger oil, and have since been removed.  I'll be happy to put some back for whomever gets it, if desired.)

Deliverable dates:

The New Jersey plant where I'm getting the CDs made has a three-week turnaround, which doesn't include shipping time to me, or shipping time from me to you.  So the items will be delivered to contributors within 5 weeks of the end of the campaign!

If I don't meet my goal:

Now if I don't meet my goal, I'll still get whatever funds are raised.  If that happens, I'll restructure the budget to order smaller amounts where necessary, and re-budget the promotional and video costs as well.  But I am getting this album out there.

How You Can Help (besides contributing!)

I need help getting the word out. If you could share this campaign on Facebook, on Twitter or with friends, it'd go a long way towards achieving my goal - to make more music!  You can use the Indiegogo sharing tools on the top right hand corner of this page (the circles right underneath the amount raised) to do that!

Thank you for taking the time, and for supporting my project!

 

* some of what they said about my previous recordings:

"If you’re content with the current musical status quo, don’t buy this album. This album is NOT a rehash of “the industry’s” bottom line. Or an attempt to jump a genre bandwagon. This is Music! Sorely missed Original Music. It is a rich, eclectic mix, crossing borders and redefining creativity. A musical portrait for the ears. The production and engineering are first rate – and as creative as the music itself. Buy this album, pop in the earbuds, and be prepared to lose yourself in this truly rich experience."

"Everything – I mean everything you hear on this…is Mark Marshall. Man – what a great album. I’m thrilled to be adding this to our rotation. I’ve actually had a tough time here…we have a rule of thumb at the station on how many songs we can put in from a particular artist…There are nineteen songs on this CD – I would probably play at least 17 of ’em on our station – and actually, I’d play the other two, too."

“It was not only fantastic on the first listen…it grows in your heart and soul. Nice, real nice!!!! When is the next release?”

story:
(Abajo para español)

Our History and Vision

Elena & Los Fulanos is a bilingual folk rock band based in Washington, DC since 2011. Influenced by front-woman Elena Lacayo’s experience growing up in two cultures (Nicaraguan and American) we make music that ranges from twangy, heartbreak-themed folk Americana, to soothing, introspective, violin-infused Latin rock. Thanks to the generous support of people like you, we were able to release our first album (Miel Venenosa) in 2014 which earned a Washington Area Music Association (WAMMIE) nomination for Best Latin Recording! Since then we've toured Nicaragua (Elena's home country) and the US and played some amazing shows including the Kennedy Center's Millennium Stage in November!!! 

We've learned a lot since our last album and are so excited to invite you to join us again in helping us make our second studio album possible. In this album, Elena & Los Fulanos  -- Elena Lacayo (vocals, guitar, marimba), Danny Cervantes (violin, ukulele), and Andrew Northcutt (percussion, drums, guitar) -- will build off of our growth as a band to bring you songs in more Latin and American genres including rumba, bossa nova, son nica, cumbia, R&B, and folk.

Working with the Best

We're excited to share that we will once again get to work with the extraordinary, Grammy-award-winning recording engineer Charlie Pilzer and his awesome team at Airshow Mastering in Takoma Park, MD. We're also looking to work with a number of special guest musicians to expand our sound and bring greater depth to our songs. Your contributions to this campaign will go towards paying for:

  • Studio Time. Including recording, editing, and mixing.
  • Fairly Compensating Musicians. They work hard and deserve it.
  • Audio Mastering. The necessary (and somewhat magical) process of preparing songs into a final mix and putting them into a form that can be distributed and printed.
  • Printing Physical Albums. Including CDs and VINYL!
  • Graphic Design. Of the album, the merch, and associated branding.
  • Publicity. So we can reach a broader audience and expand our opportunities. *

We also believe that this is the right time for this album. During the last year, we've noticed that voices against diversity and inclusion have made their way into the mainstream and have made our mission -- to use music, language, and tradition to enhance appreciation for diversity in an increasingly multi-cultural world -- even more relevant to the health of our communities. We will continue in our tradition to continue to make art that addresses issues of concern to our communities, as we did in the video for our song, "Amor Migrante."

Risks & Challenges

Recording an album is really hard work and requires tons of time, effort, persistence, and dedication. We learned a great deal from our first album and are confident that we can put together an even more polished product that you'll be proud to support! We are excited to learn more about vinyl production with our second album, but know that challenges and/or delays could arise given that it is a more involved and tedious physical process than CD printing. We will keep you informed about our progress every step of the way!

Spread the Word!

Even if you can't contribute monetarily to this project, you can definitely help spread the word to your friends and family through Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, email, and even human conversation. So please do! After you donate, you can use IndieGogo's sharing platform to tell your friends. 

We are humbly grateful for any and all of what you can give. Thank you so much for your support!

* We didn't want to bore anyone with the details, but if you want a further breakdown of the estimated costs, we're happy to provide them. Just send an email to info@elenalosfulanos.com.

----

Nuestra Historia y Visión

Elena & Los Fulanos es un grupo de rock folklórico bilingüe basado en Washington, DC. Desde 2011 hemos creado música que exhibe calidades tomadas de música “folk” norteamericana hasta rock en español.  Reflejando la experiencia de nuestra cantautora, Elena Lacayo, quien creció entre los Estados Unidos y Nicaragua, Elena & Los Fulanos crea música que mezcla el idioma y la cultura para ayudar a apreciar un mundo cada vez más multicultural. Gracias a la generosidad de personas como usted, pudimos producir nuestro primer disco titulada Miel Venenosa en 2014 la cual fue nominado por un premio "Wammie" para mejor grabación Latina. Desde entonces hemos estado de gira por Nicaragua y los Estados Unidos tocando grandes escenarios como el Centro de Artes Escénicas John F. Kennedy.

Hemos aprendido muchísimo desde el lanzamiento de nuestro primer disco y los queremos volver a invitar a que se unen a nuestros esfuerzos para hacer un segundo disco de música original bilingüe en  la cual le traemos canciones en más géneros latinos y americanos incluyendo rumba, bossa nova, son nica, cumbia, R&B, y folk.

Trabajando con los mejores

Estamos emocionados de anunciar que de nuevo estaremos trabajando con el talentoso Charlie Pilzer, ganador de premio Grammy, y su equipo en Airshow Mastering en Takoma Park, MD. También esperamos poder tener músicos invitados especiales que podrán traerle más vida a nuestras canciones. Su contribución a esta campaña será usada para pagar para los siguientes gastos:

  • Tiempo en el estudio. Esto incluye grabación y edición.
  • Pago para los músicos. 
  • Masterización. 
  • Impresión de discos y vinilos. 
  • Diseño gráfico. De los discos, la mercadería, y la publicidad asociada.
  • Publicidad. *

También reconocemos que en este momento histórico es importantísimo seguir con nuestra misión de crear música que promueve la unión de las culturas y que abortan temas de justicia para la comunidad como lo hicimos en nuestro video de "Amor Migrante."

Retos y riesgos

La grabación de un disco toma muchísimo trabajo, tiempo, dedicación, y esfuerzo. Aprendimos muchísimo en la grabación del primer disco y estamos confiados que podemos hacer un disco que estará satisfecho de haber apoyado. El único aspecto que se nos hace un poco difícil será la impresión del vinilo, ya que es un proceso más tequioso y complicado. Pero si tenemos algún problema, les avisaríamos con tiempo!

Difundir la palabra

Si no pueden apoyar este proyecto de forma monetaria, aún nos puede apoyar diciéndole a sus amigos en Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, o en la vida real! Después de donar puede usar el menú de IndieGogo que lo hará fácil para decirle a sus amigos y familia.

Estamos humildemente agradecidos de cualquier apoyo que nos pueda brindar. Muchísimas gracias por su apoyo!

* No queríamos aburrirlos a todos con los detalles de la cotización de este disco, pero si quisiera más detalles sobre cómo se usaría el dinero, le puede mandar un correo a info@elenalosfulanos.com.

story:
Hi everyone,

I’m proud to introduce you to my new musical project!

I’ve just written 7 new pieces for string quartet and saxophone, illustrating the 7 imaginary worlds of the Japanese Butoh dance.

The recording in studio will take place at the Bunker Studio in Brooklyn on September 26th.

Then, we will be premiering this project “Magma” at the Triad Theatre in Manhattan on October 4th.

This show will combine music and dance. Indeed, a Butoh dancer will be illustrating with dance the music played live.

I am allowing myself to ask for your help to finance this project: to pay the musicians, the dancer, the recording studio and the production of the record.

I hope you will be sensitive at my request and, to thank you, I will send you a copy of the record as well as a ticket to attend the show on October the 4th at the Triad Theatre or at one of the shows during the European tour I dream about organizing in 2017.

Thank you so much for your time and thank you in advance for your support!

Julien

story:
Who are we:

Sunday wilde and Reno Jack : We are an old style roots and blues duo, with six albums released over the past six years. Sunday's last album included a duet song called "One of These Days" and the popularity of the tune by listeners and fans prompted us to consider a duet album, which will be recorded in Toronto and include some classic covers by Patsy Cline, Howlin Wolf, Ruth Brown and more. 

Sunday has won numerous awards for her unique songwriting and vocals including 2x Independent Music Awards Best Blues Song Voters Choice, 2x Winner of the Best International Blues Release on Blues411, Winner of the ISC Blues Song and many more most notably hitting #1 on Siriuxm Radio and Blueberries & Grits (2016) sat on the Grammy Ballot. Hitting #1 on numerous radio charts including Acoustic Album for the Roots Music Report and more. http://www.sundaywilde.com/

Reno has been playing country blues and rockabilly for over four decades most notably as a bass player and band leader for many bands including The Jack Family, Handsome Ned and most recently partnering with Sunday. Reno's debut album titled Lightnight Fried hit the top ten Mexico.

So we are ON tour in January leaving Northern Ontario and heading to Ottawa, Montreal, Ottawa and the area for a number of shows and are showcase artists at the Blues Summit, and we will be recording the new album LIVE off the floor in Toronto at a previous Bean Sprout Factory near China Town with The Jack Family. After the recording we head to Memphis where Sunday has also been invited to Sun Studios to guest on James Buddy Rogers new album so we have a lot of travelling and expenses coming up.

Winter Tire Tread Tour—2017

January 5—Oh So Good Coffee House, Westboro, ON

January 7—Hard Stone Grill, Kemptville ON

January 10—The Barfly, Montreal QC

January 13—The Spitfire Grill, Brockville, ON

January 14—Utopia Hall, Utopia, ON

January 15—Station Coffee House, Brantford, ON

January 16– Gate 403, Toronto, ON

January 17—Cinecycle, Toronto, ON w The Terror of Toronto Shiela Gostick

January 18/19—Recording, Toronto, ON

January 20/22—Showcase at the Blues Summit, Toronto, ON

January 31—Kings Palace, Memphis—VARIETY  Acoustic Blues Showcase

  Watermelon Slim, Gary Vincent, Mandy Lemons & Sturgis Nikides, More TBA

 

We are hoping our Friends, fans and family can help us out on our continued musical journey. We set some perks up but if there are any other ideas let us know....

What We Need

Mostly we need help covering the hotel rooms for approximately 21 nights, that's a lot of hotel room costs. Thankfully we do have some friends along the way!

FOOD we are making instant oatmeal for the road, but eating out can add up while away from the kitchen for approximately one month

and mileage (Atikokan to Toronto to Memphis and BACK to Atikokan = 4706 KM or 2924 Miles OH MY That's a lot of GAS. So if we were government employees we might be given .51$ per KM $2400, but sadly we aren't.

That doesn't even start at releasing the DUET album, but getting the first phase of it done (engineering, mixing, mastering etc) we hope to be under 2,000.

We know there are many others asking for help for a wide array of things, issues, inventions, and we hope that one day the pursuit of creating art without many people buying art can be covered by the government or business but that's a whole other issue.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want to or cannot contribute we hope you can share the campaign and better yet go to live shows of emerging artists!!! Support your local venue that hires live music tooo!

Much appreciated!!

story:
I am a family man, locomotive engineer poet, labor singin', songwriter, collector of stories and a student of west african village music. I wear many hats .. 

This project will be my 4th studio recording. My previous work can be found here.  I plan with this recording to add a little bit of all of those things together - to create a sound that represents all the sounds that I have found, on the rails, in the shadows and from my work as a labor activist and railroad worker.

Do It Yourself projects are very time consuming and can be very challenging to complete. I have done 3 that turned out very well, This time, I want to work with many artists and musicians. Being an independent folk artist has its perks, but being independent is not what I want really, I need your help and support. I want to involve as many folks in my work as possible. That is what folk music is all about ... people coming together to create ... 

I am a very excited about this recording. I have collected songs from my travels and have several new original songs that are ready to put on wax! I have two covers that I am going to do .. I can't wait to get started ...

Music and storytelling are my passion. Working with people is something that I love to do. Building community is something that I have always held close to anything I have done .. please consider getting involved in this project with me.

story:
We are Ultrea

It is our goal to make music that MATTERS. We know that music speaks to humans on an emotional level. Music with passion, encouragement, and drive can awaken a fire within us. It is a fire we wish to share with the world. 

  • We are a hard rock 5 piece from southern Wisconsin.
  • We have created this campaign to create our 3rd Studio EP. But more importantly to involve as many people as interested in building it together
  • This will be our biggest and best yet of Ultrea with more music, more perks, and more fun to share.

The Goal... $5000

In a nutshell? Recording costs. Time is money. Every contribution, pre-order, and perk claimed literally buys us time in the studio. The quicker we reach our goal the sooner the music hits your earholes. We've gone the route of recording ourselves for our 1st EP "Always Persevere" but have since found a home away from home in Madison's Megatone Studios.  There we created our 2nd EP "Forever Ascending" the result was an incredible step in the forward direction. We will be returning to start work on EP #3 this winter. We know exactly what we have to do to get new music into your hands and are ready to get started, but to do that as quickly as possible WE NEED YOU!

Choose from perks like...

 Being the FIRST to get the new record - Tshirts and merch packs exclusive to this campaign -  Video access during recording sessions  - Be a guest vocalist on one of our tracks - Party with the band - Free access to live performances - even a house show in your honor. 

We tried to come up with fun, interactive, and important perks to choose from.

If we EXCEED our goal, the extra funds will be used to aid in the distribution and reach of the release, for touring, special features, and more.

If we do not meet our goal, we will still soldier on and get the New EP out as soon as humanly possible. 

We're in this together

As humans we know from history that divided we fall, but united WE RISE. Join us in the victory of completing our 3rd release and the experience of building it together. 

We all feel struggles, loss, courage, hope, and love. This is what you can expect to feel when you listen to the newest Ultrea music. 

The reality is...

We are not funded by a label, corporate sponsors, or have endorsement contracts. Everything we do is built by our blood, sweat, tears and love for our fans, and humanity. The same love we have to support our families: spouses, significant others, children (future world changers), friends, bandfam, and fur babies. 

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE SHARE SHARE: We are all connected and though you may not be in a place to contribute, I bet you know someone who might. Tell a friend, Indidegogo share, Facebook, Twitter, Google +, email, text, street sign, billboard.... woah, got carried away but you get the idea ;)

Stay connected: let us know what you think, where you are, what you want out of life. Life is a team sport and all are welcome in the Ultrealienation.

THANK YOU!

www.facebook.com/ultrea

www.reverbnation.com/ultrea

www.ultrea.bandcamp.com

@ultreaband on twitter

@ultrea on instagram

ultrealienation@gmail.com

MORE ABOUT THE MUSIC AND US...

Ultrea is a hard rock band from Madison, WI. We are a band that seeks to bring more positivity into our world. You can expect heavy pummeling to light and beautiful riffs, mixed with harmonic vocals and expressional screams. All in hopes to awaken the soul and to make people feel again. Our world has become full of burden and dishonesty, and we hope to make a lasting change in the people who listen to our message. 
Our influences range anywhere from Top 40 rock, to post hardcore metal to ambient soundscapes. We write our music to be dynamic and relatable. To pull you in and make you feel again. This can be heard on our previously released E.P. 's Always Persevere and Forever Ascending. Both releases are streaming on Spotify and www.ultrea.bandcamp.com and can also be purchased on iTunes, Amazon, Google Play and many more online retailers.d
Ultrea means, to always persevere. And this is what we strive to do as a band, despite life's many obstacles. Our goal is to create and share our music with positive messages as far and wide as possible. We have been compared to bands such as Lacuna Coil, Evanescence, Halestorm and In This Moment. We have been fortunate to have opened for many great acts already. Bands like Sevendust, Lacuna Coil, Hed PE, In This Moment, Wicked Wisdom, CAVO, Another Lost Year and many more! 
The band was started in March of 2012, and hasn't slowed down since! Ultrea is Jen (Lead vocals) Greg (Lead guitar) Jason (Bass) Bryan (Drums) and Kyle (Rhythm guitar).  You can get our current releases on all online retailers. And you can follow us on most all online sites! We will see you soon! ALWAYS PERSEVERE ~Ultrea

Special thanks to Luke Drury for filming. There were a lot of peoples talents used in the making of our video, very talented photographers, and we are happy to share their gift. 

In order of photo appearance. 

Jon Ferris www.facebook.com/ferris.b.photography

James Tesmer www.teheproductions.com

Michael Brooks www.michaelbrooksphotography.com

John Payne www.payneproductions.com

Lauren Ruth www.facebook.com/laurenruthphotography

Bob Good www.facebook.com/bobgood67

Steve Porter www.facebook.com/shootstuff2207

Brittany Kreutzer www.facebook.com/BrittanyKreutzerPhotography

Doug Alan www.facebook.com/doug.alan.545

Chris Wurtinger CW snaps www.facebook.com/CWSnaps

Thank you to Elizabeth Wadium of E Wadium Productions for the "Through the Ashes" Video located in the Gallery Tab.

story:
Descripció del projecte

Aquest projecte consta de dos videoclips del primer disc de la cantant Txell Sota. El primer, ja rodat, canta a la connexió amb la nostra essència, amb allò que és únic i singular en cada ésser humà. Parla d’aturar-nos i escoltar quins anhels tenia el nostre nen petit, aquell pel qual TOT era possible. Quina passió ens guiava la nostra voluntat. I parla, sobretot, del coratge de mirar endins i de vèncer la por de ser qui som. Que mai és tard per ser lliures, fugint dels automatismes i de l’estandardització. Canviant la Pell canta i reivindica l'originalitat, la singularitat i la possibilitat de tornar a somiar per caminar. 


La Campanya

Com molts sabreu Indiegogo és una plataforma de Crowfunding on la gent que confia en un projecte pot fer aportacions i ser mecenes a canvi d'unes recompenses. Encara que el videoclip Canviant la pell ja està rodat, ens falta una petita ajuda per acabar la postproducció, és a dir, el muntatge, color i alguns efectes. Hem pensat fer aquesta campanya per poder finançar la postproducció del vídeoclip i, a més, aprofitar i destinar l'altra part a fer un altre videoclip d'una altra cançó de la cantant Txell Sota. Al no tenir un suport econòmic extern, però si moltes ganes de fer peces audiovisuals amb sensibilitat i que facin pensar, creiem necessari l'ajuda de tots vosaltres per treure endavant un segon videoclip amb la mateixa filosofia i el mateix equip. Gràcies a la vostra ajuda podrem seguir fent coses que inspirin, enamorin i facin reflexionar. 

Memòria de la cantant

Ja feia temps que escrivia lletres que buscaven ser cançons.

Guiada per un seguit de ‘casualitats necessàries’ van aparèixer els compositors Pepo Domènech i Miquel Roldán, teixint melodies amb sentiments, filant cançons.

He tingut la sort de comptar, també, amb uns grans músics que es van posar al servei de paraules, sons i melodies noves. Cadascú d’ells va aportar la seva sensibilitat.

Necessitava, però, que algú li donés coherència, que entengués quin so havia de protagonitzar el disc. I aquí és on vaig buscar al productor Èric Vinaixa. Va cuidar cada vibració, trobant un estil final molt proper al so que jo tenia dins del cor.
A tooots, moltes gràcies pel viatge!!!!

I llavors va arribar el director de Canviant la Pell, Txetxu García, amb tota la seva empenta, gosadia, il·lusió, temeritat... i va fer fàcil el difícil. Vam sumar pors i inseguretats i va sorgir la força i la inspiració.
Ha estat un rodatge de tres dies màgic!!!! Aquells regals per l’esperit que et fan sentir molt viva! Hi ha vivències que les paraules no són suficients per explicar.

Gràcies a tots per perdre’ns en el món de la fantasia i la imaginació!!!!!


Memòria del director

Quan la Txell es va reunir amb mi i em va dir que volia que jo fos el director del videoclip de la seva cançó, vaig pensar: Està igual de boja que jo. Em vaig posar a escoltar les cançons i va haver una en concret que em va cridar molt l'atenció: “Canviant la pell”. Aquesta cançó em va transportar a un altre món, un món de somnis on has de deixar enrere el passat i centrar-te en el present per canviar el futur. La sensibilitat que tenia aquesta cançó parlava de canvis, de lluitar, de no tenir por i de buscar-se a un mateix. Ho veia tot molt clar en el meu cap, però necessitava ser transmesa a un llenguatge universal perquè arribés el missatge a tothom. Així doncs, em vaig posar a treballar en una idea molt visual i metafòrica que pogués entendre tothom. Volia que les persones de qualsevol país i de qualsevol nacionalitat, en veure aquest videoclip, es poguessin sentir identificats i els fes reflexionar sobre el seu JO interior. Que es preguntessin si estan a gust amb la vida que porten o s’han de replantejar coses per fer un canvi. 

El videoclip – igual que la cançó- parla de l'aclaparament quotidià en una societat d'estrés. Parla del caos i de l'ordre, del passat, del present i del futur. Parla del nen que tots tenim dins, de les metes a complir, dels somnis i de l'amor. I ,en definitiva, parla de la vida. D'una vida perduda o d'una vida per trobar. De perdre's i de trobar-se.


Equip

Director – guionista.
Txetxu Garcia (1993). Va estudiar producció audiovisual en l’ EMAV. Ha dirigit l'anunci viral contra la violència domèstica No te hagas el sordo(2014), l'Espot Be the hero (2016), l'Espot Octocamvision (2015),els curtmetratges Plato Estrella (2015) i Fora de Camp (2015). Canviant la pell és la seva sisena peça com a director. 
A més, ha estat en l'equip de producció de les pel·lícules Tercer Grado, dir. Geoffrey Cowper (2014), Tu y Yo, dir. Kike Maillo (2014),Anacleto, Agente secreto, dir. Javier Ruiz Caldera (2014), A monster calls, dir. J.A Bayona (2015), El Elegido, dir. Antonio Chavarias (2015), Rumbos, dir. Manuela Moreno (2015) les sèrie Cites (2015) i Se quien eres (2015). 

Actors: Txell Sota, Maria Sota, Lluis Cadafalch, Guillem Cadafalch, Ericksson De Freitas, Montse Olalla, Gloria Gimenez.
Aj Direcció: Ferrán Ureña 
2 Aj. Direcció: Ana Bear 
Aux. Director: Javi Carreras 
Script: Aina Segui 
Director de Producció: Jose Parcerisa
Ajudant de Producció: Elisabeth Lorda 
Auxiliars de producció: Nadia Salmerón, Santi García, Txema Serrano, Marta Parcerisa
DoP: Guillem Tramullas
Foquista: Joan Tous 
Aux. càmera: Violeta Octavio 
Gaffer: Albert Cantallops 
Elèctrics: Andrea Cardozo Yago Ruiz i Jaume Muntada 
Maquilladora: Mariate Pascual 
Director d'Art: Blai Carriet 
Ajudant d'Art: Josep Vicenç
Cap de so: Asier Santx 
Making of: Eduardo Vega i Pere Cots 



Per a què és el finançament?
Meta 1: 915$ (800 €) 
Si arribem al primer objectiu, els diners s’utilitzaran per acabar el videoclip de Canviant La Pell. Els 800 euros cobreixen les despeses de muntatge, laboratori de color, mescles finals i les despeses de la campanya de crowfunding. 
Meta 2: 4003$ (3500 €)
Si aconseguim el 100% del primer objectiu, destinarem el que aconseguim del segon objectiu a la realització d'un altre videoclip amb una altra cançó del mateix disc. Si aconseguim part o la totalitat del segon objectiu, aconseguiríem cobrir part de les següents despeses:
- Càmera, il·luminació i maquinària de rodatge.
- Segur de rodatge.
- Catering i despeses de transports. 
- Localitzacions.
- Material d'art ( atretzzo i vestuari)
Meta 3: 6289$ (5500€)
Amb aquest últim objectiu, a part de poder realitzar un videoclip amb una excel·lent qualitat, podríem destinar una part dels diners a pagar simbòlicament a tot l'equip que ens va acompanyar en el primer videoclip i que volem que ens acompanyi en el segon. Va ser un equip meravellós i sensible, i es mereix les millors condicions per part nostre.

Sabem que és una quantitat alta de diners, però si entre tots vosaltres doneu un cop de mà, podrem treure endavant dos videoclips genials que ens traslladaran a altres dimensions i podrem sentir dins nostre les cançons d'una cantant amb una sensibilitat especial. No és gens fàcil per a una cantant que treu el seu primer disc poder finançar un videoclip; Per això us necessitem!

Com pots col·laborar

• Escollint una recompensa i el valor que vulguis aportar com a mecenes;
• Divulgant la pàgina del projecte a Facebook, Twitter i altres xarxes socials, convidant a amics i familiars teus a participar. Mai se sap!

Recompenses

A l'hora de col·laborar, rebreu una o més recompenses depenent de la vostra aportació. Les recompenses són:
- Sortir als agraïments del videoclip. Si la vostra col·laboració es realitza abans de mitjans de maig sortireu tant en el primer videoclip com en el segon. Les aportacions que es facin a partir de la segona quinzena de maig, sortirán en els crèdits del segon videoclip. 
- El disc en format digital. A totes les recompenses on estigui el disc digital, se us facilitará un link per poder-lo descarregar gratuïtament. 
- Una postal amb una imatge del videoclip, que estarà firmada i dedicada per la cantant i el director. 
- Una tassa amb un disseny especial i que hi figuraran frases escrites de les cançons del disc.
- El disc físic firmat i dedicat per la cantant. 
- Dues entrades per venir a un concert en directe de la cantant. 
- Venir al rodatge del segon videoclip i estar a costat del director i de la cantant.
- Ser productor oficial del videoclip.
- Concert privat:
Opció 1: Concert privat a una casa o a un local. Aquest concert serà en acústic i     només amb la cantant. 
Opció 2: Concert privat a una casa o a un local. Aquest concert serà amb tots els integrants de la banda. 
A l'hora d'escollir un paquet de recompenses veureu que us entren diverses recompenses esmentades. Escolliu la que més us agradi i a gaudir!!!

Calendari

- Finals de juny/inicis de juliol: Producció del videoclip La Reina del Caos.
- Juliol/Agost: Rodatge del videoclip La Reina del Caos.
- Septembre: Estrena del videoclip Canviant la pell i entrega de recompenses a tots els que hagueu col·laborat. 
- Octubre: Estrena del videoclip Reina del Caos.
story_txt:
Descripció del projecte


Aquest projecte consta de dos videoclips del primer disc de la cantant Txell Sota. El primer, ja rodat, canta a la connexió amb la nostra essència, amb allò que és únic i singular en
cada ésser humà. Parla d’aturar-nos i escoltar quins anhels tenia el nostre nen
petit, aquell pel qual TOT era possible. Quina passió ens guiava la nostra
voluntat. I parla, sobretot, del coratge de mirar endins i de vèncer la por de
ser qui som. Que mai és tard per ser lliures, fugint dels automatismes i de
l’estandardització. Canviant la Pell canta i reivindica l'originalitat, la
singularitat i la possibilitat de tornar a somiar per caminar. 







La Campanya
Com molts sabreu Indiegogo és una plataforma de Crowfunding on la gent que confia en un projecte pot fer aportacions i ser mecenes a canvi d'unes recompenses. Encara que el videoclip Canviant la pell ja està rodat, ens falta una petita ajuda per acabar la postproducció, és a dir, el muntatge, color i alguns efectes. Hem pensat fer aquesta campanya per poder finançar la postproducció del vídeoclip i, a més, aprofitar i destinar l'altra part a fer un altre videoclip d'una altra cançó de la cantant Txell Sota. Al no tenir un suport econòmic extern, però si moltes ganes de fer peces audiovisuals amb sensibilitat i que facin pensar, creiem necessari l'ajuda de tots vosaltres per treure endavant un segon videoclip amb la mateixa filosofia i el mateix equip. Gràcies a la vostra ajuda podrem seguir fent coses que inspirin, enamorin i facin reflexionar. 


Memòria de la cantant

Ja feia temps que escrivia lletres que buscaven ser cançons.

Guiada per un seguit de ‘casualitats necessàries’ van
aparèixer els compositors Pepo Domènech i Miquel Roldán,
teixint melodies amb sentiments, filant cançons.
He tingut la sort de comptar, també, amb uns grans músics que
es van posar al servei de paraules, sons i melodies noves. Cadascú d’ells va
aportar la seva sensibilitat. 
Necessitava, però, que algú li donés coherència, que
entengués quin so havia de protagonitzar el disc. I aquí és on vaig buscar al
productor Èric Vinaixa. Va cuidar cada vibració, trobant un estil final molt
proper al so que jo tenia dins del cor.
A tooots, moltes gràcies pel viatge!!!!
I llavors va arribar el director de Canviant la Pell, Txetxu García,
amb tota la seva empenta, gosadia, il·lusió, temeritat... i va fer fàcil el difícil.
Vam sumar pors i inseguretats i va sorgir la força i la inspiració.
Ha estat un rodatge de tres dies màgic!!!! Aquells regals per l’esperit que et fan
sentir molt viva! Hi ha vivències que les paraules no són suficients per
explicar. 
Gràcies a tots per perdre’ns en el món de la fantasia i la
imaginació!!!!! 




Memòria del director

Quan la Txell es va reunir amb mi i em va dir que volia que jo
fos el director del videoclip de la seva cançó, vaig pensar: Està igual de boja
que jo. Em vaig posar a escoltar les cançons i va haver una en concret que em
va cridar molt l'atenció: “Canviant la pell”. Aquesta cançó em va transportar a
un altre món, un món de somnis on has de deixar enrere el passat i centrar-te
en el present per canviar el futur. La sensibilitat que tenia aquesta cançó
parlava de canvis, de lluitar, de no tenir por i de buscar-se a un mateix. Ho
veia tot molt clar en el meu cap, però necessitava ser transmesa a un
llenguatge universal perquè arribés el missatge a tothom. Així doncs, em vaig
posar a treballar en una idea molt visual i metafòrica que pogués entendre
tothom. Volia que les persones de qualsevol país i de qualsevol nacionalitat,
en veure aquest videoclip, es poguessin sentir identificats i els fes
reflexionar sobre el seu JO interior. Que es preguntessin si estan a gust amb
la vida que porten o s’han de replantejar coses per fer un canvi. 
El videoclip – igual que la cançó- parla de
l'aclaparament quotidià en una societat d'estrés. Parla del caos i de l'ordre,
del passat, del present i del futur. Parla del nen que tots tenim dins, de les
metes a complir, dels somnis i de l'amor. I ,en definitiva, parla de la vida.
D'una vida perduda o d'una vida per trobar. De perdre's i de trobar-se.




Equip

Director – guionista.Txetxu Garcia (1993). Va estudiar producció
audiovisual en l’ EMAV. Ha dirigit l'anunci viral contra la violència domèstica
No te hagas el sordo(2014), l'Espot Be the hero (2016), l'Espot Octocamvision
(2015),els curtmetratges Plato Estrella (2015) i Fora de Camp (2015). Canviant
la pell és la seva sisena peça com a director. 
A més, ha estat en l'equip de producció de
les pel·lícules Tercer Grado, dir. Geoffrey Cowper (2014), Tu y Yo, dir. Kike
Maillo (2014),Anacleto, Agente secreto, dir. Javier Ruiz Caldera (2014), A
monster calls, dir. J.A Bayona (2015), El Elegido, dir. Antonio Chavarias
(2015), Rumbos, dir. Manuela Moreno (2015) les sèrie Cites (2015) i Se quien
eres (2015). 

Actors: Txell Sota, Maria Sota, Lluis Cadafalch, Guillem Cadafalch, Ericksson De Freitas, Montse Olalla, Gloria Gimenez.
Aj Direcció: Ferrán Ureña 
2 Aj. Direcció: Ana Bear 
Aux. Director: Javi Carreras 
Script: Aina Segui 
Director de Producció: Jose Parcerisa
Ajudant de Producció: Elisabeth Lorda 
Auxiliars de producció: Nadia Salmerón,
Santi García, Txema Serrano, Marta Parcerisa
DoP: Guillem Tramullas
Foquista: Joan Tous 
Aux. càmera: Violeta Octavio 
Gaffer: Albert Cantallops 
Elèctrics: Andrea Cardozo Yago Ruiz i Jaume
Muntada 
Maquilladora: Mariate Pascual 
Director d'Art: Blai Carriet 
Ajudant d'Art: Josep Vicenç
Cap de so: Asier Santx 
Making of: Eduardo Vega i Pere Cots 



Per a què és el finançament?
Meta 1: 915$ (800 €) 
Si arribem al primer objectiu, els diners s’utilitzaran
per acabar el videoclip de Canviant La Pell. Els 800 euros cobreixen les
despeses de muntatge, laboratori de color, mescles finals i les despeses de la
campanya de crowfunding. 
Meta 2: 4003$ (3500 €)
Si aconseguim el 100% del primer objectiu,
destinarem el que aconseguim del segon objectiu a la realització d'un altre

totalitat del segon objectiu, aconseguiríem cobrir part de les següents
despeses:

rodatge.
- Segur de rodatge.
- Catering i despeses de transports. 
- Localitzacions.
- Material d'art ( atretzzo i vestuari)
Meta 3: 6289$ (5500€)
Amb aquest últim objectiu, a part de poder

dels diners a pagar simbòlicament a tot l'equip que ens va acompanyar en el
primer videoclip i que volem que ens acompanyi en el segon. Va ser un
equip meravellós i sensible, i es mereix les millors condicions per part nostre.

Sabem que és una quantitat alta de
diners, però si entre tots vosaltres doneu un cop de mà, podrem treure endavant
dos videoclips genials que ens traslladaran a altres dimensions i podrem sentir
dins nostre les cançons d'una cantant amb una sensibilitat especial. No és gens
fàcil per a una cantant que treu el seu primer disc poder finançar un videoclip;
Per això us necessitem!
Com pots col·laborar
• Escollint una recompensa i el valor que
vulguis aportar com a mecenes;
• Divulgant la pàgina del projecte a Facebook, Twitter i altres xarxes socials, convidant a amics i familiars teus a
participar. Mai se sap!

Recompenses




A l'hora de col·laborar, rebreu una o més recompenses depenent de la vostra aportació. Les recompenses són:

- El disc en format digital. A totes les recompenses on estigui el disc digital, se us facilitará un link per poder-lo descarregar gratuïtament. 
- Una postal amb una imatge del videoclip, que estarà firmada i dedicada per la cantant i el director. 
- Una tassa amb un disseny especial i que hi figuraran frases escrites de les cançons del disc.
- El disc físic firmat i dedicat per la cantant. 
- Dues entrades per venir a un concert en directe de la cantant. 
- Venir al rodatge del segon videoclip i estar a costat del director i de la cantant.
- Ser productor oficial del videoclip.
- Concert privat:

Opció 1: Concert privat a una casa o a un local. Aquest concert serà en acústic i     només amb la cantant. 
Opció 2: Concert privat a una casa o a un local. Aquest concert serà amb tots els integrants de la banda. 
A l'hora d'escollir un paquet de recompenses veureu que us entren diverses recompenses esmentades. Escolliu la que més us agradi i a gaudir!!!

Calendari

- Juliol/Agost: Rodatge del videoclip La Reina del Caos.

story:
Hello, we are the LoBros! A horn band built around two brothers; Christian and Salvador Lopez.  We take different musical styles and genre and blend them together to create a unique and exciting musical experience. We have named our eclectic mix of classical, latin, jazz and funk - Caliente Classical Crossover.

We have our eye on a Grammy and your contribution will go towards helping us to create an award winning album!  Our new album will feature 10 tunes inspired by some of the greatest "classical" music, hottest Latin rhythms and hippest jazz and funk licks.  

We create and play music because we love it and part of the experience is to share our creation with you and hope you love it too.  Our dream is to take Caliente Classical Crossover on the road both in the US and abroad.  The next step to achieving our dream is this new album. With our albums we are able to share our unique style of music, not only with those who can come to a live event but with people all over the world.  

We have already won an award for our tune "Little Symphony" (based off Mozart’s symphony #25 in G minor) and we plan on submitting this new album to the Grammys in hopes of winning best Instrumental album. Your contribution will be helping us make this dream a reality.

We’re raising $7,500 which is the budget for our album. The funds raised will go towards studio time (this includes the recording, mixing and mastering), album art, disc maker fees and distribution. To record our album we are teaming up with our favorite veteran recording engineer, Jim Brady in Tucson AZ who has worked with artists such as Linda Ronstadt and Kenny Rogers.

We have lots of fun perks for you when you contribute from signed CDs, limited edition calendars, and LoBros baseball hats, to Horn-O-Grams, a LoBros original tune written for you, and even a private concert! 

We’re only 3 years old as a band and we have already recorded two albums, performed internationally, and won best instrumental tune from Akademia Music Awards.  We may have big dreams but we also have a lot of drive and focus. Sky is the limit and with your donation we’re going to make history! 

There are always risks and challenges when recording an album especially during the recording and mixing phases.  Because we have recorded 2 previous albums we have a realistic time table and have also added in a cushion for delays and or other unforeseen issues that may crop up during the project.  

Beside contributing, the very best way that you can support us is to share this with your friends and family. 

As always we appreciate all your love and support!

story:
We are making only 100 4xCD mini-vinyl-style box-sets to celebrate 40 releases on Cut Records.

Short Summary

Cut Records is a small subscription-based record label which has been going since 2006. We started with free releases, and shifted to a subscription-based model a few years ago.

Subscribers pay a tiny recurring monthly fee to access our entire catalogue via our website at http://cutrecs.com

Since starting the label I have always wanted to do a physical product, and with our 40th release fast approaching, I thought it would be fun to put together a compilation, showcasing all of our releases so far.

With your help, we can create something to mark the time and effort all of our artists and subscribers have put in, as well as something which will take our artists and label to a new audience, while celebrating our community.

If we were able to fund this release with contributions from subscribers only, I would be especially blown away by the support, and the reality of creating a self-sustainable label would get that little bit closer!

What We Need & What You Get

The actual product and funding goal is quite simple.

  • I want to create a set of 4 vinyl-style CDs. 100 of each.
  • Each will have vinyl-style miniature packing (e.g. a sleeve and an inner-sleeve)
  • I'd also like to try and create a collectable box for each set of 4 to be packaged in too.
If I can make the relatively small funding goal, then I should have enough money to:
  • Press the 100 CDs (x4) and packaging, and have them delivered to me in Riga, Latvia
  • Hand-number and package each set of 4 CDs together into the 100 presentation boxes.
  • Package each box up, and post them all out to those who contributed.
Initially I am inviting subscribers to contribute, so that those who have been helping me sustain the label this long get the first opportunity to secure their copy of the set - and then I'll open the funding up to the public also.

The Impact

Building the Cut Records name, and helping our artists get seen on a wider stage has always been a goal of mine. From free releases to subscription - I want our artists to feel Cut is a platform which will help them get a step closer to wider recognition and success.

With this compilation, I would hope that aside from getting a totally beautiful product that people will *WANT*, we can help build the names of the producers involved, and take the label to the next level.

The compilation will also serve as an excellent showcase of our releases so far, and what we can bring to the table.

If we can encourage people to become subscribers in the process, then it means we can continue to do wonderful things with the label, and push Cut into new territory!

Risks & Challenges

My main concern is building enough to do a 4-disc release here, so there are some fall-backs if we are unable to pull enough funding together.

This is the order of preference:

  1. The 4-disc set, complete with presentation box and stickers.
  2. The 4-disc set, complete with presentation box.
  3. The 4-disc set without presentation box.
  4. A 2-disc compilation in miniature vinyl-gatefold sleeve.
  5. A single CD compilation.
  6. A large digital compilation only.
I hope that we can do better than just a digital release! :)

Other Ways You Can Help

If yo can't afford to help us with this campaign, then perhaps you can still enjoy the music we're releasing by subscribing to Cut for just $2 a month at http://cutrecs.com

If you are a subscriber already, then you might want to consider upping your subscription level to a $5 monthly subscription here.

If you can't subscribe, then perhaps you would like to buy just one of our release from our Bandcamp page.

Thank you!

==

To those about to comment suggesting I use your PR or kickstarter booster campaign nonsense. STOP. Do not bother. I'm already wading knee deep through your crap.

story:
Kingfisher Sky

Kingfisher Sky was founded in 2007 by drummer/songwriter Ivar de Graaf and singer/songwriter Judith Rijnveld.

The music we make is from the heart, with no specific style or genre in mind. You can hear progrock, pop, celtic and classical influences in all our songs.

We have released three albums and an EP thus far: Hallway of Dreams (2007), Skin of the Earth (2010), Arms of Morpheus (2014) and To Turn the Tables (2017). Arms of Morpheus would not have been possible without your help and generosity and we need you once more to make our fourth record a reality!

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

With this campaign we want to raise 9500 euro for the recording, mixing, mastering and promotion of our fourth album.

We have some unique items for you to obtain! Among others:

  • You can get a personalised 30 second jingle
  • We will come and play an acoustic set in your living room (only available for The Netherlands)
  • Unique KS items used on tour like the "Arms of Morpheus" banner

We can make this happen together! Let's make this fourth record the best KS record ever!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

You can help us by spreading the word about this campaign: share it with family, friends, on social media. You have our eternal gratitude!

story:
Seattle acoustic duo, The Alkis, have delivered their sound from the cobblestone streets of Pike Place Market to the rest of the country; they show no signs of stopping. After meeting in high school, singer/guitarist Carly Calbero and singer/drummer Nika Wascher, soon began to experiment and develop their sound together. Since releasing their first E.P. "Bright Eyed Kids" in 2014 they have toured nationally, playing in 19 different states, as well as Canada. Now after two and a half years of sharing their music with the world, they are ready for the next chapter in their music.

 

After two and a half years of constant touring, we now have enough songs for our very first full length album. We have been writing together (for the first time), arranging, and fine tuning an album that we think all of you will really enjoy. Thanks to a few wonderful people, we now have a great space to record our album and the time to do it. We just need your help to get it out into the open. Like everything else we have done, Screen printing t-shirts, making our album packaging, stickers, etc. We have always found a way to create our products with our own hands. We want to do the same with this new album. We want a chance to show you guys what we have learned over the last few years! We want to record, produce, mix, and design our new album all on our own. This is where our Indie Go Go Campaign comes in...Like many recording endeavors, this can be expensive. It is going to require recording equipment such as mics, cables, stands, software, etc., as well as getting the album mastered, and manufactured. After hours of research and years of experience, we have totaled the cost of the album to be $7,000. 

 

Our vision as artists is to create a quality album that you all will love. We want our new music to excite, inspire, move, as well as resonate with each and every one of you. Both of us hope that this new album will show the world just how passionate we are about our music and will maybe even provide an escape for those who need it. Each person who gives to our Indie Go Go Campaign will receive a certain perk depending on the donation amount. We know that we wouldn't be where we are as artists right now if it weren't for each and every one of you. That is why we know we couldn't create this new album without you, and it wouldn't be the same without you all being involved in this process. 

 

Thank you all for supporting our music and taking the time to look at our campaign! You all are what keeps us going!

Cheers,

Nika and Carly

story:
L’Autre Dame is a dark alternative band from Toronto, Canada. Borne from the ashes of it’s predecessor – Alectrona - L’Autre Dame has been playing shows in and around Toronto in various forms since 2013. Every band has its ups and downs, and we have seen many former members come and go. It has been a long and sometimes exhausting process to find the right combination of personalities and creative sensibilities, as well as dedication to advance our music to the next level. It was difficult at times to believe that we would ever find the magic combination needed, however, we have finally attained it,  and have evolved from a bare bones project, into the dynamic assemblance of creative minds we see here today.

 

Our influences range from new wave, to post punk, to synth rock, to gothic rock, and even folk, which has resulted in our own uniquely dark sound. With pounding drums, crunchy guitars, playful bass lines, heavy synths, and hauntingly beautiful harmonies, L'Autre Dame stands apart from the crowd. 

We can't count the many times we've been asked at our shows whether we have music to sell, and up until now, we have sadly been unable to fulfill this request. We're at the point now, where we have honed our sound, and are ready to unleash some of our music to the world, so we began recording earlier this summer. With your help, we will be able to complete the rest of the recording process, as well as mixing and mastering of the album, CD manufacturing, and distribution on various platforms.

 

Our goal is to raise $3000, which will roughly cover the following expenses :

$1000 to cover the costs of studio time

$1000 for mixing and mastering of the tracks

$500 for the first run of 100 CD's

$500 for the distribution of the album

In appreciation of your contributions, we are offering a variety of perk packages at different levels containing various, L'Autre Dame items. Feel free to peruse these packages, as we are confident that there is something here for everyone, regardless of your contribution size! If you see some items that you would like that are in packages you don't want, feel free to contact us and we will do our best to create a custom package for you! For an extra $5, we will also sign the CD's if requested.

** Please note that some packages are offered worldwide with shipping, as well as to Torontonians only with local pickup to save on shipping costs. Please ensure you select the appropriate package. **  

Once we have acquired professional recordings, we will be able to present our material to a wider audience. This will bring a whole new set of opportunities for the band that we have never had before, like booking shows out of town, the possibility of opening for larger bands in our home town, and the ability to send our music to various media outlets, both nationally and internationally.

We realize that not everyone is in a position to make any financial contributions. Whether you are able to contribute or not, you can still help us out even further by spreading the word and increasing our gogo factor in the following ways:

Sharing a link to our campaign on your social media pages, by clicking the share button at the top of this page, or by copying and pasting the following -  https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/l-autre-dame...

Sharing a link to our various pages - www.facebook.com/lautredame

                                                                             www.instagram.com/lautre_dame

                                                                             www.twitter.com/lautre_dame
